loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from San Miguel, Bohol. 

She has engaged in the rice farming business for more than 20 years now. 

Teodula is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Teodula hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 30 years old, male, married with one child, and living in Kasese Uganda. Moses is a butcher and also buys and trades animals in order to earn a living. 

Moses has a dream of educating his children and expanding his business to other centers. However, he is faced with a challenge of high transport and license fees. Moses wants money to buy goats for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase some construction materials such as cement and sand to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
A loan of $700 will help Carlos to send his son to University. 

He hopes that, if he continues his children’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.  

The money will be used to cover educational costs, including textbooks and a backpack for her youngest daughter.

loans.use: To pay for enrollment and school equipment

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 19 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa and has a cocoa garden to supplement what she sells, which she has been doing for three years. 

Sylivia requested a loan, which she will use to buy cocoa to sell. She hopes to rent more cocoa gardens so that she can earn a greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows tea, bananas, and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is a generous woman. She was born in 1983. She is from the northern part of the country. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has four children. She has been in business about fifteen years.

Muhayo plants agricultural produce and keeps livestock. Her husband left in search of a job. She and her husband decided to enlarge their activity and earn more profit. She wants to spend a part of her income for the education of their children. Additionally, they are planning to renovate their apartment. She plans to use another part of her income to enlarge her business. She is asking for support to expand her square of working land and for buying plastic pipe for water.

loans.use: To buy plastic water pipe and expand her square of working land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a businesswoman from the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with two sons. Her husband is in the fishing business. On the other hand, Tita is into a sari-sari store business and hog raising. In her store she sell condiments, snacks, canned food, chips, toiletries and seasoning. Tita is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy to buy feed, canned sardines, beef loaf, vinegar, cooking oil, detergent, candies, bread and soft drinks.

Through her business, she hopes to save for the future, for house renovation and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, vinegar, cooking oil, detergent, candies, bread, soft drinks and feed to keep her hogs healthy

loans.name: Bibinor

texts.en:
Bibinor is patient woman. She was born in 1984. She lives in a village. She is a widow and has one child. She does a business of agricultural produce and keeping livestock. For about fifteen years she has had this business. At the beginning she faced difficulties. Raising a child alone and keeping family is hard for her. 

Bibinor's parents gave her cattle and land as a gift, in order that she could feed her family. Her parents taught her how to keep cattle and plant a crop. Now she does the business by herself. She does well and has big progress in doing business. She is asking for financial support to repair her house as her house is in bad condition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be kind. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy shoe repair materials. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of shoes within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a distributor of fruits and vegetables to supermarkets within five years. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jovanna Esther

texts.es:
Jovanna Esther tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a sus padres en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, de la región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. Es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales, así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría (corrales). Con esto Jovanna Esther espera mejorar la producción de su negocio lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanna Esther, age 30, is single. She lives with her parents in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru’s northern coast. It is a community that devotes itself to agriculture and working with livestock. 

She raises and sells animals.  Her business is located at her house.  She has over eight years of experience in the business, and she has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan she is requesting will be to buy more animals and to make repairs to the place where she raises them (pens).  With this Jovanna Esther hopes to improve production in her business.  This will allow her to increase her level of earnings.  Then she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to make repairs to the place where she raises them (pens).

loans.name: Gradys

texts.en:
Gradys is 32 years old and a single mother with one child. She divorced her husband due to marital problems.

Gradys operates a retail shop in Ibanda town with capital of UGX1,000,000 where she earns a living to support her family. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help her add stock to her business so that she can increase her sales and profit. She will use the rest of the money to pay rent since she has just moved to a new place.

She is a very honest and hard-working woman and is grateful for the financial boost.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in the retail shop (sugar, rice, corn flour, sodas, water)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To furnish the house.

loans.name: Nhóm 4-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Hue, pictured first from the right, is 54 years old and a member of Nhom 4-Khanh An 01 Group. She works in the agricultural sector and earns approximately VND 450,000. Her family is classified as a poor family. 

Due to the lack of funds, her household does not have a sanitary latrine yet. This loan will help Hue build a septic tank latrine, which will improve the family's hygiene and health and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is 36 years old; living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a wood stall in which he sells pieces of wood for fuel. In his area, frequent short fall of cooking gas is a problem, so people like to burn these pieces of wood for cooking. He continues his business at the corner of their residence. 

Sofia's husband wants to increase his current business. Therefore, Sofia, his wife, is requesting a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more pieces of wood for sale. She is thankful to Kiva lenders as well as BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's wood stall business

loans.name: Nhóm 6-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. The, 42 , works in agricultural production and embroidery. Her husband died 10 years ago so she is living with her daughter. They earn a monthly income of about VND 650,000. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2000. 

Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation and they don't have a sanitary latrine yet. With this loan, she will use the funds to build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, The is pictured first from the right, second row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Florenca

texts.en:
A loan of $1,000 is offered to Florenca to improve her business. She is married with two children; her husband is a farmer.

Florenca has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, biscuits, slippers, noodles, oils and sprite. She has been involved in business activities since 2014. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Florenca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fish, biscuits, slippers, noodles, oils and sprite.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por crecer y salir adelante. Ellas están en su ciclo número 15, y trabajan por ir mejorando cada día.
Isidra, una de las integrantes, vende comidas varias, que ella misma hace, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, y se esfuerza siempre por dar la mejor comida a sus clientes. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, jamón, queso, y otros insumos, de manera a poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas y de esta forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are 17 members of the Divino Niño Jesus Group. They are female heads of household who are struggling to grow and succeed. They are in their 15th cycle, and they work to get better every day.

Isidra, one of the members, sells meals that she cooks herself and sells as a street vendor. She is a hardworking woman, starting work very early every day. She is constantly striving to provide the best food to her customers. She wants to keep growing her business, which is why she works so hard.

Isidra is requesting this loan to be able to buy various ingredients for her meals, like vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and others. She wants to be able to continue with the preparation of her meals in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other consumables.

loans.name: Hoạt

texts.en:
Hoạt is 35 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Hoạt works in agriculture, where she farms food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Hoạt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hoạt faces in her life is not having a biogas system, so she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Hoạt hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed, with four children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. Rose lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Rose operates a bar at the market on a retail basis.She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from rental houses. 

Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy jerry cans of local brew, spirits and gin. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and to buy a van to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy jerry cans of local brew, spirits and gin

loans.name: Juan Adolfo

texts.es:
Juan Adolfo tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al transporte, comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi (vehículo), cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, Juan Adolfo presta este servicio en los alrededores de Zaña. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Juan Adolfo espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel ingresos y le va a permitir incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Adolfo, 54, is a widower who lives in his own house in the district of Zaña, in Chiclayo, Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.  He lives in a community where people work in transport, commerce, agriculture and livestock.

He provides a transport service with his motor taxi.  He has been doing this for more than five years and he has built up a good reputation, both on a professional and a personal level.  He works around the Zaña area.  

He is asking for a loan to make some repairs and service his vehicle as it is not in a very good state at the moment.  With this help, he hopes to be able to provide a better service for his customers which will have a positive effect on his income.  This will allow him to improve the standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to repair and service his motor taxi,

loans.name: Bwambale

texts.en:
Bwambale is 32 years old and married, with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He is a teacher by profession who has been in service for three years. He was inspired by the parents to join the profession, after they failed to provide him with school fees for advanced education. 

He has a dream of buying land to settle with his family. However, he faces a challenge of underpayment. 

Bwambale needs a loan to buy land for settlement.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en:
Yeremiya is a married man with four children, living in Kasese Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy cement and bricks for constructing his house.

Yeremiya operates a retail shop for general merchandise; earns a salary and does farming. He grows crops such as maize, rice and others to increase his income.

Yeremiya has a dream of growing his business, however, his challenge is limited capital. He will use the loan to buy salt, rice, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a twenty two year old, divorced woman with two children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is in the business of buying and selling cocoa and fish in Bundibugyo. She loves her business and devotes much energy to it.

She hopes to have a bigger business and to educate her children. She wants a loan to buy cocoa and fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Jesika

texts.en:
Jesika is a thirty year old divorced woman with one child living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She operates a food stall selling tomatoes in her home area. She has managed to look after her children and business very well and is reaping much profit out of it.

She lacks capital to expand her business and for a preserving machine that can reduce the rate of perishability of her products. Jesika will use the loan to buy food stuff to sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuff to sell.

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Panambi está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas forman este grupo con mucho entusiasmo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Beatriz, la presidenta de este grupo, comenta que hace tortas de todo tipo y sobre pedidos, y que gracias a ello está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Beatriz lucha para que cada día vaya mejorando, y es por ello que pone su mejor empeño en crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus tortas, como ser harina, manteca, huevos, azúcar, y otros, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus tortas, y también seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Panambi Group is in their first loan cycle. The group members are all women who work and help each other to succeed. They were excited to form the group, which enables them to help their familes by all working together.

Beatriz, the president of this group, makes all types of cakes by order. In this way, she is able to help her family and loved ones. She struggles every day to better her life, putting forth her best effort to grow. 

Beatriz requests this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for making cakes, such as flour, butter, eggs, sugar and others. In this way she can continue to make cakes and grow her business.

loans.use: buy flour, butter, eggs, sugar and other ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, de la región Cajamarca, de la sierra norte del Perú. Es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de café, caña, maíz, entre otros, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore, tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta su parcela de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas). Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 03 años contando con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Samuel espera mejorar la calidad del café que ofrecerá a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old and lives with his wife and children in a rural area of the Santo Tomás district, located in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in northern Peru. It is a community dedicated to agriculture, farming coffee, sugar cane, corn and other crops, as well as business and raising livestock.

Samuel grows coffee of the Catimor variety. He has agricultural land of his own where he keeps his coffee plot. He also raises and sells cattle. He has been doing this kind of work for three years, relying on his experience and very good personal and working references in the area. The loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain his crops, as well as to contract manual labor for harvesting season. With this, Samuel hopes to improve the quality of the coffee he will sell to his customers, allowing him to increase his income level and consequently improve quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain his crops, as well as to contract manual labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seed and seedlings for their agricultural land.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 32-year-old married mother of nine children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She operates a food stall in Bundibugyo town, selling mainly tomatoes, beans and fish. This has helped her so much in providing basic needs for her family. She hopes of having a bigger business with a permanent address where her customers can easily find her.

Priscilla wants a loan to buy food like fresh beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy food like fresh beans for selling.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 50-year-old widowed mother of four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She works hard in her food stall business to support her family. She hopes to expand her business though seasonality factors affect her expected returns. 

She is requesting a loan to buy food, like tomatoes, to sell

loans.use: To buy more food, like tomatoes, to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 22-year-old married mother of three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Two of her children are attending school and she is paying school fees for them. She is a hard-working woman who loves her business. She hopes to have a bigger business though her major challenge is seasonality.
She will use the loan to buy cocoa and brooms to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and brooms to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a washing machine for the house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: A $1.000 (USD) loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She opened her grocery kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $150. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like beer, soft drinks, eggs, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and body lotion. She is generating a good income from her business. She has been thinking of running a bigger business. She is living in a town with her family. She also raises animals, including five pigs and five chickens.

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, eggs, cigarettes,sugar, salt, milk,biscuits and body lotion.

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer humilde de 34 años de edad, quien desde hace tres años empezó su negocio vendiendo hielo que ella misma hacía en su casa. A medida que pasaba el tiempo ella fue ahorrando y comenzó a vender frutas, hasta estar hasta donde está ahora, con una pequeña pulpería que pudo concretar vendiendo una vaca que tenía. La vida de esta emprendedora mujer ha sido de mucho esfuerzo, ya que ella sola ha salido adelante con sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 19 y 14 años de edad.
Afortunadamente Maribel cuenta con el apoyo de su tío, quien le manda remesas desde Estados Unidos. Ahora está mujer no duda en hacer crecer su pulpería en una gran distribuidora, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su pulpería. Esto le permitirá atender mejor a sus clientes y mejorar su calidad de vida. En sus metas está en convertirse en una gran comerciante para generar más ganancias y así poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34 years old, is a humble woman who began three years ago her business selling ice that she herself made at home. As time went by, she started saving and began to sell fruit, until she got to where she is now: the owner of a small grocery store that she was able to set up by selling a cow she had.

Life for this enterprising woman has required much effort, she on her own has moved forward raising her two children who are now 19 and 14 years old.

Fortunately, Maribel has the help of her uncle who sends her remittances from USA. Nowadays this woman has no doubts about growing her business into a large store.

Maribel is requesting a loan to buy construction materials in order to expand her grocery store. This will allow her to better serve her customers, and improve her quality of life.

Her goals include to become a big shopkeeper so that she can generate more profits, thus being able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, cards and biscuits. She has been involved in her business activities since 2011. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Adelina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, cards and biscuits.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Creciendo Juntas, lleva este nombre ya que ellas se unieron para poder crecer y salir adelante a través del esfuerzo conjunto y unido. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando y esforzándose mucho.
Lidia vende ropas, sabe que es muy sacrificado ya que tiene mucha competencia, pero pese a ello se esfuerza cada día por crecer, ya que quiere dar todo a su familia. Ella comenta que tuvo que pasar por muchos obstáculos, pero que los ha ido superando ya que es una persona luchadora y perseverante.
Lidia pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con todo tipo de prendas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The group is called Creciendo Juntas, and it has this name because these women banded together to grow and move forward through group effort and unity. These women are heads of households who are striving and working hard. Lidia sells clothes, and knows it's tough work because she has lots of competitors. In spite of that, she works every day to expand because she wants to provide her family with everything. She states that she had to overcome many obstacles, but she has been able to get past them because she's hard-working and persevering. Lidia is requesting this loan to be able to stock her inventory with all types of garments, so that she can continue doing her job the way she has been. She's grateful for the opportunity that's being given to her, as it will help her a lot.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Oudom

texts.en: Oudom is a 19-year-old single construction worker who resides with a brother, a sister and an old grandmother in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has worked as a worker since 2013. His brother is also a construction worker and his sister is a student. They can make around $10 per day. Oudom’s present house is old, so he would like a loan to buy pillars and lumber to renovate his house. This loan will help him and his family have a stronger house to live in. In the future, he wants to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy pillars and lumber to renovate his house

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana used the previous loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, cups, and plates to sell. Yohana is a 39-year-old male, married with two children, living in Kasese Uganda. He is still dealing in his business of a mini-supermarket and also earns a salary for supplementary income. He has been in that business for seven years. He maintains his dream of growing his business into a supermarket. However, he meets difficulties of limited capital and poor management. Yohana wants money to buy splash, sodas, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, cups,  and plates to sell.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is 38 years old and lives in Ugac Sur with her family. She is a retail store owner and sells grocery items to the people in her village. She operates her store daily and offers friendly service, too. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and soap to sell. She hopes to continue selling good products and offering good service to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Subha

texts.en: Subha is 28 years old, divorced and has no children. After her divorce, she wanted to rely on herself so she started her simple business selling blankets from her home. Subha wants to increase her income so she plans to expand her business to sell clothes along with the blankets. That would meet her needs and provide some help to her family. She requested a loan to help her buy some clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy some clothes to sell to increase her income.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas de San Antonio, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada ves mas independientes.
La Sra. Juaquina es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Comerciante cuenta con una negocio de venta de productos varios en su casa, este préstamo lo pide para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, panificados, aceites, carnes y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe.
texts.en: The group Mujeres Unidas de San Antonio is from the city of San Ignacio. They're united and committed to solidarity. They work together on tasks, and they state that they are satisfied and feel that the Women's Committee's program is helping them to boost their incomes and become more independent every day. Juaquina is the group's president, and she's a shopkeeper and runs a business selling various products from her home. She's asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her business such as beverages, pastries, oils, meat, and more. She's thankful for the help that she's receiving.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, pastries, oils, meat and more to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 58-year-old married mother of three children and the sole breadwinner of her family. Sixteen years ago she started baking markouk, a type of flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle, known as "saj." Markouk is served with several tasty toppings as the customers may choose, such as thyme, cheese, and many others. This business covers the needs and expenses of her family.
Jamila is a hard worker who has professional skills in her domain, and is known throughout her region for her special tasty markouk. Jamila is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by buying necessary raw materials to satisfy her customers' needs with special markouk tastes.
Jamila hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to develop her business by buying necessary raw materials to satisfy her customers' needs with special markouk (flatbread) tastes

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is 34 years old, single and works as a sidewalk vendor selling boiled eggs and barbecued meat. He is very patient in preparing and cooking foods to sell. Though he only generates minimal income, he still pours out his efforts in providing delicious street foods. He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy eggs and meat to cook and sell. Romeo hopes to improve his income to save funds to use for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy eggs and meat to cook and sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 10-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en: Vui, 60, works as a farmer with a monthly income of about VND 550,000. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1988. Her family is classified as a poor family and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a septic tank toilet. This will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, she is in blue, pictured in the middle of the first row.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with two children, ages seven and thirteen. 

For a year now, Nelly has been selling snacks, such as rice cakes, and fruits, like bananas and mangoes. She is also engaged in farming rice for a living. She earns an average income of PHP 9,000 per month. 

Nelly is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to support her businesses. She will use it to buy fruits to sell, like bananas and mangoes, as well as fertilizer and seedlings for farming. 

Her income will provide a healthy diet for her family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell, like bananas and mangoes, as well as fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Yazan Group

texts.en:
Yazan is a group which consists of four hardworking women from Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 200,000 YER from AMB and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Hefa is a 29-year-old married woman with only one daughter. She has a university education and works with a private institute with a small salary. Her husband has immigrated outside of the country and what he sends to her monthly is not enough to cover the daily expenses of the family. In reality, her house lacks a lot of home appliances and most of them are old. The TV is broken down and it is hard to repair it. Unfortunately, Hefa doesn't have enough money to change it. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a TV for the house.

Hefa hopes to open a saving account in the bank.

loans.use: to purchase a TV for the house.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido de todos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fanni, quien tiene una mercería bien variada donde vende todo tipo de productos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, todo esto gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que siempre tiene todo tipo de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
La Sra. Fanni pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Lucia and is in its 17th cycle within the Committee for Women program, where they all work together to help one another get ahead.  Each one of them puts forth her best effort to grow and help their families by working together.

Fanni is one of the members and she has a shop where she sells all types of products.  She is very hardworking and has been growing little by little, thanks to her effort and hard work.  She says that things are going very well and that she always has all sorts of products to offer her customers.

Fanni is asking for this loan to buy clothing, shoes, general merchandise, and other things so she can continue making sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Señora Angela de joven siendo adolescente vino desde la ciudad de Mbujapey hasta Asunción para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, al llegar empezó a trabajar como empleada domestica en una casa de familia, luego de varios años y con deseos incumplidos de progresar decidió alquilar un local para poner un comedor, siguiendo el consejo de su hermana que se dedicaba en la fabricación y venta de comida. Ya abierto su local de comidas, se dio cuenta que necesitaba ayuda para poder crecer, es por eso que acudió a la fundación paraguaya, y de eso ya hace 5 años.
Hoy en dia ya ha crecido mucho y tiene una clientela bastante numerosa que siempre va a su comedor. Pide este préstamo para la compra de sillas, mesas, manteles y cubiertos para poder mejorar su comedor.
texts.en: Angela came to Asuncion from the city of Mbujapey as a young woman, a teenager, to improve she and her family's standard of living. Upon arrival she started working for a family as a live-in maid, and after several years and unfulfilled dreams of progress she decided to rent a location to set up an eatery. She was following the advice of her sister, who works in the production and sale of food. Once her eatery was open she realized that she needed help to be able to grow, and that's why she turned to the Paraguayan foundation 5 years ago. Now she has expanded a lot and has many customers that always come to her eatery. She's requesting this loan to purchase chairs, tables, tablecloths, and place settings to improve her eatery.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, tablecloths, and place settings to improve her eatery's infrastructure.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 23-year-old single woman from Atteel, a village near Tulkarem city. She lives with her mother alone in a small house. Her mother works in a sewing workshop where she gets a very low income. Malak is a student in a local college. She studies Mechatronics. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job in the future to help her mother with part of the expenses.

Malak took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy the raw materials she needs to build her project. By taking this loan, Malak will be able to graduate and take the BA degree and find a job.

Malak appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials she needs to build her project.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, rollers, treatments, weaves and oils. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to redesign her salon by buying better chairs, hand dryers and towels. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, rollers, treatments, weaves and oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is taking a loan of USD 800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as cement and zinc. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of USD 1,000.  

She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement and zinc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 46 years old from Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. She is married with three children ages 9, 16 and 19. Alicia works hard for her children. She owns a sari-sari store (small convenience store) and also grows vegetables for an income. Alicia needs additional capital to buy more supplies for her store such as shampoo, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, milk and soft drinks. She would like to keep her store fully stocked to accommodate more customers. With her business, Alicia dreams of giving her children a good education. She is also determined to save for old age.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, milk and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas dan todo de sí para poder mejorar sus vidas y las de sus familias.
La señora Aida es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una librería y mercería que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido montando, le gustaría ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de artículos de librería, como también para la compra de artículos de mercería, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this loan group work with different businesses. Each one is giving everything they have to improve their and their families' lives.

Aida is one member of the group. She has a stationery and haberdashery shop that, with a lot of effort, she has built up. Aida would like to continue improving her and her family's living conditions.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy stationery and haberdashery items to sell as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy stationery and haberdashery items to sell.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He is single and a freshman pursuing an associate’s degree in accounting at a university in the city. His parents are farmers who cultivate rice, corn and sesame. His father is also a motorcycle taxi driver. Channy does not have enough finances to pay his university fees from the first to the second year, so he would like a loan. With the loan, he will successfully earn an associate’s degree with skills for his future job. After graduation, he hopes to have a job with a decent salary. He also wants to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado EL AMANECER, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, se ayudan para poder crecer y salir adelante, y por medio de su trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Myrian es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Vendedora de Ropas para Damas, con su trabajo y esfuerzo, mantiene a su familia, y lucha por darles una vida digna. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas para dama, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "El Amanecer" group from the city of San Ignacio is made up on close and supportive woman. Together they help each other to grow and move forward. Through their work they can help one another.

Myrian is the president of this group. She sells women's clothing. Through her hard work and efforts, she supports her family and fight to give them a decent life. Myrian is applying for this loan in order to buy women's clothing. She can then continue working and fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir están con una pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Maribel, una de las integrantes, comenta que es peluquera, tiene un salón humilde, pero que con mucho esfuerzo ha montado, con su esfuerzo y duro sacrificio. Ella solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de peluquería y en la compra de los productos varios que utiliza allí, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Cabe destacar que las integrantes de este grupo han trabajado y logrado unirse más entre ellas, han aprendido a trabajar entre todas para cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" loan group is on its second loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme where everybody works and helps each other in order to get ahead. The members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey, which is showing that two of the group's members are living below the poverty line; this means that they live in extreme poverty.

Maribel, one member of the group, is a hairdresser. She has a humble salon that she has built up with a lot of effort, hard work and sacrifice. Maribel is applying for this loan to invest in her hairdressing business and to buy products that she will use there. This will allow her to realise her business plan, thus helping her to increase her income.

It should be noted that the members of the group have worked hard and become more close-knit. They have learned to work together in order to carry out their duties.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en: Saidat is a fifty-year-old female, widowed with seven children, living in Kasese Uganda. She sells crude salt and also owns a salt pan where she gets income to look after her family. She has been in that business for ten years. She has a dream of having a good family with educated children. However, her challenge is unpredictable weather changes which affects salt production levels. Saidat intends to use the loan to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Francisco está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, es una zona muy alejada de la ciudad, cuentan con caminos pocos transitables, es una comunidad muy olvidada por los municipios en cuanto a los caminos y otros, pero que aun se encuentra en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Margarita  es una de las integrantes, ella al igual que las otras integrantes del grupo se dedica a la cría de animales, también se dedica en la agricultura.  Ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha podido dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de animales para la cría. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en: The group called San Francisco is in its 1st cycle in the Women's Committee's program and hails from the city of Curuguaty, a very remote area that has few passable roads. It's a community that has been largely forgotten by the municipalities in terms of roads and other things, yet it continues to grow. Margarita is one of the group's members, and like the other members she works in animal breeding, and she also works in agriculture. She states that through her job she has been able to provide her loved ones with everything she wasn't able to have. She's applying for this loan to purchase animals for breeding. This way she'll be able to keep growing her business and provide her family with what they need to live a life free of hardships.

loans.use: To purchase animals for breeding.

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Anifa is 28 years old, married and has been blessed with one baby. For the past two years she has run a café where she sells mishkaki, a marinated meat shish kebab, along with soft drinks, sodas, water and juices. Her café is open from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit every month.

This loan will be Anifa‘s second loan through Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva’s partner. She successfully paid back her previous loan, which she used to buy drinks and meat for her cafe. She put her profits toward supporting her family and building her business.

Anifa and her two Beijing members will hold each other accountable for paying back this 1,700,000 TZS group loan. With her portion of the loan she will buy more drinks and meat to sell in her cafe. She believes she can change her living standards for the better through her business.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and meat to sell in her cafe.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, es una zona muy alejada de la ciudad cuentan con caminos pocos transitables, es una comunidad muy olvidada por los municipios.
La Sra.   Zulma es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño trabajo de cría de animales, también se dedica en la agricultura. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que pese a los problemas ha ido creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de animales y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría de los mismos par vender. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named "San Cayetano" is in its first loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, which is in a remote area with roads that are difficult to access. It is a community that has been largely neglected by the municipalities.

Zulma is one of the members of this group. She makes a living breeding animals and also farming. She is a very hard-working woman, who, in spite of the difficulties, has been growing her business and improving her life.

She is requesting a loan to buy animals so that she can breed them to sell them later. In this way, she will be able to keep on growing her business and, thus, give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 36-year-old, married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has two children, ages three and six. 

She is engaged in various items in the market, like cellphone cases, batteries, scissors, hair ties, glue, and padlocks. She also invests in raising hogs for an income. 

Agnes works hard, so she can send her children to school. She is asking for a loan to buy cuticle removers, nail cutters, batteries, combs, mirrors, scissors, lighters, ladies' accessories, and piglets. 

In the future, Agnes would like to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cuticle removers, nail cutters, batteries, combs, mirrors, scissors, lighters, ladies' accessories, and piglets.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Abdalah, 51 years old, is married and has three school-age children. He has been supporting his family for twelve years now by running a gengeduka, a place where he sells fruit, vegetables, cooking oil, sweets, soap, etc. He works from 6:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. a day and makes a fair monthly profit.

This will be Abdalah’s sixteenth loan application with Kiva’s partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He successfully paid back those loans, using them to buy more stock for his gengeduka. He is now able to satisfy more customers with his increased stock. He has used this extra income to pay school fees and home expenses.

Abdalah will share this 2,650,000 TZS loan with his four-member group, Songa Mbele, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He will use his portion of the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for his gengeduka. He dreams of owning a big shop.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for his gengeduka.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana, 41, has a child, and they live with her family. She is a victim of a conservative society's beliefs about a divorced woman. Rana`s family has prevented her from working. Rana wants to be an independent, productive woman and have a social life. She also wants to meet her child's needs. 

Despite all the challenges Rana faces as a divorced woman, she has begun to achieve her dream and her family agreed to let her to work inside the house. She decided to sell women's clothes in her house. She became successful and known in this field. 

She has requested a loan to help her buy more products and clothes to sell, so she can increase her income and improve hr level of life. Then she can meet her son's basic needs and pay for his education.

loans.use: to buy more products and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virgencita Azul De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgencita Azul de Caacupe está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción.
La Sra.  Mirna es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa donde vende todo tipo de productos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una forma muy honesta.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser: verduras, panificados, frutas, enlatados, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgencita Azul de Caacupe" is in its first loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  This group meets in the city of Concepcion.  

Mirna is one of the members of this group.  She has a store where she sells all types of products.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who starts work each day from the early morning hours.  This honest form of work is how she earns a living.  

Mirna is requesting a loan to buy products for her store, including: vegetables, bakery goods, fruit, canned goods, drinks, and other items.  This way she can continues with her sales.  She is grateful to be receiving this opportunity that will enable her to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres luchadoras, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, son 19 mujeres muy trabajadoras, y por sobre todo muy luchadoras, que se unieron para poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias.
Norma es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es la presidenta, una mujer muy entusiasta que pone todo lo mejor de si para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella vende joyas variadas que después sale a vender, tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas, como ser cadenas, anillos, pulseras y demás, de manera a poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" is from the city of Lambaré,.  The group includes 19 hardworking and tenacious women who unite to work together to find a way to help their families.

Norma is a member of this group.  She is the president, and is a very enthusiastic woman who gives her all to be able to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.  Norma has a business selling jewelry. She has many customers who constantly make orders with her.

Norma is requesting this loan to buy a variety of jewelry, including: chains, rings, bracelets, and other items.  This way, she can fulfill her customers' orders.  She is grateful to be receiving this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding.

Because the weather this year has not been favorable, the coffee harvest has been less productive. After deducting all costs, she is saving the remaining income she has to spend in order to have enough to cover the family’s living expenses. Meanwhile, she wants to buy fertilizer for coffee, but she doesn't have enough money. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee.

She will find an extra job to work to earn money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and is hoping that the loan amount will assist her family to invest well in the next coffee crop, so that it will bring a high yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a mini shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts and children's wear. She opened her mini shop in 2000 with her own working capital of $400.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.  Her husband is a teacher. She also has four pigs.

loans.use: To buy  shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts and children's wear

loans.name: Villa De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Villa de las Mercedes se formo en la ciudad de San Pedro, es una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital del país, que esta en crecimiento, es una zona rural, que aun no tiene mucho acceso a las vías de comunicación.
La señora Mirian, es una de las integrantes, ella trabaja como comerciante en los puestos de ventas de la feria que se realiza en San Pedro los días sábado, vende todo tipo de productos, y por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The "Villa de las Mercedes" group is from the city of San Pedro, which is quite far from the country's capital city (Asunción) but is expanding. San Pedro is in a rural area with little access to other areas of the country.

Mirian is one member of this group. She works as a trader at a market stall in San Pedro on Saturdays. She sells all sorts of products and, through sales, helps her family and loved ones.

Mirian is applying for this loan in order to buy fruits to sell. She can thus continue with her work and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, se formo con la unión de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de San Pedro, la cual es una zona bastante alejada de la capital del país. Todas luchan por un mejor porvenir para sus familias y sus seres queridos.
La señora  Blanca  es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que quiere salir adelante.
Blanca pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This is the "Kuña Guapa" group and has 17 female members from the city of San Pedro, which is quite far from the country's capital city (Asunción) but is expanding. All of the members are fighting for a better future for their families and loved ones.

Blanca is one member of this group. She makes a living selling meals that she makes and then goes out to sell. Blanca is a self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead.

Blanca is applying for this loan in order to invest in supplies to make her meals and thus continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing meals.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 42-year-old, married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has three children, ages 7, 9, and 11. 

For three years now, Susana has been raising hogs and she also started a small sari-sari store business, selling basic household needs, like soy sauce, shampoo, toiletries, and chips. However, she needs an additional loan to keep it going. 

It has been quite a challenge to meet the feed requirement of her hogs while maintaining her store. She is asking a loan to buy piglets, feed, supplements, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, canned foods, and toiletries.

Susana's income goes towards paying for her children’s education and a healthy diet for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, supplements, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, canned foods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending and pig fattening businesses.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 37 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bornice

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Bornice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Cheborgei, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of other food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. 

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also be protected from diseases that may arise from being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Bornice believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will also save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

Bornice hopes to have your support to improve her quality of life and that of her children!

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Najeb

texts.en:
Najeb is a 33-year-old married man with nine children. He and his family live on the first floor of a small house in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied up to the secondary level of school but was unable to finish his education.

Najeb hoped to build a second floor onto his house with the intent to rent it and use the money to help him cover some of the family’s expenses. Building it, though, has proved to cost a lot of money and he hasn’t been able to finish the job.

Najeb has now applied for a 200,000 YER loan through AMB in order to buy doors, windows and paint to finish the second floor. He hopes to make the apartment a source of income for his children.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to finish his rental unit.

loans.name: Dan's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Dan, born in 1990, is a Kinh ethnic man. He lives with his wife and his lovely son in Mai Son district, Son La province. His family's living is mainly based on cultivation and breeding, and their income is just enough to cover food for the family and to save the small amount that is left.

He wants to invest in buying a breeding pig and food for it but does not have enough money. He needs to access a loan for that purpose.

He will work hard to earn money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and he hopes that the loan will help his family invest effectively in breeding with high productivity. And thanks to the loan, his next pig herd will bring his family a significant profit.

loans.use: to invest in buying a breeding pig

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Nan’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is an 18-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor since two years ago, with limited income to cover her needs and expenses.

Zahra is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to improve her living conditions; thus, today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start her own new business of selling clothes from her house as a second source of income.

Zahra hopes to succeed in her new business, as she hopes to develop her business more in the future through opening her own clothing shop to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to start her own new business of selling clothes from her house as a second source of income to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Dorisi

texts.en:
Dorisi, who is in her late 30s, is a married mother of three children, all of whom are still in school.  For five years now Dorisi has been operating a beauty salon and working as a decorator for functions in big halls.  Working from 9 am to 9 pm daily, she is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Dorisi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start the decoration business and increase her salon products.  Profits went toward school fees and household expenses.  Dorisi will use this loan to buy both up-to-date salon products to meet customer demand and  equipment for her decorations enterprise.  

Dorisi will make sure she repays according to the loan schedule. She dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: to buy both up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements and equipment for her decorations business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, who both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Grace operates a boutique selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past one year and earns additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes to sell. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 45 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Celsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Celsa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Omniat Al- Wohda Group

texts.en:
This group is called Omniat Al-Wohda. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Joma is a 51-year-old married woman with ten children. She is living with them in a small house in Sana'a city, Yemen. Her husband works with an unfixed income, which is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family.

Joma lives with her family on the first floor, which is small and not enough for all the members of the family. She wants to build a second floor to expand the house, and is hoping her oldest child will marry.

Joma and her husband don't have the sufficient money to do this. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steels to build a second floor to expand her house.

Joma hopes to build more than one floor.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steels to build a second floor to expand her house.

loans.name: Artemen

texts.en: Artemen is requesting 100,000 ALL (Albanian Lek) to make some basic repairs to his family home. He has been photographed with Alketa, his wife, and their two younger children, who are 10 and 9 years old. They come from the vulnerable ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians and they live with poverty.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to the family house where the two children in the photograph are living

loans.name: Benedik

texts.en:
Benedik is a 25-year-old single man who is running a carpentry shop in the city of Lezha. The reason why he is requesting a loan in an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek is that he must buy equipment for the shop.

Benedik lived in a village before and worked for a couple of years in a carpentry shop as a helper. He had to travel for hours every day to get to work, but it was worthwhile because there he learned the skills of furniture-making and developed the passion for this trade, as per his saying. He then, about a year ago, opened up his own shop.

Here is what Benedik said: “Pursuing your passion, it takes you a long way. Clients sense that what I do is not just for money. I have been slowly establishing my clientele, and this makes me happy.”

loans.use: to buy equipment for his furniture-making shop.

loans.name: Yeath's Group

texts.en:
Yeath’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yeath makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en: Cheng’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh, a city in Cambodia. Cheng makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where she is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop, the family's only source of income. 

Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan because her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop including bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

Parveen is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's imitation jewelry business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio Luis pertenece al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO, él socio  sigue trabajando como  chef en uno de los restaurantes de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el  socio sale adelante, a la vez el socio continua con su negocio de taller mecanico.
El socio Luis requiere el préstamo para la compra de aceite, faros  entre otros.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank. He continues to work as a chef at one of the restaurants in the city of Cusco. Luis appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms. He is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that he can get ahead. Luis also continues to manage an auto repair business.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy oil, headlights, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy oil, headlights, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Santaní, comenta que se dedica a la producción de leche y queso, también en la ganadería y agricultura, tiene una clientela formada, es un señor muy trabajador, que lucha por poder crecer y mejorar su vida.
El esta esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante, pide este préstamo para poder comprar ganados vacunos para la venta, y así tener un mejor ingreso. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old and single. He lives in the city of Santaní. He describes how he makes a living from producing milk and cheese and also from livestock and agriculture. He has an established clientele base. He is a very hardworking man that struggles hard in order to grow as a person and improve his life.  

He is trying to grow and progress and is asking for this loan to buy cattle to later sell and therefore increase his income. He is grateful for this opportunity that will allow him to carry on selling.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Jaritza Carola

texts.es:
El deseo de Asistir a las personas que necesitan atención médica fue lo que impulso a Jaritza Carola a elegir la carrera de enfermería al ingresar a la universidad. Con la ayuda de su familia y con su propio empeño ha logrado alcanzar siempre las mejores notas en sus clases. Afirma que su carisma y la  pasión por la medicina son los dos factores mayores que la llevaran al éxito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que esto le ayudara a realizar sus investigaciones en tiempo y le facilitara la entrega de cualquier asignación en la universidad. 
Jaritza Considera que hoy en día las Pc son indispensables para agilizar cualquier proceso educativo. Por lo tanto al recibir este préstamo, estará de la misma manera recibiendo una herramienta clave  que le ayude al desarrollo e independencia  de si misma. Planea terminar su carrera y después seguir desplegando su conocimiento con mayores niveles de educación. Para ella la educación y la voluntad de ayudar a otras personas no tiene límites.
texts.en:
Wanting to help people who need medical attention is what drove Jaritza Carola to enroll at a university and choose a degree in Nursing. With the help of her family and her own initiative, she has able always been able to achieve good grades in her classes. She says that her charisma and her passion for medicine are the two major factors that have allowed her to become successful. Jaritza is requesting a loan in order to buy a portable computer, which will help her to optimize her research time and facilitate her university assignments.

Today Jaritza believes that personal computers are indispensable for making the educational process easier. By receiving this loan, she will have an essential tool that will help her to develop and become independent. She plans to finish her degree and then use her knowledge to pursue higher levels of education. Jaritza considers her education and her willingness to help other people to be limitless.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her sister to cover her semester fees so she can achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Khley

texts.en: Khley is a fifty-five-year-old widowed mother with three children who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She sells vegetables at a market and she has been in this business since 2010. All three of her children are factory workers. Together, they can earn approximately USD 20 each day. Now Khley would like to secure a loan for her children to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motorcycle for her daughter so they will have better traveling conditions. Khley hopes to expand her business and build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Halima is a mother of two schooling children. She is in her mid-30s. She has had a mamalishe business serving food such as cooked rice, ugali, banana with meat, beans and vegetables. Halima has been in this business for two years now. She does business from 6 am to 9 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request to be apportioned among Nia Njema's two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous loan, paid back successfully, she bought mamalishe cooking ingredients.
 
She is now requesting another loan, which she will use to buy food cooking ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour. Halima's dream is to build a classic restaurant.
