loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients such as  rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Valientes, cuenta con dieciocho integrantes, todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que quieren dar a sus familias una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Presentacion es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos varios, es una señora muy emprendedora  y se siente agradecida por formar parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceites, jabones, suavizantes y otros, para poder continuar con sus ventas, y seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Valientes" and has 18 members, all of which are very hard-working and determined women that want to provide their families with a decent life where they are not deprived of anything.

Presentacion is one of the members. She makes a living buying and selling various items. She is a very enterprising woman and is grateful to form a part of the programme which aims to eradicate poverty. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase oils, soap, fabric conditioner and other products so that she can continue to sell and carry on working hard towards improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase oils, soap, fabric conditioner and other products to later sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a sari-sari store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Nenita has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for a year now. She sell various items in her neighborhood like canned goods, noodles, spices, seasoning, condiments and toiletries. 

Nenita is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.  In the future, she will continue to expand her business and increase her inventory to attract more customers and provide her children what they need.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, canned goods, sugar, toiletries and sugar

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Tin, 33, lives in a small community in Prey Veng Province. He has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on a farm located near his house. He has been involved in this type of business since 2007. Hi is able to earn a daily income of USD 5.00, on average.

Tin wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego  es un hombre casado de 59 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, junto a su hermosa familia. 
Diego ya es un hombre mayor de edad, pero sin embargo todavía,  le encanta trabajar en la agricultura, para él el trabajo le renueva energías, pues él vive un una comunidad con un ambiente muy cálido, y es un lugar donde se cosechan las mejores cebollas. 
Con los préstamos que ha logrado Diego, ha podido incrementado su siembra, él  quiere sembrar más todavía porque aún tiene terreno para hacerlo, pero uno de las dificultades que afronta Diego, es que no cuenta con suficiente capital de trabajo, es por eso que él solicita un préstamo más que le servirá para darle mantenimiento a la siembra ya hecha, y otra parte le servirá para la compra de más pilones de cebolla y compra de insumos agrícolas. 
Diego con el primer préstamo  invertido en su agricultura le genero un poco más de ingresos, esto  le ayudo a satisfacer otras necesidades en beneficio de su familia, pues las metas y los sueños de un padre son infinitos, lo que sueña Diego es construirles una pequeña casa para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diego is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his beautiful family in the community of Sololá.

Diego is an older gentleman who still enjoys working in agriculture. His work gives him renewed energy. The community where he lives experiences very warm weather, which makes it a place for harvesting the best onions.

With the loans Diego has obtained, he has been able to increase his plantings. He wants to plant more because he has the land to do this, but one of his difficulties is that he does not have sufficient operating capital. For this reason, he is requesting another loan so that he can maintain the crops he has already planted. Part of the loan will be used to buy more onion seedlings and farming supplies.

Diego used his first loan by investing it in his farming, which helped to generate a bit more income. This allowed him to meet other needs that benefited his family. His goals and dreams as a father are infinite, one of them being to build a small house for each of his children.

loans.use: to buy onion seedlings and farming supplies, as well as pay for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Editha has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Liep's Group

texts.en: Liep’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Liep makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: Sen’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sen makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filte

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis esta estudiando arduamente para poder cumplir con su meta de ser un buen licenciado en química, comenta que su carrera no es fácil, pero que esta esforzándose para poder ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de un trabajo que debía entregar en la facultad, que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo, para poder invertirlo de nuevo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis is studying hard so that he can reach his goal of becoming a successful degreed chemist. He says that his degree program is not easy, but he is striving to make something of his life. Luis says that his previous loan was used to pay for a project that he was assigned by the faculty, so the loan was very helpful.

He is now requesting another loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university fees, which will help him continue his studies. Luis appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can continue his education.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Alicia es de la ciudad de San Pedro, ella se dedica a ser recicladora, se dedica a la recolección ambulante de todo tipo de productos reciclables, como así también de la compra, para su posterior venta al por mayor.
Ella está orgullosa de su trabajo ya que le permite ayudar a su familia, y comenta que pide este préstamo para invertirlo en compra de materiales para reciclar tales como, metales, plásticos, bronces, aluminios. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
Alicia is from San Pedro.  She is a recycler and collects all types of recyclables on foot and then resells them in quantity.

She is proud of her work because it allows her to help her family and she is asking for this loan to buy supplies to recycle, such as metals, plastics, bronze, and aluminum.  This will allow her to continue growing her business and provide for her family’s needs without depravity.

loans.use: to buy recyclables for resale.

loans.name: Kholisa

texts.en:
Kholisa lives in the town of Tursunzade, named in honor of the Tajik writer - Mirzo Tursunzoda. She is 25 years old and married. Kholisa's husband is away on earnings, in the Russian Federation. 

Kholisa has been engaged in sewing women's clothing for five years. Kholisa asked for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. The current machine does not fulfill its functions as well as before, so Kholisa decided to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes that somebody supports and helps her. Please support Kholisa.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat lives in the town of Tursunzade, named in honor of the Tajik writer - Mirzo Tursunzoda. She is 25 years old. She is married. Saodat has a large family consisting of her husband, children, father-in-law and mother-in-law. For her husband it is difficult to support the whole family, and Saodat helps him in this. She takes orders at home for sewing national women's clothing. Such work does not bring a lot of income, but it is an important help for the family budget.

At the moment, Saodat has a difficult situation connected with the activity. Her sewing machine broke and is not usable. She decided to buy a new sewing machine, so as not to lose a source of income. But she does not have sufficient funds to buy a sewing machine. For this reason, Saodat requested a loan. You can help her. Support Saodat!

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1956. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. 

Her husband helps her to do a business. She passed a hard time in her life when there was uncertainty of doing a business. She did not know before how to do a business. 

Shahodat had practice working on land on their parents' ground. She rented land for planting crops. By-products are used for the feeding of cattle. Shahodat is needed for financial support of her family's needs and expenditures. She wants to save for livestock and, in this way, to increase working capital. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.
La socia MARIA  sigue trabajando en una empresa pública, la socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando para dicha empresa la cual le va bien, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank named “Comuzone”. She lives in the city of Cusco, which is in the District of Huanchac in the Department of Cusco.

Maria continues to work for a public company. She appreciates and values the assistance that has been given to her in this manner, so she promises to pay off her debt according to the established terms. Maria is a responsible and industrious person. She continues to work for her employer and is doing very well. Working in this manner enables her to get ahead.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy provisions such as rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Mariana Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la menor de 18 años que  este año termina el colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Mariana es una muy buena esposa que le gusta ganar lo suyo y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella  tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, ella prepara el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas y de pescado picudo que son el deleite de sus clientes que día a día llegan hasta su local, ella también lleva a entregar sus deliciosos platos a ciertos lugares que le piden a domicilio, allí ella también vende aguas, gaseosas y otras bebidas lo cual le da ganancias extra. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio con el cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los ceviches. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años y  le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino al Progreso meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned craftsmanship. It is home to the famous Panama hats.

This is where Mariana lives. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children from this relationship. Two of them are adults and the youngest, who is 18, finishes school this year. Two of her children live at home. Her husband is a bricklayer. 

Mariana is a good wife that likes to have her own income and use this to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a small restaurant area at home where she works every day. In the mornings she prepares delicious ceviches [marinated seafood] of sardines and billfish, which her customers love. They come to her location every day and she also delivers her delicious dishes to certain places when customers ask for their food to be delivered.
She also sells juice drinks, sodas, and other beverages that gives her extra income. She has had her business for 12 years, obtaining an income and doing her bit for the family.
 
She will use this loan to purchase fish and other food supplies used to prepare the ceviches. She has been with the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it because the loans are very important for her. Her goals are to keep moving forward and for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food supplies.

loans.name: Carla Monserrate

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Teresita.
En este lugar vive la señora Carla, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 5 años  de edad la cual  estudia en escuela, ella y su esposo estudian medicina  en la universidad.
Doña Carla es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos tanto del hogar y para sus estudios se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha sus ratos libres para salir a vender aunque también vende en la universidad en la cual estudia, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 4   años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Su sueño es ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the lovely seaside town of San Jacinto, there is a beautiful beach that is located where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. In addition, this place is frequented by many domestic and foreign tourists. The Communal Bank named “Santa Teresita” meets every 15 days.

Sra. Carla lives in this place. She is 22 years old, married, and has a five-year-old daughter who is in school. Carla and her husband are studying medicine at the university.

Doña Carla is a housewife who earns her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and pay for their studies. She also works in retail by selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Carla sells by going door-to-door in her free time, but she also makes sales at the university where she is studying. She extends credit and collects payment every eight days. Carla has been in this business for more than four years and it has allowed her to earn the money she needs to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. She has been with her Communal Bank for four years and she enjoys being a member because the loans were used to start her business. Her dream is to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fátima Patricia

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es mecánico automotriz. 
Doña Fátima como muchas personas del lugar se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces de todos los sabores y diseños, ella trabaja a base de pedidos para fiestas y ocasiones especiales, además de estos dulces también elabora tortas con los diseños que sus clientes deseen. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga en la semana, lleva más de 22 años que se dedica  a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ingredientes para elaborar los dulces. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y bien construida.
texts.en:
In the area of Rocafuerte the members of the Credit Group Confraternidad de Amigas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people and because there the locals prepare delicious sweets that are renowned in the province and throughout the country.
Fátima lives in this area. She is 52 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has two adult children who are independent. Her husband is an auto mechanic.
Fátima, like many other people in the area, makes a living preparing and selling sweets of all flavors and styles. She works on the basis of orders for parties and special occasions, and in addition to these sweets she also prepares cakes with designs requested by her customers. She works four days a week depending on the orders she has during the week. She has dedicated more than 22 years to this activity, with which she earns her own living.  
This loan will be employed in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the sweets. She is a founder of of the Credit Group and she likes it because the group is very united. Her dream is to have her own well-built house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare sweets.

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Madame DENISE est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants tous étudiants. Elle est présidente du groupe BORA et s’occupe de la vente des friperies au marché central. Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui servira d’acheter  32 t-shirts.Son objectif pour l'avenir est de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et consolider son épargne. Elle tient à remercier HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle ne cesse d’apporter aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Denise is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. Denise is the president of the Bora group; she sells used clothing in the central market.

Denise is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase 32 t-shirts. Her goal for the future is to pay for the schooling expenses of her children and to consolidate her savings.

Denise wants to thank Hekima for their never-ending support of low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 32 t-shirts

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
This is Drande, a villager from northern Albania who is in her 60s and a married mother of three.

Drande is seeking your financial help to build a fence around the agricultural land she owns and her family home. “We live in a village here and without fence around your own things, trespassers like animals or people,  might come any minute to visit you unwanted,” Drande said, smiling. 

Drande does agriculture to earn a living; currently, she’s got two milk cows from which she sells about 15 kg/day raw milk and she has two baby calves each year. She also got chickens and sells about 30 of them per year and in addition to all of the above, she has 9900 square meters of agricultural land where she plants mainly beans and corn and sells 50 kg of beans per year and about 200 kg of corn.

loans.use: to build a fence around the agricultural land she owns and her family house, also

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамила, 38 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Жамила в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад с 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 3 лошади. Также на участке 0,60 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец и 2 коров для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhamila is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She raises livestock and plants crops as the main source of income for her family, which she began ten years ago with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhamila's hard work, she currently has two cows, ten sheep, and three horses. She also has a 0.60 hectare plot of land where she grows barley. In order to expand her business, Zhamila applied for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank so that she can save money to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep and two cows to fatten and resell in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio es un joven que está estudiando la carrera de derecho, ella al mismo tiempo que estudia, también trabaja, y de esa forma quiere salir adelante.
Su meta es poder terminar su carrera, y poder ser alguien en la vida, para poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una computadora, que le permitirá poder cumplir con sus trabajos de la universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Silvio is a young man who is studying for a law degree. He is also working while he is studying, which allows him to get ahead.

His goal is to finish his degree. He wants to make something out of his life so that he can help other people with his knowledge.

Silvio is requesting this loan so that he can buy a computer, which will help him to complete his university assignments. He appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can study.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
Aquí vive la señora Flor, tiene 55 años  de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y no tuvo hijos. Vive con familiares. 
Doña Flor es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de chifles, todos los días ella a las 06h00 se  levanta a realizar su trabajo el mismo que consiste en elaborar chifles para la venta diaria, hace dos clases de chifle el que es de plátano verde y el pintón el cual tiene un sabor un tanto dulce. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 16h00. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar manteca y plátanos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una gran empresa de chifles.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte, the members of the Credit Group Confraternidad de Amigas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people and because here the locals prepare delicious sweets that are renowned in the province and in the entire country. 
Flor lives in this area. She is 55 years old. Her husband died many years ago and she does not have children. She lives with relatives. 
Flor is a woman who has had to work to get ahead. She has a business making and selling "chifles" (fried banana chips). Every day she wakes up at 6:00 in the morning to do her work which consists of preparing chifles for daily sale. She makes two types of chifle, one that is made from unripe banana and one made from "pintón" banana, which has a slightly sweet flavor. She works everyday from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. She has been working at this job for more than 8 years, and with it she has been able to get ahead. 
This loan is to buy butter and bananas. She has been with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because of the way in which it has helped her obtain loans. Her dream is to have a large business making and selling chifles.

loans.use: to buy butter and bananas.

loans.name: Susy Yamalie

texts.es:
Susy Yamalie tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de más animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
24-year old Susy Yamalie is married and lives with her husband and children in a rural area in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. The local people earn their living as farmers, businessmen, or by raising livestock.

Susy raises and sells poultry such as ducks, chickens, roosters, hens, as well as pigs. She has more than five years' experience doing this work and has very good personal and work references from people in the area.

The loan money will be used to buy more animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys, and also specialized feed to fatten them. This investment will help Susy obtain a greater variety and larger number of animals and better productivity. Then she will be better able to respond to the varied tastes and needs of her customers resulting in increased income and a better standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: buy more poultry such as chickens, ducks and turkeys, and special feed for them

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma earns a living by engaging in a mineral water vending business. She sells mineral water to customers in the community. She is 37 year old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 5. Aside from that, she also engages in fruit vending business. She sells oranges, apples, mangoes, banana and other fruits.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional fruits and mineral water for resale and additional empty gallons. These materials are very helpful in augmenting Vilma's livelihood. She will now have additional capital to purchase more fruits and mineral water to be sold to her respective customers. In this way, she can now afford to buy healthy diets and better shelter for her family.

In the future, she hopes that she can successfully handle both businesses for the welfare of her growing children, especially by sending them all to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and mineral water for resale and addtional empty gallons

loans.name: Kalimurhima Group

texts.fr: La cliente MAWAZO est présidente du groupe KALIMURHIMA. Elle est vendeuse de haricots  au marché central depuis 2003 grâce au fonds de démarrage reçu de son mari à l’âge de 35 ans. Mère de 9 enfants dont seulement 9 vont à l’école, elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter  2,5 sacs de 100kgs d’haricot  et payer le transport. Elle compte agrandir son entreprise et renforcer son système d’épargne. A cet effet, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Mawazo is the president of the Kalimurhima group. She has been selling beans at the central market since 2003, thanks to the funds that allowed her to start her business which she received from her husband when she was 35 years old.

Mawazo is the mother of 9 children, all 9 of whom attend school. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase 2.5 bags of 100kg of beans each, and to pay for transportation. 

Mawazo plans on growing her business and to bolster her savings. As a result, she thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase 2.5 bags of 100kg of beans and pay for transportation

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Carmen es una gran ama de casa que además  se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ella vende todo tipo de productos como granos, carnes, legumbres, frutas, así como también artículos de bazar y papelería y ropa de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando él puede pero es ella la que siempre está atenta a ofrecer el mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya son 16 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse lo suyo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, ropa entre otros productos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte the members of the Credit Group Confraternidad de Amigas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people and because here the locals prepare delicious sweets that are renowned in the province and throughout the country. 

Carmen lives in this area. She is 54 years old, married and from this marriage has six adult children. One of her daughters still lives with her and her husband. Her husband is a farmer. 

Carmen is a housewife that also earns money through business. She has a grocery store in her home, and from there she sells all types of products like grains, meats, vegetables, and fruits, as well as bazaar items, stationery and clothing of all types. She works everyday from 6:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening and sometimes later. Her husband helps her in her work when he can but it is she who always attends and offers the best service to her customers. She has already run this business for 16 years and with it she has been able to earn her own living. 

This loan will be employed to further supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar and clothing among other products. She has been with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because it helps her to receive loans. Her dream is to better her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, clothing and other products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old single man who started working as a baker on his own account three years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is known among his customers for his tasty bread and delicious Manakish (is a popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, ground meat or any others. It can be sliced or folded, and it can either be served for breakfast or lunch).

Hussein is trying hard to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials to satisfy his customers' needs and their special requests.

Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the future through buying new machines to facilitate his work and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials to satisfy his customers' needs and their special requests

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: Welina is a 53-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her food vending business. She sells snack foods like steamed rice cake and other items. Welina has been in the business for more than 11 years now. This is the source of her income. Welina is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, milk, yeast, cooking oil, flour and flavorings. With this, Welina will be able to cook and sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, milk, yeast. cooking oil, flour and flavourings

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, born in 1970, is a Thai ethnic women. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her son and her daughter. Her family now is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.	

Her family's main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding, so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living costs and save the little amount left.  But, the saved amount is not enough to invest in buying fertilizer for the next coffee crop. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee.

She hopes the loan will help her family to invest in coffee to get high productivity, and with the willing to learn attitude, all her coffee trees will bring her family red ripe coffee berries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Felisa Magaly

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Felisa, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 18, 16, 13 y 11 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Felisa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y tarjetas telefónicas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días por  semana ya sea en las mañanas o tardes y no tiene horarios fijos para realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ochos días. Lleva más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para salir adelante.	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y tarjetas telefónicas. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The "Camino Al Progreso" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It's the place where the famous "toquilla" straw hats (more commonly known as Panama hats) come from.

Here we met Felisa. She is 35 years old, is married, and has four children—aged 18, 16, 13, and 11. The three oldest attend high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Felisa is a homemaker, who generates her own income by selling clothes by catalogue, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories), and phone cards. She sells her products from door to door and works between three to four days per week, either in the mornings or in the afternoons. She doesn't have a fixed schedule to do her rounds; she sells her products on credit and collects payments every week. She has been following this occupation for over 12 years and that is how she gets ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes, and phone cards. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, and she likes it because of the help that she gets from the loans.

Her dream is to see that her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes, and phone cards.

loans.name: Al Sanafer Group

texts.en:
Seham is the featured borrower for Al Sanafer Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Seham is a 47-year-old married mother of three children who works in selling dresses, scarfs, and accessories to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
Seham is a hard worker and sacrificing lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable dresses and scarfs to satisfy her customers in this winter season.

With respect to the other group members, Chirine is a 25-year-old married mother of one child who works as a teacher and wants to buy a new bedroom for her child. Hanan is a 36-year-old married mother of two children who works as a saleswoman and wants to develop her business. Donia is a 41-year-old married mother of one child who works as a hairdresser assistant and wants to improve her living conditions.

Seham is the second lady on the right, Chirine is the first lady on the right, Hanan is the first lady on the left, and Donia is the second lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable dresses and scarfs to satisfy her customers in this winter season

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1976. She is from the northern part of the country. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a disabled worker. Surayo has had her own business for almost twenty years. She is a well educated woman. She graduated with excellence and now teaches kindergarten. Every year she teaches 25-30 children. Surayo feeds and supports her family. Her husband gets a pension, but it is not enough to fully support the family. She is planning to refresh her apartment, doing renovation. She needs financial support to  buy building materials for renovating her apartment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her apartment.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa esta casada, y tiene 2 hijos, ella es una mujer que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y crecer para poder dar a sus hijos lo que ella no pudo tener, todo esto con la ayuda de su marido.
Ella tiene despensa en su casa, en la que trabaja desde hace unos años, ella es una persona que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias a que siempre trata muy bien a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos, como ser: verduras, frutas, carne, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Narcisa is married and has two children.  She's working hard to be able to get ahead and grow so she can give her children what she wasn't able to have.  She does all this with her husband's help.

She has a store in her house where she has worked for several years.  She has acquired very good customers because she always treats her customers very well.

Narcisa's requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, and other supplies so she can continue with her job and her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to keep his products in good condition.

loans.name: Carmita Lorena

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmita, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de un  hijo de 14 años el cual estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de un hermano. 
Doña Carmita es una muy buena madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella trabaja dos o tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en horas de la noche en sus recorridos, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, lleva más de 12  años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños, bisuterías, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Confraternidad de Amigas". communal bank meet every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte. This community is known for it's friendly and hard-working people and in this place the locals prepare delicious sweets that are re known in the province and the whole country.

Carmita lives here. she is a 43 year old single mother of a 14 year old son who studies in school. She lives in the house of her brother. Carmita is a very good mother who in order to make her own income and with this get ahead works in commerce. She sells all kinds of clothing and jewellery. Her method of selling is door-to-door. She works 2 to 3 hours every day either in the morning or in the evening doing her rounds. She also sells from her house where her best clients come.

She has more than 12 years in this business that allows her to make a living. This loan is to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing, jewellery amongst other things that she sells. She has been in the communal bank for 6 years and she likes it as the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Merita

texts.es:
Ofelia Merita tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero (vacas). Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, cerdos, patos, etc. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará será para realizar reparaciones y mejoras en su vivienda, con la compra de materiales como cemento y pintura para realizar arreglos en los pisos y paredes de su casa, esto le permitirá vivir con más comodidad con su familia y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ofelia Merita is 41 years old, she has a partner, and she lives in her own house with her partner and children in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this area work, for the most part, in agriculture and livestock. 

She works in the herding of cows. Additionally, she also herds and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, ducks, etc. She has experience working in this sector and she also has positive personal and work references in the area. The loan that will be provided to her will be used to make improvements to her home; to purchase supplies such as cement and paint to make improvements in the flooring and the walls of her home. This will allow her to live more comfortably with her family and it will also improve her way of life.

loans.use: to perform reparations and improvements to the household by purchasing supplies such as cement and paint to fix the flooring and the walls in her house.

loans.name: Kolap's Group

texts.en: Kolap’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kolap makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor, factory laborer, and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Yoemthavy's Group

texts.en: Yoemthavy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yoemthavy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and taxi driver to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chany's Group

texts.en: Chany’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chany makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling grocery to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Phorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Agélica María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
Aquí vive La señora Angélica, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen una  hija de  18 años de edad la cual estudia en una universidad de Portoviejo. Su esposo trabaja en una farmacia.
Doña Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de dedicarse al hogar también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00 aunque si alguna cliente quiere algo ella la recibe en su  casa sin ningún inconveniente, su hija le ayuda con sus ventas, ella vende al contado y también deja a crédito y cobra por semana. Lleva más de 13 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le sirven para los estudios de su hija
Este crédito es para comprar ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niñas. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace ya 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton, the Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Organizadas group meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are recognized throughout the whole country. Angélica live here, she is 42 years old and is married. The result of this relationship is her daughter who is 18 years old and studies at a university in Portoviejo. Her husband works in a pharmacy. 

Angélica is a hard-working woman who not only works at the home but who also works in trade; she sells clothing and she does this by selling from household to household. She works on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 AM until 4 PM, unless a client requires something, she will gladly accept her in her home. Her daughter helps her with the sales; she accepts cash and also credit; she charges every week. 

She has been working in this field for over 13 years and through which she earns her share that allow her to support her daughter's studies. This loan will be used to purchase clothing, especially clothing for women and girls. She has been a partner of the Grupo de Crédito group for over 10 years and she likes it because of the support that the organization has provided to her. She dreams of seeing her daughter become a great professional.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for women and girls.

loans.name: Blanca Filerma

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene  65 años de edad, hace tiempo su esposo falleció pero  de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, una de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Blanca es una mujer que le gusta valerse por ella misma para así  obtener sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Con la ayuda de los créditos ella aprovecha para comprar productos de oferta que luego vende a un buen precio y así se gana algo extra. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otros productos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre la ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the region Rocafuerte the members of the Credit Group Mujeres Organizadas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by locals that are renowned throughout the country.

Blanca lives in this area. She is 65 years old. Her husband passed away some time ago but from her marriage she has 5 children who are already adults. One of her children still lives with her. 

Blanca is a woman who likes to take care of herself by obtaining her own resources to advance herself. She makes a living in the sale of clothing from catalogues and products from Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Her way of selling these products is by going door-to-door. She works three days per week, leaving her goods on credit and collecting payment each week. With the help of loans she is able to purchase products that she later sells at a good price and thus earns something extra. She has spent more than 6 years working at this activity, through which she is successful. 

This loan is for buying clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, among other products. She is a founding member of the Credit Group and she likes it because it always helps her with loans. Her dream is to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa, el marido es agricultor. 
Doña María para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y al ver que su marido no gana mucho en el campo  se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5h00 a preparar los dulces los mismos que una vez preparados los entrega a comerciantes que los llevan a vender a otros cantones y ciudades del país, ella también vende en su casa al público en general que a diario saborean los deliciosos dulces, en esta labor le ayuda uno de sus hijos. Lleva más de 31 años en este negocio con lo cual ella se gana sus ingresos por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la fabricación de los dulces. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte the members of the Credit Group Mujeres Organizadas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by locals that are renowned throughout the country. 

María lives in this area. She is 61 years old, married and from her marriage has 10 adult children, three of whom still live in her home. Her husband is a farmer. 

María, to help her husband with household expenses and because her husband does not earn much working as a farmer, works in the production and sale of sweets. Every morning she wakes up at 5:00 to prepare sweets that, once prepared, she delivers to vendors that sell them in other regions and cities of the country. She also sells from her home to the general public, who daily taste her delicious sweets. One of her children assists her in this work. She has spent more than 31 years in this business, with which she earns her living for the well-being of her family. 

This loan is to buy ingredients necessary for the preparation of the sweets. She has been with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because the loans help her be successful. Her dream is to move forward and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of sweets

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer, 37 years old, has four children and lives in a rented house. Her husband works in a printing house. Eight years ago, Tahreer wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, because they faced financial problems. 

She started selling clothes and some products in her home. In the beginning she faced some difficulties in her job due to the lack of experience. Then she began to learn how to market the products and how to deal with her customers. She built some social relationships with some traders to help her.

She took more than one loan to buy products or to cover the financial gap, which was the result of lack of experience, where she sold a lot of goods in installments. She also got an education loan for her husband, because he took some classes for his job. Perhaps this will help him to develop in his work. 

Now she wants to get a loan and she needs help. Tahreer has requested a loan to buy more products to sell so she can increase her income and improve the standard of living for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, so she can increase her income and improve the standard of living for her and for her family.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a farmer born in 1957, who lives in a small village of south Rift Kenya called Kibumai. In this rural location, he owns a two-acre piece of land that he uses to grow vegetables and maize. He also keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He's been selling his produce a few kilometers away at the local market since he started farming in 2002. 

Jacob is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce 10 to 15 liters of milk every day, which will be sold at the market. Money from these sales will go to loan repayment and other business expenses. Any profits from this investment will be returned to his business to propel growth. Your loan will have a great impact on Jacob's life. 

His hard work thus far has seen him take great care of his four children, his lovely wife , and one employee. With your loan, he hopes to improve his family's livelihood and continue to impact society in a positive manner.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, a married father of four children who are all in school, comes from Kajonjo, Kantonzi cell in Kmwenge district. A very honest and hardworking man, he supports his family by growing coffee and bananas. His major challenge is the dry season, when his production is affected by drought.

Emmanuel has requested a loan of  ugx.1000.000= to buy manure for his coffee and banana plantation. This will help him to achieve greater crop yields. 

Emmanuel's future plan is to enable his children to attend good schools and construct a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están luchando por ir mejorando sus vidas y superar su pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patrocinia, quien vende leche, ella comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano para poder hacer llegar a sus clientes su producto desde muy temprano. Patrocinia es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche en cantidad, de manera a poder tener un buen stock para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Kyrey is part of the elimination of poverty program in which everyone is struggling to improve their lives and overcome extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Patrocinia who sells milk. She states that she starts work very early every day so that she can deliver her product to her customers very early. Patrocinia is a very hard worker who is fighting to get ahead and to help her loved ones. She is asking for this loan so she can use the money to buy milk in quantity. This will provide her with a good supply so she can satisfy her customers' demand. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to  improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is engaged in rice farming. She is a 50-year-old married mother of an 11-year-old child. She has been farming rice for five years now. In addition to that, she also has a food-vending business, selling snack foods like banana cue (fried and sugared bananas) and homemade meals.

She has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer. This will definitely improve her farm and increase her yield. She will sell higher volumes of rice, thus gaining a higher income. She could start to manage her finances and to pay her dues. 

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to be successful and have bountiful harvests.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer.

loans.name: Toro Blanco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Toro Blanco está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de 50 indicadores podrán conocer su situación de vida y trabajar por mejorarla.
La Sra. Amalia, es una de las que integra este grupo, ella trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y es por medio de este trabajo que está luchando por mejorar la vida de su familia. Es una mujer muy capaz que está poniendo todo de si por crecer y ser mejor cada vez.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que con ello podrá surtirse y tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Toro Blanco is in its number 2 cycle of the women’s committee program, where they all form part of the poverty elimination program, which through the 50-indicator survey will be able to know their living situation and work to improve it.
Amalia is one of the members in this group. She works every day, from early in the morning, and it is through this work that she is fighting to improve the life of her family. She is a very capable woman who is doing all she can to grow and improve every day.
She asks for this loan to purchase summer clothing, because with this she will be able to have a supply and a larger variety to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year old Zenaida has a business vending salted fish. She has a stall situated inside a market in her community. She is a married woman with three children from Dulag, Leyte. Two of her children are still attending school. She also has a hog-raising business. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies of salted fish and to provide additional capital for fruit vending.
Zenaida would cater to a variety of customers and gradually improve her income. She could then pay her dues and start to prepare nutritious food for her whole family.

In the future, Zenaida would like to expand both businesses to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of salted fish and to provide additional capital for fruit vending

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras es de la Ciudad de Itá está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, todas se ayudan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
María es miembro de este grupo, es la presidenta, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando su vida y la de su familia, ella se dedica a vender ropa, y comenta que le va muy bien, ya que se ha formado una muy buena clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Trabajadoras [Working Women] is from the city of Itá and is in its second cycle of the women's committee program in which everyone works and  helps each other to get ahead and improve their living conditions. 

Maria is a member of this group and is the president. She is a very hard-working woman who, with a lot of work and effort has been improving her life and that of her family. She sells clothing and says that it has been going very well for her as she has developed a strong clientele. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, etc. so she can continue with her clothing sales.

They are all appreciative of the opportunity to grow that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes Esperanza

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 64 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvieron tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante sola, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00. Además también vende artículos de bazar y papelería con los cuales obtiene muy buenos ingresos extra que le sirven para salir adelante, este negocio lo tiene hace mas de 30 años el mismo que era de sus padres pero al fallecer ellos ella se hizo cargo de la tienda que es su vida.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más víveres para surtir su tienda.  Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Mujeres Organizadas" (Organized Women) meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are well-known throughout the country. Mercedes lives in this place. She is 64 years old. Several years ago her life companion died and she was left a widow but from this relationship they had three children who are now adults and are independent.  

Mercedes is a fighter who has had to work hard to get ahead. She owns a small store at her home were she sells all kinds of products such as grains, detergent, meat, legumes, among other basic supplies. She works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening. Aside from food products she also sells various household goods and stationary products from which she obtains additional income to get ahead. She has owned this business for over 30 years; the business belonged to her parents but once they passed away she became responsible for the store and which is now her life. 
She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of more essential grocery products to stock her store. She has been in the communal bank for more than 8 years and she likes it for the help that she receives with the loans. Her dreams are to continue working and to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies.

loans.name: Ángela Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
Aquí vive la señora Ángela, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es comerciante. 
Ella  junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de producción y venta de helados. Trabajan todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 17h00, ella en las mañanas se encarga de fabricar los deliciosos helados de distintos sabores que luego su esposo sale a vender en un carro  por la localidad y también se desplaza hasta los campos donde sus helados son muy apreciados y apetecidos, ella también en su casa vende sus helados. Además de esto por las tardes pone un pequeño local en el cual vende  meriendas, allí prepara platos al gusto de sus clientes que llegan en gran número  a su pequeño local, llevan más  23 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, saborizantes y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 11 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the communal bank Mujeres Organizadas (Organized Women) meet every fifteen days. This place is known for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are recognized throughout the country. Angela resides here; she is 59 years old, married, and she has four children who are adults and are independent. Her husband is a trader. 
Along with her husband, they own an ice cream store. They both work every day from 7 in the morning until 5 in the evening. She is responsible for preparing the delicious ice cream flavors every morning, which her husband then sells in a car, along the area, and in the rural areas where the ice creams are greatly appreciated and sought after. She also sells the ice creams at home. Additionally, during the afternoons she sets up a small store were she sells snacks, and dishes that here clients seek. A lot of clients go to her small store. They have had this business for over 23 years and which has allowed them to get ahead. 
This loan will be employed to purchase sugar, flavorings and food supplies to prepare the dishes. She has been a part of the communal bank for over 11 years and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to move ahead. Her dreams are to continue working and to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flavorings and food supplies.

loans.name: Gonzalo Gil

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive don Gonzalo, tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de  11 años de edad la cual estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ellos. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Gonzalo es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para darles a su familia lo necesario para vivir, el tiene un local que arrienda en el mercado de la localidad donde se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos y quesos, el vende al por mayor y menor, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta los 1800, ya son más de 32 años realizando esta labor la cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario de su familia y gracias a los créditos ha ido aumentando. 
Este crédito es para comprar huevos y quesos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 5 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha mejorado su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank Mujeres Organizadas (Organized Women) meet every fifteen days in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets which are prepared by the locals and are recognized throughout the whole country. Gonzalo lives here; he is 50 years old; and he is in a relationship and he has three children; two of them are adults and one of them is 11 years old and studies at school. Two of his children still live with him and his partner. His wife works at home. 
Gonzalo likes to work hard to provide for his family; he has a store which he leases at the local market. He purchases and sells eggs and cheese. He sells in bulk and in retail. He works every day from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He has been working in this field for over 32 years, this has allowed him to make a living for his family and thanks to the loans his income has increased. This loan will be used to purchase eggs and cheeses. He has been a part of the communal bank for over 5 years and he likes it because the loans have improved his business. He dreams to own his own store.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and cheeses.

loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart is a 33-year-old married father of two children, 11 and 6 years old. He wants to buy two milk cows. A loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek will give him the opportunity to achieve his goal of starting a dairy farm.
So far, he has been farming on land he owns where he grows tobacco and onions and he also grows corn on rented land. Eduart sells most of the produce, but with the two cows he is buying, he plans to use some of the corn to feed them.

loans.use: to start up a business by buying two cows

loans.name: Betty Domitila

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 66 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvieron seis hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña Betty es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para así salir adelante ella sola, ella tiene una papelería en su casa donde además de útiles escolares también  vende libros, helados y otros productos, ella aprovecha que su casa está cerca de una escuela de la localidad por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas y le permiten a través de su trabajo diario ganarse el sustento sin depender de nadie más, lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.	
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares, libros, helados y todo de lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte the members of the Credit Group Mujeres Organizadas meet every fifteen days. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by locals that are renowned throughout the country. 

Betty lives in this area. She is 66 years old. Her life partner passed away many years ago and she has remained a widow, but from this relationship she had six children that are now adults and independent.

Betty is a woman that has had to work hard to succeed alone. She has a stationery store in her home where in addition to school supplies she also sells books, ice cream and other products. She takes advantages of the fact that her house is close to a local school for whom her sales are very good and have allowed her through her daily work to support herself without depending on anyone. She has worked in this activity for 2 years, with which she has earned a living. 

This loan is to buy school supplies, books, ice cream and all that she sells. She has been with the Credit Group since its founding and she likes it because the loans help her greatly. Her dream is to have good health and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, books, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Glenda Josefa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar  vive la señora Glenda, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, de 2 años y un bebé de 11 meses  de edad. Su esposo es docente.
Doña Glenda es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, el además de trabajar como maestro en una escuela de la localidad también se dedica a elaborar y vender artesanías, el elabora collares, pulseras, rosarios y muchas otras obras con motivos religiosos los mismos que tienen mucha salida razón por lo cual las elabora ya que sus ventas están aseguradas y esto le deja muy buenas ganancias, el todos los días en sus ratos libres elabora estos productos pero las ventas las realiza los fines de semana.
Este crédito es para comprar materiales e imágenes religiosas que el necesita para elaborar las artesanías. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At the Rocafuerte canton, members of the communal bank Mujeres Organizadas (Organized Women) meet every fifteen days. This place is known for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are recognized throughout the country. Glenda inhabits this area; she is 28 years old, married and has two children, ages 2 and a 11-month old baby. Her husband is a teacher. Glenda is a great wife who uses the loan so that her husband can use it for his craft. As well as working as a teacher in a school in the locality, her husband also prepares and sells handicrafts; he makes necklaces, bracelets, rosaries, as well as other religious crafts. This products are well received and that is why makes them because they generate good revenues. During his free time he makes these products but he sells them during the weekends. 
The loan will be used to purchase supplies and religious symbols that he needs to elaborate the handicrafts. She has been part of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because of the support she receives from the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and religious symbols to prepare handicrafts.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including beverages, seasonings, shampoo, eggs, and noodles. She is a 59-year-old married mother of one grown child. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has been running a store for seven years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items like canned goods, noodles, condiments and toiletries.  This additional stock will attract more customers and earn her more income. She could then prepare healthy diets which are important in her daily activities.
