In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it sustainable and she hopes to keep it in as healthy a condition as possible.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, noodles, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Trepisa

texts.en:
Trepisa engages in the buying and selling of vegetables, including onions. She is a 56-year-old, married woman, residing in Dulag, Leyte. It has been three years now that she has engaged in this kind of business. 

Trepisa has requested a loan to purchase more supplies of onions and bihon - a kind of noodle. These supplies are very essential in augmenting her daily income. She could now sell a variety of its kind to her respective customers. 

In the long run, she can balance her finances and start to pay her obligations. Trepisa is determined to expand her current business to become successful and to have a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of onions and bihon - a kind of noodle.

loans.name: Cita Ines

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Cita, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa, el marido es albañil. 
Doña Cita es una mujer  muy trabajadora que le gusta de una u otra forma ganarse la vida, ella trabaja en un bar de una escuela de la localidad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, ella requiere de este crédito pues necesita hacer ciertos arreglos en su casa, quiere poner cerámicas en el piso de los baños y cocina así como también pintar las paredes en su casa, ella espera con los créditos poder terminar su casa y vivir dignamente.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámicas y pinturas. Lleva 7 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella puede ir de a poco construyendo su casa. Sus sueños es tener terminada por completo su casa.
texts.en:
At the Rocafuerte canton, the members of the Credit Group Organized Women get together every two weeks.  This place is known for its delicious sweets made by locals and recognized around the country.
Cita lives here, she is 54 years old, she is married and has six grown children.  One of them lives at home.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Cita is a very hardworking woman, in one way or another she likes to earn a living.  She works at the bar of a local school for which she gets a monthly salary.  She requests the loan because she needs to make certain improvements to her house, such as putting tile in the bathrooms and kitchen as well as the walls of her house.  She hopes with the loans to be able to finish her house and live with dignity.  This loan is to buy tile and paint.  She has been with the credit group for 7 years and likes it because with the loans she can slowly build her house. Her dream is to finish her house in full.

loans.use: to buy tile and paint.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, en un local propio. Cuenta más de 02 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de insumos para la preparación de comidas así como para la compra de materiales de cocina como ollas, mesas y sillas para implementar su negocio, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Noemi is 29 years old; she lives with her partner and her youngest child in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture, livestock as well as other economic activities. 

She sells meals in her own store. She has more than 2 years of work experience and has excellent work and personal references from her area. The current loan will be used to purchase supplies to prepare meals, as well as to purchase kitchen supplies such as pots, tables and chairs to implement her business. This will allow her to increase her revenue and thus improve her lifestyle and her families wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare meals, as well as to purchase kitchen supplies such as pots, tables and chairs to implement her business.

loans.name: Al- Samt Al- Aarouk Group

texts.en:
The members of  Al- Samt Al- Aarouk Group are four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.
Fatima is a 55-year-old married mother of nine children. The family lives in a small house which is inadequate for all the members of this large family. Her husband works for a small wage which is not enough to pay for the necessary expansion of the house. Fatima decided to take a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase some construction materials to build other rooms inside of the house.
Fatima looks forward to building the second floor and renting it out.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build other rooms inside of the house.

loans.name: Donagul

texts.en:
This is Donagul. She is 56 years old and lives in Vakhsh district. She is married and has one son at the age of 30 years. Her son is married and has children. He is working in the Russian Federation to earn money for living. Donagul lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Her husband is 65 years old, and the daughter-in-law is 28 years old. Her grandchildren are ages 10, 9, 6 and 1 years. 

Donagul is a good woman. She sells Tajik milk product "Katik" in the local market. She started this kind of business two years ago. This business is the main source of income. With this income she provides for her family. Donagul wants to expand her activity and that is why she is getting a loan. This loan will help her to improve the living conditions of the family. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Arco Iris está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, todas y cada una de ellas quieren mejorar sus emprendimientos para poder dar los mejor a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado su condición de pobreza, pero es consciente que debe seguir esforzándose. Ella se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, lo realiza en su casa ya que posee las condiciones para ello.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cerdos, para poder criarlos y luego venderlos. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Arco Iris is in it's fourth loan cycle within the programme called Comité de Mujeres. Each one of them wants to improve their business ventures in order to give the best to their families.
One of the members is Maria. In her last survey she showed that she was living in poverty level three, this means that she has improved her conditions of poverty but she knows the she must continue to make a great effort. She earns a living breeding and fattening up pigs. She does this from home as she has the conditions in which to do so.
She is asking for this loan to buy pigs to be able to breed them and then sell them. The group members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old. He comes from Kyarugyendo cell, Kazo in Kiruhura district.  Robert deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He has requested for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to help him buy more cows for fattening to increase his capital. 

His major challenge is drought, which affects his animals, leaving them with no water and grass to feed on. This has affected his working capital. He hopes to use the rest of the money to construct a dam to store water for his animals during the dry season. Robert is a very honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace comes from Rubona cell, Buhanda sub-county in Kamwenge district. She is 42 years old and a widow with two children. She has managed to take care of her children after the death of her husband.

Grace deals in coffee farming, where she earns income to take care of her family. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to help her increase her working capital by buying coffee to sell. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Grace is a very honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to pay school fees .

loans.name: Roqiya

texts.en: Rokiya, 46 years old, is married and has a daughter aged 16. Rokiya is engaged in selling children's clothing and galoshes. She loves her job and is trying to expand it. She has three years of experience during which she learned all the details of her work. Rokiya wants to expand her activity and requests your support. She will use this loan to buy a new counter and new seasonal goods. She asks you to support her and believes that she will not give up.

loans.use: to purchase counters and new seasonal goods

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza está en su 2do ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Empiezan con mucha motivación porque todas ellas son emprendedoras y quieren llegar muy lejos.
Anastacia es una de las integrantes, es costurera, y comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos, es por ello que le va muy bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora que pese a los problemas ha ido sobresaliendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones, y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza group is in it's 2nd loan cycle within the Women's Committee programme. They have a lot of motivation because they are all entrepreneurial and want to go very far.
Anastacia is one of the members, she is a seamstress. She sais it is going well as she has many customers who always place many orders. This is why it is going very well. She is a hardworking person who, despite problems, has excelled. 
She is asking for this loan to invest in fabric, thread, buttons and other items so that she can continue with her clothes making and complete her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric. thread, buttons and other items to use for making clothing.

loans.name: Hane

texts.en:
Hane is a 46-year-old villager and mother of 3 children ranging in age from 12 to 20 years. She would like to take a loan so she can purchase a dairy cow. 

Hane has been running her agriculture and livestock business to earn a living. She has 3 sheep and 3 goats; however she earns nothing from them since she uses their products for the family’s personal use. She has 4 sows and is able to sell 8 piglets each year. She also has 50 chickens from which she is able to sell 20 chickens and 3,000 eggs each year. 

In addition to her livestock, Hane owns about 16 dynym of land (4 acres) on which she plants corn and wheat. Their 20-year-old daughter works in a company but earns little pay.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gabriela Raquel

texts.es:
La adolescencia de Gabriela no ha sido como la de la mayoría, desde los 14 años, ella tenía que ir por la mañana al colegio, en la tarde hacia sus tareas y a veces salía a jugar con sus amigas, ya que en la noche tenia que ayudar a su mamá en la fritanga. Ahora está joven con espíritu emprendedor tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de un niño de cuatro años. Afortunadamente su madre le heredó este negocio que le ha permitido sustentar a su pequeña familia. 
A medida que pasan lo años, los deseos de superación de esta comerciante siguen aumentando, pues ha agregado la venta de productos lácteos a su negocio para diversificar su puesto de comida. Por está razón es que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para comprar plátanos, cebolla, arroz, frijoles, queso, crema, pollo crudo, carne, entre otros productos para ofrecer una comida de calidad. Esto le permitirá aumentar su ingresos y poder ahorrar para comenzar sus estudios universitarios en un futuro cercano. En sus planes está ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabriela's teenage years were not like those of most people. From the age of 14 she went to school in the morning, did her homework in the afternoon and sometimes went out to play with her friends. But at night she had to help her mother at the restaurant. 

Now this young woman with an entrepreneurial spirit is 22 years old and is the single mom of a four-year-old boy. Fortunately, her mother passed down this business to her which has enabled her to support her small family. As the years go by, this merchant's desire to excel continues to grow. She has added dairy products to her business to diversify her food stand. Gabriela is asking for a loan to buy plantains, onion, rice, beans, cheese, cream, raw chicken, meat, and other products to provide quality food. This will allow her to increase her income and save some money so she can begin university studies in the near future. Her plans include expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy plantains, onion, rice, beans, cheese, cream, raw chicken, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Dolores Catalina

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 15, 12 y 6 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Dolores es una mujer  muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella junto a sus familia tienen un restaurante en un local que arriendan en el mercado de la localidad, allí preparan desayunos,  almuerzos y meriendas, trabaja de viernes a domingo ya que es cuando más personas acuden hasta este centro de abastos, estos días aprovecha para vender casi todos el día desde la madrugada hasta tarde en la noche, ella varia el menú de acuerdo al gusto de sus clientes que visitan su local, ya son cinco años que tiene  este negocio con el cual se ganan la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para la elaboración de sus platos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la seriedad del grupo. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the "Confraternidad de Amigas" communal bank meet every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for it's friendly and hard-working people and because the locals prepare delicious sweets that are re-known in the province and in the whole country.

Dolores lives here. She is 37 years old, married and from this relationship has 4 children aged 2, 15, 12 and 6 years old. They all study in university, high school and primary school. Her husband is a businessman. Dolores is a very determined woman who likes to work to get ahead.

She together with her family has a restaurant in a stall that she rents from the local market. She makes breakfast, lunch and dinners here. She works from Friday to Sunday which is when the most people come to this wholesale center. She takes advantage of these days selling all day from early in the morning until late at night. She varies the menu according to the tastes of the people who visit her stall

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a single lady who lives with her family, and she is 29 years old. She has a bachelor’s degree in dental technician. Somaya didn't find a job when she graduated, but that does not stop her. She decided to do something to cover her daily expenses and to help her family, as she didn't want to be a burden on them. Seven years ago she started to sell clothes and cosmetics. Her customers are limited to her friends, neighbors, or family.

After a long time, Somaya was hired in hospital and she likes her work.  She built more social relations so she has more customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy more products to sell. In the end she is an ambitious and distinct person, and needs your support.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell. In the end she is an ambitious and distinct person, and needs your support.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan earns a living through fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her community. She is a married mother of 2 kids aged 3 and 1 years. Together, she and her family live in Dulag, Leyte in the Philippines.

Joan is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets. These would help her improve her on-going catch, and sales of more fish would allow her to provide her children with proper diets. As well, she could set aside some of her profits to begin other possible businesses and earn additional income.

Joan will keep striving to expand her business to make it productive and thus be able to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is 56 years old and is a kind, polite, responsive, and beautiful soul. 

Khosiyat is divorced, and she brought up her 2 sons herself. Her oldest son is 21 years old, while the youngest is 19 years old. She did everything for her children, making sure they were secure and well-clothed. For more than 2 years, Khosiyat has been engaged in providing seamstress services. She loves her job because she is able to communicate with new people and have a good time.

In both Khosiyat's and her son's life there was a pleasant event. He met a girl and is going to marry her soon. 

Khosiyat endorses her son's choice and is preparing for the wedding. She wants to throw the wedding with their traditions and customs. However, they require money for the wedding, and so Khosiyat is requesting a loan. With her loan amount she will be able to help her son get married.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her son's wedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his new office and buy some furniture and a computer for his law office.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Catalina está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7  integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas que ella siempre trata de conseguir las mejores frutas de estación para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, de manera a poder surtirse y dar a sus clientes productos frescos, y eso le ayudará a poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Santa Catalina is in its 4th cycle in the women's committee program in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey in which seven members have been found to be below the poverty line, which is extreme poverty.

One of the members is Mirian, who in her last survey was shown to be at poverty level one - extreme poverty. She sells fresh fruit and always tries to buy the best seasonal fruits to offer to her customers. She is asking for this loan so she can buy fruit and have enough stock to provide fresh products to her customers. This will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit for resale.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
19 son las integrantes que forman parte del grupo llamado 6 de Enero, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilberta, quien hace confecciones de prendas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino, y hoy en día ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre les hace muchos pedidos. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, es por ello que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, etc., de manera a poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
There are 19 members who comprise the group called 6 de Enero.  They are female heads of household who struggle to give their families all that they could not have.
One of the members is Gilberta who sews articles of clothing.  She is a hard-working woman who little by little has made her way and nowadays she has acquired a very good clientele who always make many requests,  
She wishes to progress and it for this reason that she requests this loan in order to invest in cloth, thread, elastic bands, etc. to be able to keep up with the demands of her customers.
She is grateful for the opportunity she receives which will be of much help for her to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastic bands, etc.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a married man with four children from Dulag, Leyte. His oldest child is fifteen and the youngest is nine. He runs a sari-sari, or variety store, where he sells a range of goods such as noodles, cookies, bread, cooking oil, eggs, soap and condiments.

Jerry is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy additional groceries for his store. He feels this increase in stock will attract more customers and so improve his income. He could stabilize his finances and afford to provide a proper diet for the whole family.

Jerry’s goal is to expand his business so as to make it more productive. His desire is to support the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, beverages and toiletries for his shop

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline engages in fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her community. She is 30 years old, and married with two kids from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in fishing for five years now.

She is asking for a loan to purchase fishing net and maintenance for the boat engine. With these, her fishing livelihood will improve. She will sell more fish and start to balance her finances. She will afford to buy healthy foods for the whole family. Evangeline dreams to expand her business to make it productive and successful, and to continue supporting the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and maintenance for the boat engine.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam lives in Baqaa, Jordan. She is working hard to grow and become a professional who will be able to help others.

Ahlam's parents divorced when she was young. And while her parents fends for themselves, her mother provides some help to her children.

Ahlam is studying for her bachelor’s degree in Arabic so that she can continue increasing her knowledge and teach others. She is requesting a loan to pay her college fees and thus be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her college fees and thus be able to continue her studies.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a 25 years old mother who runs a small retail store within their village. She was gifted with two children and currently lives in a rural community. She and her husband help each other in gaining income to sustain their daily necessities.

Sheryl aspires to increase her inventory of grocery items but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy culls, frozen foods, slippers, bakery breads and soft drinks to resell in her community.

She believes that this financial assistance will help her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy culls, frozen foods, slippers, bakery breads and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a mother who has a deep passion for dairy farming, which she has been involved in for the past ten years. She owns a small farm in Kiburion, which is situated in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya. With the help of her husband, she also raises poultry and grows maize, among other crops. She also has a couple of small businesses on the side to make extra money.

The income Caroline makes from farming, however, is not sufficient to sustain her family comfortably. As a result she is seeking a 40,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to build a cowshed. She has plans for a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. The plans provide for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these elements account for most of the labor in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day.

Overall, Caroline feels these steps will result in increased milk production. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of her business.

The farming sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates about 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 60% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of farming to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain under served by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

loans.use: To build a cow shed.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 31-year-old, married man and a father of two children, living with them in Sana'a city, Yemen. He studied until secondary education. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete it, because he got married when he was very young. 

Saleh is the sole breadwinner of his family. He works hard Sunday to Sunday to earn money to cover the necessary expenses of his poor family. His income is very small and limited. Saleh decided to run his own business that will help him provide his family with better living conditions, by opening a grocery in his area to sell the necessary food materials and goods for the residents in his area. 

Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of food materials, items, and goods to open a small grocery. Saleh hopes if he succeeds in that business, to open another grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase some of food materials, items, and goods to open a small grocery.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem  is 47 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her share of household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is 38 and works in a shoe factory owned and operated by foreigners. His sister has a cow and sells eight kilograms of milk a day for about nine months out of the year. The two sell a baby calf a year as well as chickens and eggs. They plant and sell seasonal vegetables and grapes from their vineyard.

Kastriot’s mother was living with him and his sister until three months ago when she passed away. He had to ask some friends for a loan to lay his mother to rest and promised to pay them back as soon as possible. The 150,000 ALL loan he is requesting from you through VisionFund Albania is to pay off this debt.

Kastriot will be grateful to all of you for your understanding in this matter.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's funeral expenses

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jorge está en su ciclo número 4to, Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran en pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio de pobreza.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender, se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus comidas.
La Sra. Rosa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called San Jorge is a communal bank program, in its 4th cycle, where all work and help each other to succeed. They are completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey, which finds 10 members in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Señora Rosa, who in her latest survey indicated a level of poverty in the level two, i.e. at an average level of poverty.  She makes a living selling meals that she makes and sells herself. She has already accumulated a very good clientele that always buys her meals.

Señora Rosa requests this loan to buy supplies, with which to make her meals, such as greens, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, etc. This will help her to be able to fulfill her business plan, which will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, etc for food production.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 27 years old and married. She has been operating a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Zubaid

texts.en: Zubaid  is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is engaged in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 48 years old and a vigorous woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. Nasreen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of two children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demands.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal is a 46-year-old married woman. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffalo and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Iqbal’s job is to look after the buffalo and collect milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Iqbal has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. Zareena is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders from her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Zareena closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders from her customers on time to earn good profits.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen has successfully built her general store business along with her husband (also shown in the photo) with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has obtained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Nhóm 1-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en: Lien, 52, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 300,000. She is a single mom but her 19-year-old daughter is an intellectual disability. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1990. Now, her family is classified as a very poor family. Due to the lack of fund, her household does not have a sanitary toilet yet. With this loan, she will build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection. In this photo, Lien is pictured first from the left. The man who is pictured first from the right is a local resident.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 57-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffalo for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to improve her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to improve her milk sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Proceres De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Próceres de Mayo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y a través de esto pretenden ir mejorando la situación de pobreza de cada una y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien se dedica a las ventas varias, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja sin descanso para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere ir mejorando por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo, sumado a la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya a través del programa de comité de mujeres.
Mirta pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
The group "Próceres de Mayo" (Heroes of May) is doing the poverty elimination survey, and through this they aim to keep improving each member´s situation of poverty, and help their families. 

One of the group members is Mirta, who makes a living selling various items. She has a well-stocked storeroom in which she works tirelessly to be able to give her family everything that she was unable to have. She is a very selfless woman who wants to improve her situation with hard work and effort, along with the help of the Fundación Paraguaya, through the Committee of Women Program. 

Mirta is requesting this loan to be able to buy various supplies for her storeroom, such as vegetables, fruit, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods and more.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods and more

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 25-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in the public sector. This is the only source of income for the family. Eyad is a student and would like to complete his studies and find a job in the health sector to help his family with their expenses. 

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to do his home work and write his reports easily. Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 55 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Saeed  Mai

texts.en:
Saeed Mai is a 39-year-old married woman. She is in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, cada una de ellas quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su esfuerzo, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y luchar por mejorarla.
Una persona que se esfuerza por mejorar su vida y la de su familia es la Sra. Sonia, quien vende comidas que ella misma hace. Comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y pedidas por sus clientes. Sueña con poder tener un comedor grande, y poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, frutas, condimentos hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 18 women, each of whom wants to get ahead and help their loved ones through their effort. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to be able to get to know the living situation of each member and fight to improve it.

One person who is striving to improve her life and that of her family is Sonia, who sells food that she makes herself. She says she has great clientele because her food is very tasty and requested by her clients. She dreams of being able to have a large diner and continuing to grow. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her food, such as leafy vegetables, garden vegetables, fruit, condiments, and more. In this way, she can continue fighting as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy leafy vegetables, garden vegetables, fruit, condiments, and more

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 50-year-old married woman. Her son is an electrician by profession. He provides his services in his locality and earns a good amount of income to contribute in detail.

In order to cater to more customers, he needs to purchase different wires, switches, charges, and cable. For this reason, Safia has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son's business. It will help her son in catering to more customers to increase his net income.

loans.use: to purchase different wires, switches, charges, and cable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make university payments

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARTESANAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, trenzado y venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de sombreros, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, venta de polleras, venta de ropa y medias, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años conjuntamente su esposo quien trabajaba anteriormente en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "ARTESANAS" communal bank is part of the Los Andes Regional Office of the Pro Mjuer, and will begin the organization's sixth cycle. ARTESANAS consists of eight members, who run businesses that include poultry sales, weaving and sale of blankets, fruit sales, hat sales, food sales, construction services, clothing and stocking sales, and furniture sales. 

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Señora Maxima, who is the Chairwoman of ARTESANAS. She is married, the mother of a son, and runs a business selling furniture. Señora Maxima says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the group after receiving an invitation as part of a major promotional campaign that Pro Mujer conducted in her area. Señora Maxima says that she learned the furniture sales business a few years ago from her husband, who used to sell furniture himself. 

Señora Maxima is applying for a loan to increase her capital. She plans to purchase furniture that she'll buy from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz, then resell these items at her store. This investment and resale will allow Señora Maxima to earn income to support her family financially.   

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Maxima answers that she likes the health care services that the organization offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale furniture

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es conocida como la manicurista más creativa de su ciudad, muñecos, flores y hasta paisajes en las uñas son algunas de las creaciones que la han hecho sobresalir desde que comenzó a trabajar a sus 20 años de edad. Sus amigas eran sus principales clientes al principio que no había establecido un lugar, hasta que decidió fijar un espacio en su casa, con una mesa y un stand donde exhibir su equipo. Ahora esta comerciante de 35 años de edad es madre soltera de dos adolescentes de 17 y 15 años de edad, quienes a diario la apoyan y ni dejan de asistir al colegio.
Siendo este su primer y único negocio, su visión emprendedora está muy clara, pues quiere establecer un gran salón de belleza más grande y completo donde pueda ofrecer todos los productos de belleza. Razón por la cual solicita un crédito para comprar pinturas de uñas, cremas, acetona, pinzas, uñas acrílicas, entre otros utensilios importantes para trabajar. En sus planes está conseguir un local estratégico para brindar un mejor servicio y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is known as the most creative manicurist in her city. Dolls, flowers, and even landscapes on the fingernails are some of the creations that she has made to stand out since she began to work at the age of 20. Her friends were her principal customers at the beginning, when she had not established a location. until she decided to arrange a space in her house with a table and a stand where she could exhibit her equipment. Now she is a businessperson of 35, the single mother of two adolescents, ages 17 and 15, who support her every day and don't miss school.

Since this is her primary and only business, her entrepreneurial vision is very clear, since she wants to establish a larger and more complete beauty salon where she can offer all the beauty products. This is the reason why she is applying for a loan, to buy nail polish, creams, acetone, tweezers, and acrylic nails, as well as other important tools for her work. Included in her plans is acquiring a strategic location to offer better service and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, creams, acetone, tweezers, acrylic nails, and other tools

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Al llegar al negocio de Martha no solo se encuentra una excelente miel embotellada en venta, sino también una sonrisa acogedora te da la bienvenida, asegurándote un buen servicio, muy reconocido por toda la ciudad. Esta madre soltera de 27 años de edad, es comerciante desde hace diez años, cuando decidió ayudar a su madre en el hogar. Ahora con su hijo de dos años de edad se siente más que inspirada por crecer. 
Martha sueña con establecer su propio local donde pueda vender mejor su producto, por está razón es que solicita un préstamo para comprar miel y así diversificar los tipos y los tamaños de cada botella que vende. De esta manera irá aumentando sus clientes y así podrá empezar ahorrar para cumplir con su sueño. Por el momento, quiere ampliar el negocio con solo sus productos para seguir sustentando su hogar y salir adelante con su pequeño que el próximo año entrará al estudiar.
texts.en:
Upon arriving at Martha´s business, one finds not only excellent bottled honey for sale, but a comforting smile that welcomes you, assuring you of good service that is recognized by the whole city.

This single mother, age 27, has been a merchant for 10 years, since she decided to help her mother at home. Now, with a two-year-old son, she feels more than inspired to grow.

Martha dreams of establishing her own shop where she can sell her product better. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy honey and thus diversify the types and sizes of the bottles she sells. In this way, she will increase her clientele, which will allow her to start to save up for her dream. 

For the moment, she wants to expand the business with only product, so she can continue supporting her household and getting ahead with her little boy, who will begin his studies next year.

loans.use: to buy honey

loans.name: Zahoor

texts.en: Zahoor is 59 years old and married. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchases for many years with her husband. Zahoor fully supports and assists her husband in meeting their household expenses. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 25 years old and married. She has been doing a business of bangles sales and other jewelry items for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit.  Abida has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles and other jewelry items in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles and other jewelry items in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate healthier source of income.

loans.name: Kuibanga Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Kuibanga Women Group. She is 45 years old, married and a mother of three. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management has helped her realize her strengths and she is engaged in a full-time business of vegetable and dairy farming, supplying milk to the local dairy. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure for the crops. She hopes this will improve her crop yield and thus, more income, which she plans to use in catering to her children's school fees.

Mary is happy because of Kiva’s financial support.

loans.use: To buy manure that will improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Nañe Mbaeteete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñane Mbaeteete  está en su ciclo 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, 22 integrantes de las cuales todas trabajan en variadas actividades. Todas tienen  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un nivel de pobreza extremo.
Fatima se dedica al humilde oficio de la venta de remedios naturales, comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, cuando sale en busca de sus remedios, es un trabajo duro y sacrificado, pero lo hace para poder dar y ayudar a su familia en todo lo que ella puede de acuerdo a sus posibilidades.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named Ñane Mbaeteete is in its 14th cycle of the Women's Committee Program. There are 22 members, all of whom work in various occupations. All of them have taken the "Poverty Stoplight" questionnaire where they are all found below the poverty line, in other words at a level of extreme poverty.

Fatima earns a living in the humble occupation of selling natural medicines. She mentions that everyday she begins working very early when she heads out in search of medicines. It is a hard job that requires sacrifice, but she does it to be able to help her family and give everything she can according to her possibilities.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of natural medicines to sell. She is thankful for the the opportunity that they are all receiving to be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Nueva Esperanza, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, ellas están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Sra. Luz es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica, a ayudar a su marido que cuenta con un taller de moto y representan a una marca importante de motos, ella vive con sus hijos y su marido en casa propia que con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al trabajo de ambos pudieron tener.
Luz pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para motos, de manera a poder usarlo en su taller de motos, y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group of women is called "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope). They are united and supportive of each other, and they work together on activities. They are happy, and they feel the support of the women committee program as they increase their earnings and become more and more independent.  

Luz is the president of the group. She makes a living helping her husband, who has a motorcycle workshop. They represent an important motorcycle brand. She lives with her children and her husband in their own home, which they were able to obtain with great effort and as a result of her and her husband's work.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles, which she will use in the motorcycle workshop in order to meet the demands of customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
l grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante son de la Ciudad de Itá, y  se encuentran mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de la ayuda mutua.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Justina, quien es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, ella procura siempre tener una buena variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que se fue haciendo de clientela y hoy día ya es muy conocida en el barrio.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, enlatados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Katupyry" is in its ninth loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program, where all the members work and help each other to get ahead. The members are from the city of Itá, and they are improving their living conditions through mutual help.

One person worthy of mention is Justina, who is a woman devoted to her family. Every day she starts her work very early in the morning. She always tries to have a good assortment of products to offer to her customers. She mentions that she started with a small business, but she began getting more customers, and now she is well-known in the neighbourhood.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store such as vegetables, fruits, baked goods, canned goods, and the like. This way, she will be able to continue with her sales—as she has been doing—and keep on striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPAQUITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magdalena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de repuestos de auto, servicio de transporte, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magdalena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de autos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, ya que desde niña ella apoyaba a su padre en su negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente para apoyar a su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos de autos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Alpaquitas group will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Andes Focus Center. It's made up of eight members and directed by a board where Magdalena is the president. 

The members of the group have various businesses; among them are food sales, blanket sales, car parts sales, transportation services, jacket sales and clothing sales.

The loan they're taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Magdalena is a member. She said the first time she joined Pro Mujer, she was invited by the institution's large promotion in her area. 

Now, she has a business selling car parts, a business she learned from her family, as she learned from her father at a very young age. Over time, she decided to start an independent business to support her family.

She loan she's now taking out is to grow capital (purchasing spare car parts wholesale), which she'll get from larger sellers in the city of La Paz and later sell at her point of sale. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, as she's currently single.

When asked what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy auto parts wholesale.

loans.name: Gitutha Maisha Bora Group

texts.en:
As a married parent with five children, George, holding a passbook in the photo, is 56 years old and a member of Gitutha Maisha Bora Self Help Group. He works hard to support his family. He does poultry, dairy and vegetable farming on the family farm. George is taking a loan to purchase manure to boost his vegetable farming business, which he has been operating for the last two years. He has gained consistent customers in his enterprise so he needs to meet the rising demand. He looks forward to an improved harvest and thus, more income.  He hopes this will go a long way in helping him support his family 

George is happy for Kiva and the support from his lender.

loans.use: To buy manure that will boost vegetable farming.

loans.name: Dasabhuja Shg Group

texts.en:
Ahalya is a 24-year-old lady currently engaged in vegetable cultivation and vegetable selling. She cultivates and sells vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, ladyfingers (okra), bitter gourds, bottle gourds, cabbage etc. From this activity, she is able to make 3,000 INR per month. 

Along with 14 other women from her village, she created a Self Help group called "Dasabhuja SHG", and Ahalya is the president of this group. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Ahalya. The group is made up of members having a purpose to help and support each other in their business activities and in their personal lives. All the group members are engaged in different activities to make some money for their household expenses. 

Ahalya lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her four children who are in school. Her husband was a farmer; currently he is not able to work as he met with an accident over one year ago and lost his memory and vision. Now Ahalya has to take on all the family's responsibilities. Ahalya needs more income to take care of her family, especially her husband. Ahalya, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 300,000 INR. Ahalya will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mística está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cuatro señoras se encuentran en un nivel de pobreza extremo.
La Sra. Paola es integrante de este grupo, es una persona muy trabajadora que se ha abierto camino gracias a su esfuerzo y entusiasmo. Se dedica a la venta de perfumes que ella misma compra y que después sale a vender de forma ambulante, y en lo cual le está yendo muy bien pues ya tiene mucha clientela.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group "Rosa Mistica" is in cycle number 3 of the women committee program, in which they all work and help each other move forward. They are taking poverty elimination surveys, and four of the women are currently at a level of extreme poverty.

Paola is a member of this group. She is a very hard-working person who has made her way as a result of her effort and enthusiasm. She makes a living selling perfumes that she buys herself and later sells as a street vendor. She is doing very well because she already has a large customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMANUEL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Birginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de rellenos, venta de edredones, venta de api (bebida tradicional), venta de edredones, venta de anticuchos (comida tradicional), venta de bisutería, venta de artículos por catálogo, pulpería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Birginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió recientemente al observar el amplio comercio que tenía estos productos vio la oportunidad del negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de edredones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “EMANUEL” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the group Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of 8 members and led by a board of directors, of which Birginia is the President. 

The businesses that the communal bank members take part in are varied. Among them are: sales of padding, quilts, api (a traditional drink), anticuchos (a traditional food), jewelry, and catalogue items, as well as a grocery store.

The loan they will get out is to benefit microentrepreneurs in the group where Birginia is a member. She states that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, entering with an invitation from a massive promotion of the institution that was carried out in her area.

Currently, she has a business selling quilts. She states that she learned this business recently. After observing the great sales that these products have, she saw a business opportunity. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital to buy quilts wholesale. She will acquire them from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and then sell them in her sales booth. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she has a common-law marriage and four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area, and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quilts

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de la ropa que vende, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yesenia, who is 33 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For eight years, her occupation has been clothing sales, her business is located in the local market, and she has many clients because of the quality of the clothes that she sells. With the profit she makes, she manages to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothing for women and men at wholesale, and be able to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for women and men at wholesale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Grace. She is 54 years old and has five children. She is married and lives together with her family. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She is happy for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training she received, which equipped her with knowledge on enterprise and financial management. She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her dairy farming business by buying quality fodder that will improve production. This will lead to an income increment from improved sales. She intends to use part of her profit to provide food for the family and to pay school fees for her children.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy quality fodder that will improve productivity.

loans.name: Hussen

texts.en:
Hussen is 44 years old and a father of three children, living with them in Sana'a city, Yemen. He has been running a small grocery for four months. The profits from this business are small because his grocery store lacks of a lot of food materials. He works hard to be able to face all the demands of his customers. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy different kinds of food materials, items, and goods for his grocery.

Hussen looks forward to expanding his business by opening another grocery.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of food materials, items, and goods for his grocery.

loans.name: Vision Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Vision Women Group. She is married and blessed with six children. Her economic activity is dairy farming and poultry keeping. Training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her to manage her business well. She needs a loan to buy both dairy and poultry feed. This will help boost cows and chicken production leading to more milk and eggs to supply to the market. She hopes that the income level from her business will increase in order to meet family needs such as school fees for her children, good clothing and food.

Margaret is very grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the help and support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy and poultry feed to help boost productivity.

loans.name: Solai Rabbit Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Wanjohi, a member of Solai Rabbit Farmers Self Help Group. He is 54 years old, married and has seven children. Three of his children are in primary school and the rest have completed schooling. He is a tailor. He is borrowing a loan to expand his business by adding more stock of textile fabric and sewing threads. He hopes this will enable him to meet customers' rising demands and therefore increase his income. He will, therefore, be able to improve his family's living standards by providing a quality education and better medical care.

Wanjohi is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: To buy more stock of textile fabric and sewing thread that will help meet his customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a repeat borrower having borrowed five times from UGAFODE Microfinance. He is married and has three children who are all in school. Vincent is a 46-year-old businessman who started his business in 2004 with the purpose of making enough profit to pay the school fees for his children and also to cater to other needs of his family. 

Vincent trades in firewood, which is his major source of income alongside tea growing. Vincent is a very hardworking man who works six days a week and eight hours per day. His business is located in Tekateka-Nshumi in Bushenyi District and his major customers are mainly the nearby schools and hotel where he supplies the firewood. 

Vincent's future hopes include educating all his children so that they get better jobs and are able to earn a living by themselves. He would like to use the 4,000,000 UGX loan to buy trees, which he hopes to split into firewood to sell. Vincent’s main challenge is cold weather, which does not permit the firewood to dry in time, but he has high hopes that he will overcome this if he gets a loan. He is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy trees for splitting into firewood to sell

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is 21 years old and is studying for a degree in the English language. She lives in Zarqa with her family of six people, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow. 

Zain dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and give her family the things that they were not able to have. She requested a loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Felister, who is twenty-six years old, married and blessed with two children.

Felister is a vegetable farmer. She is taking a Kiva loan so as to buy fertilizers and planting seeds. This will help to boost her vegetable farm produce for the market, thus leading to more income. This will enable her to cater to her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Felister is grateful to Kiva for assisting her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds that will boost her vegetable farm

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 20-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a humble house. His father is an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. Basel would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed items.

Basel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar water heating system and tank. By taking this loan, Basel will decrease their electricity usage. 

Basel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system and tank

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa lives in Jarash, she is 18 years old, and she has five brothers.

Safaa is tired of the political and security situation in the world these days. She finished her high school and decided to study political management to work in this field, to participate and to express her opinion. Perhaps she will be one of the persons who finds solutions for the world situation.

Safaa`s family faced financial difficulties, therefore they could not cover her university fees. Because of that, she applied for an education loan to help her to pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 de las 18 señoras se encuentran en un nivel de pobreza extremo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que esta en un novel de pobreza extrema. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por ser alguien en la vida. Ella se dedica a vender prendas, y poco a poco quiere ir creciendo para poder dar lo mejor a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, y de esa forma poder tener una mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, y satisfacer sus pedidos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Activas" is in its second loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program, where all the members are committed to work and help each other to get ahead. They are taking part in the poverty elimination survey, which shows that 6 out of the 18 members are living in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Maria, who came out with a poverty level of one in her survey. This means that she is living in extreme poverty. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person, who strives to make something of herself. She makes a living selling clothes and, slowly but surely, wants to grow her business to be able to provide the best for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of clothes. This way, she will be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and satisfy their requests.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nimia Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nimia Celinda; la socia sigue trabajando en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua ejerciendo su profesión de docente ,la socia se siente a gusto con su trabajo ya que le gusta trabajar como docente, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank "SAN VALENTIN."  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco

The member's name is Señora Nimia Celinda, and she continues working in one of the area high schools.  She feels grateful for the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.  She continues in her profession of teaching.  She is comfortable with her job as a teacher.  She wants to be able to continue working in this job to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan to buy teaching materials.

loans.use: To buy teaching materials.

loans.name: Nanci Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su  negocio de venta de cereales como trigo, cebada y quinua, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo al por mayor a los diferentes mercados que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales como trigo, quinua entre otros.
texts.en:
Nanci belongs to the communal bank "San Valentín."  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belong to the Province and Department of Cusco.

Nanci continues with her business of selling cereals such as wheat, barley, and quinoa.  She feels grateful for the loan, and she promises to meet her monthly payments.  She continues selling wholesale to different markets that request her.  She takes her time with her business which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts towards her business everyday.  Thus she gets her family ahead.

Nanci is requesting a loan to buy cereals such as wheat, quinoa, among others.

loans.use: To buy cereals like wheat, quinoa, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo casacas, chompas ,polos entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the San Valentin communal bank.  She continues making a living through her business of clothing sales.  She feels thankful for the loan, and commits herself to meeting her repayments.  The member will continue selling jackets, sweaters, polos and others to all clients who request them, such as friends, relatives and others.  The member hopes to be able to continue working to be able to continue helping her family.  The member will use this loan to buy jackets and more.

loans.use: to buy coats, among other things

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
