La A.C. “WIPALA” iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Toribia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de hierbas, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de chompas, venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de enaguas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Toribia es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es  cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al apoyar el negocio de su madre, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Wipala" will begin the twenty-first cycle of Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes (Focal Center of the Andes).  It is composed of eight members, and is headed by a board where the Señora Toribia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association do are varied among them: selling herbs, selling electronics, selling sweaters, selling blankets, selling furniture, selling petticoats, selling food, selling beverages.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small micro-businesses where the Señora Toribia is integral.  She indicates that it is the fourth year since she joined Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of a friend who is a customer of the institution.  Today she has a business that sells furniture.  She says that she learned this business many years ago supporting her mother's business.  Later she decided to start an independent business.
 
The loan that she is requesting is to increase the capital (buy furniture wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers from the city of La Paz, and later she will sell it at her stall.  This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy furniture wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 7 años de edad a la venta de ropa para niños vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 39 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son. She has sold clothing for children since she was 7 years old. She works as a street vendor in the different markets. With the sales that she makes, she manages to get ahead. She is applying for a loan to purchase more clothing wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 46 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija quien estudia actualmente, ella posee desde hace 10 años una tienda ubicada  en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Silvia, who is 46 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughter, who is now in school. For 10 years she has had a store located in her place of residence. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay the expenses of her household. She is applying for a loan to purchase soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. for her store

loans.name: Bunazira

texts.ru: Буназира досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 13 коров. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Буназира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией. Доходы от кредита Буназира планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bunazira used her previous loan as intended and paid it off ahead of time.  She thanks Kiva, as well as everyone who helped her get this financing.  Her farming business now comprises 13 cows, and Bunazira makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).  She is now taking a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum Bank CJSC, to buy cows for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of farm animals.  She also wants to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Koroye Kuo Group

texts.en:
Isaac, 62 years old, is a cocoa farmer who comes from Krowfofordo, in the Assin North District, Central Region of Ghana. He is married and has 6 children aged between 17 and 27 years. Isaac has 35 years of experience as a cocoa farmer. He also farms plantain and maize, which he sells to local market women in the village. The dry cocoa beans are sold to purchasing clerks who are also in the village. According to Isaac, his parents introduced him to farming because there was not enough money to provide for his education. 

Isaac participated in community education within his village on reducing deforestation, clean cook stoves, and indoor and outdoor air pollution. Isaac and his group members decided to resort to the use of the Elsa Clean Cook Stove to replace the use of wood fuel in their 3-stove open fire stove to improve their health and save the trees within the forests of their village. Isaac needs micro-loan assistance to be able to purchase the stove. He is grateful to all his micro-lenders for saving him from traveling a long distance in search of firewood for cooking and for protecting the forest within his village.

loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Koris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORIS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de bisutería, venta de ropa, servicio de construcción, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mabel es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bisutería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al observar la disponibilidad de tiempo que dejaba para su familia decide implementar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de bisutería por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una de las clientes, la misma tuvo que marcharse con premura a su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Koris" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional center. The group is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Mabel is the president. The members' businesses are varied. Among them are selling food, selling jewelry, selling clothing, construction service, and selling jackets.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-business owners, of whom Señora Mabel is one. She indicates that this is the second year that she has joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She now has a business of selling jewelry. She lets it be known that she learned this business a number of years ago. On noticing the availability of time that remained for her family, she decided to set up this business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy jewelry wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz and later will sell at her sales stall. This form of work allows her to generate income to help her family economically, since she is married and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

One of the members is absent from the photo. She had to leave urgently to go to her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wholesale fresh cheese, beans, corn, pork rind, etc.

loans.name: Soila Ruvenia

texts.es: Doña Soila tiene 52 años de edad quien no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar es madre soltera de 8 hijos de los cuales solo una vive con ella la cual trabaja en otras propiedades cuando hay buena temporada para ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su madre pues con ellas también viven 2 nietos y el yerno. Durante nueve años doña Soila se ha dedicado a este rubro el cual aprendió por iniciativa propia y sus padres le heredaron la tierra que trabaja la cual está ubicada a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitacion por lo cual se traslada caminando. Para llevar a cabo un magnífico trabajo ella tiene que pagar la mano de obra calificada y dar a su propiedad una buena atención pues los ingresos que ella percibe son generados de esta actividad. Es por eso que en esta ocasión ella solicita apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas y el pago de mano de obra dar la abonada que sus plantas necesitan y el mantenimiento en general. Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en el trabajo que realiza y lleva a cabo pues su experiencia habla por sí misma y cada día que pasa ella se esmera porque su negocio crezca y este mejor pues como productora de café sus metas están basadas en el mejoramiento de su propiedad y el crecimiento de la misma para generar mayores ingresos al momento de la recolecta del grano y ofrecer a sus nietos una mejor calidad de vida al igual que a sus hijos dar un patrimonio digno.
texts.en:
Doña Soila is 52 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to study.  She is a single mother of eight children of whom only one lives with her.  This daughter works on other properties when it is good weather to help with her mother's household expenses since two of Doña Soila's grandchildren and son-in-law also live with her.

For nine years Doña Soila has been devoted to this line of work that she learned on her own initiative, and her parents willed her the land that she works which is located 100 meters from her house, which she gets to by walking.

To carry out a magnificent job she has to pay for skilled labor and give her property good care since she knows that the revenue is made in this job.  This is why she is requesting help financially to buy fertilizers, to pay labor to spread the manure that her plants need, and for maintenance in general.

She has high hopes for the job that she does and carries out, since her experience speaks for itself.  Each day she works hard so that her business will grow and be better.  As a producer of coffee, her goal are based in the improvement of her property and in the growth of it to generate bigger revenues at the time of harvest; and to offer to her grandchildren a better quality of life as well as leave her children a dignified heritage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and skilled labor to work at her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Tupac Katari Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TUPAC KATARI” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de disfraces, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cotillones, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas tradicionales); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el capital que dejo su madre, quien anteriormente vendía esta mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de polleras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aun es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Tupac Katari” will begin the third cycle in ProMujer. As part of the regional office in the Andes, it is made up of 8 members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Veronica is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied, among them there are: pollera sales, costume sales, convenience store, food sales, sale of party favors, and sale of fried potatoes with hotdogs. 
The loan they will get will benefit the microentrepreneurs in the group where Veronica is a member. She says that this is the first year that she belongs to ProMujer. She joined because she was invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling polleras (traditional Andean skirts). She says that she started this business with the capital that her mother left for her, who previously sold this merchandise. 
The loan she will get now is to increase capital (purchasing polleras at wholesale) that she will get from sellers in the city of La Paz and afterwards will sell in her sales stall. This way of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is still single. 
When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she answers that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase polleras (traditional Andean skirts) at wholesale.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 52 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Бактыгул среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Бактыгул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 4 коровы, 25 овец и 3 лошади, также земельный надел мерою 2,9 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень, картофель и эспарцет. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Бактыгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков. Бактыгул намерена улучшить благосостояние своей семьи и доходы от кредита направлять на развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul is 52 years, married, and has two children. Baktygul has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she grows farm produce and raises livestock, having launched this business 29 years ago. Thanks to Baktygul's persistence, resolve and hard work at present she has four cows, 25 sheep and three horses. She also has a land plot of 2.9 ha [7 acres], where she grows barley, potatoes and sainfoin [a plant used for animal feed]. She sells milk daily. Her monthly income from her farm is about 10,000 KGS. Baktygul has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 75,000 KGS to buy steers. Baktygul intends to improve her family's life conditions and invest the revenues from her loan in further business development.

loans.use: to buy additional steers in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Milton Rene

texts.es: Milton de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee desde hace 10 años una tienda en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa una variedad de productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milton, 45 years old, lives in his own house with his family.  For ten years he has had a store in his place of residence where he sells a variety of products.  With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to pay for some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. and, therefore, be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy soups, eggs, basic grain, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Twungubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Claudette  fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 44 ans et est mariée à Daniel, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 4 à 24 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, pains ...) depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des articles de sa boutique en grande quantité (riz, haricot,pains,…) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Claudette is a part of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 44 years old and is married to Daniel, a driver. Together, they have nine children between the ages of 4 and 24, all in school. She has run a shop selling rice, beans, bread, etc. for 7 years. She is on her eighth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of items for her shop (rice, beans, bread, etc.) to resell at a profit. In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children in school.

loans.use: she is going to increase her capital and buy  some articles in great quantities for her shop (rice, beans, bread, etc.) to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Gpt Wéral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Wéral rassemble 5 personnes dont 3 hommes et deux femmes qui logent dans le même quartier.
La présidente, madame Kadiatou, s’active dans la vente d’œufs. Elle faisait cette activité dans une autre région depuis des années, a arrêté un temps pour se relancer dès qu’elle que possible, il y a juste un an.
Kadiatou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont la tranche d’âge est comprise entre 18 et 14 ans. 
Elle a prévu d’acheter 100 tablettes d’œufs pour revendre aux restaurants, aux vendeurs de petit déjeuner, aux boutiques. Son système est de livrer le produit, et de repasser quelques jours pour encaisser. Kadiatou appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison, étant donné que son mari est hors du pays.  
Kadiatou rêve d’élever des poulets pondeurs pour pouvoir maximiser son profit, pour cela, elle aura besoin de l’appui financier d’une institution financière comme IMCEC.
texts.en:
The Wéral group is composed of five members: three men and two women, all from the same neighborhood.
The group's leader, Ms. Kadiatou, works selling eggs. She used to work in this line of business in a different region of the country for years. After having to put her business on hold for some time, she  re-launched it just a year ago,  as soon as she could.

Kadiatou is married and has three children ranging from 14 to 18 years of age. She plans to buy 100 cartons of eggs to resell to restaurants,   vendors selling breakfast foods, and   grocery stores. She usually delivers  her wares first and stops by a few days later to collect her payment. Kadiatou helps her husband support the household, given that her husband is currently out of the country.

Kadiatou's goal is to be able to keep her own laying hens in order to maximize her profits. In order to do that she will need support from a financial institution such as IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy eggs to resell to grocery stores, restaurants etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa su hijo y su hijastra, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizza desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes pueblos aledaños y también en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con su trabajo como: harina, quesillo, tomates, jamón, peperoni entre otros, y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Victor, who is 38 years old, lives in his own home with his wife, his son, and his step-daughter. He has worked making and selling pizzas for several years. He sells his products in different adjoining villages, and also where he lives. He has many clients because of his good prices. He is asking for a loan to buy the necessary ingredients to continue with his work, such as: flour, fresh cheese, tomatoes, ham, pepperoni, among others, and be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, fresh cheese, tomatoes, ham, pepperoni, among others.

loans.name: Zheenkul

texts.ru: Жээнкул, 54 года, замужем, трое взрослых детей, которые проживают отдельно. У Жээнкул среднее образование, она работает уборщицей в школе. Также она в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. Жээнкул известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит хорошую ежемесячную прибыль в размере 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жээнкул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и корма для животных. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена отремонтировать ее дом.
texts.en: Zheenkul is 54 years old, married, and she has three adult children who live independently.  She has a secondary education and she works as a cleaning lady in a school.  As an additional source of income, she is also involved in agriculture.  She currently owns three cows.  Zheenkul is known as a woman of principle; she is honest, decent and reliable.  At this moment, her activity brings her a good monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to buy additional livestock and fodder.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to develop her farming business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and fodder in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
The person  in the photo is Leah, who is married and blessed with two children. She is a poultry farmer who also operates a business selling second-hand clothes. She is borrowing a  Kiva loan to increase her stock of second-hand clothes. She hopes her business will thrive, providing more income to cater to her family's needs.

Leah is so happy that her business will expand.

loans.use: to increase her stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, glue, varnish, reed, and other items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Irene. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a poultry farmer and also farms maize, beans, and vegetables. She is taking out a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will help boost her vegetable farming and thus increase her supply for the market, which will generate more income. She plans to plough back some profits into her farm so that in long run she will achieve her dream of large-scale farming.

Irene is grateful to Kiva for assisting her with expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to help boost farming.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rahab, who is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain skills in enterprise development.

Rahab is a poultry farmer who also farms maize, beans and vegetables. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed, as this will help improve her production. She plans to use her income to cater to her family's basic needs.

Rahab is so happy for Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed that will help improve her productivity.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nueves Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maruja es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño, venta de refrescos y gelatinas, venta de tucumanas, servicio de café, venta de comida, servicio de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maruja es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al observar la amplitud de mercado de este producto decide emprenderlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pescado por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias no esta presente en la imagen, la misma se marcho por razones personales con urgencia a su domicilio
texts.en:
The comunal bank “Virgen de las Nieves” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer. As part of the regional office in Copacabana, it is made up of 8 members and is managed by a board of directors of which Maruja is the president. The businesses that the members in the communal bank have are varied, among them are: chuño sales (artisanal freeze-dried potato traditionally made in Peru), sale of sodas and jellies, sale of tucumadas (a meat-filled pastry), coffee services, food sales, and construction work. 
The loan they will take out will benefit the microentrepreneurs of the group of which Maruja is a member. She says this is the first time she joins Pro Mujer, she joined because of the invitation of a mass promotion that the institution made in her area. Currently she has a business where she sells fish. She says that she learned this business several years ago. After seeing how large the market was for this product, she decided to begin her business.
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital (purchase of fish at wholesale) that she will get from the sellers in La Paz and will later sell at her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is still single. 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training that the institution offers. 
In the photo, one of the members is not present, she had to leave because of urgent personal reasons at her home.

loans.use: to purchase fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirian de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 10 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Mirian está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Mirian, who is 42 years old, lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked in tailoring for 10 years. Her sewing workshop is located in her residence and she has many clients because of the quality of her clothing. Mirian is asking for a loan to purchase thread, needles, a selection of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc, to be able to continue with her work, which generates good income.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, a selection of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Leonicia  Gumercinda

texts.es: Leonicia vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 6 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leonicia lives in her own home with her husband and her son. For six years she has had a small store located in her place of residence. She has many clients because of her good prices and her kindness when making a sale. She is asking for a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, pastries, etc., and be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Young Stars S.h.g. Group

texts.en:
The lady holding a passbook in the photo is Caroline, who is 53 years old, married, and living with her husband. She is a mother of three children and a member of Young Stars S.H.G. Group. She has been trained in entrepreneurial skills and prudent financial management by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa.

Caroline operates a clothing sales enterprise and wants to expand it, so she decided to apply for a loan to purchase more stock for her business. She has been operating the business for the last two years, has garnered consistent customers, and has thus earned more income.  She hopes that her business will help her support her children's education.
 
Caroline is happy with Kiva and its lenders for their great support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Grace. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She is engaged in a full-time business of dairy farming.

Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s trainings have helped Grace realize her strength in business. She is taking out a Kiva loan to buy quality fodder for her dairy cows, which will increase their milk production. She hopes this will improve her income and put her in a position to provide a better education for her children.

Grace is very happy with Kiva as she will be able to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy quality fodder, which will help improve milk production.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 20 years old and is studying for a degree in special needs education. She lives in Jarash, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow. Islam dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her education and household expenses. 

Islam is requesting an education loan to help her pay her fees and complete her studies. She hopes to graduate as soon as possible to achieve her dreams in helping people who really need help.

loans.use: To pay her fees and complete her studies.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lucy, who is 31 years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her husband and their children. She is a dairy farmer. She has applied for a loan to buy a water tank for harvesting water for both domestic and animal use. This will ensure her cows are healthy, thus producing a consistent milk supply leading to a stable income. This will help her provide basic needs for her family with ease.

Lucy is very happy for Kiva as she will to be able to expand her dairy farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for both domestic and animal use.

loans.name: Jossphine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jossphine. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children living with her and her husband. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to be trained on savings and financial management. She does vegetable farming to earn a living.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and pesticides to help boost her crop yield. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest and thus more income. She hopes this will help improve her family’s living standards, such as better medical care and quality education.

Jossphine is grateful to Kiva and the entire lender community for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Бактыгул - среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году, благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 овец, а на земельной доле мерою 0,67 Га она выращивает клевер и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые, вкусные овощи. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на покупку дополнительной земельной доли.
texts.en: Baktygul is 32 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education.  As an extra source of income for her family, Baktygul has raised livestock and grown crops since 2009.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has five sheep and a .67 hectare plot of land, on which she grows clover and corn to use on the farm.  With the goal of developing her business further, Baktygul has turned to "Bai-Tushum" bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizer so she can grow tasty, organic vegetables.  She plans on using the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock on the farm and to purchase an additional plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Nyame Wo Tumi Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the Nyame Wo Tumi (translation: God Great) group. They live in the same area and sell footwear, second hand clothing and slippers. 

Comfort is a wife and mother who sells slippers. She is requesting 2,500 GHS to buy more slippers to sell to customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband in managing their expenses. She has more than 16 years experience in this business and is applying for her seventh loan with ID-Ghana. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. 

The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principles and promises to utilize this total loan of GHS 4,800 judiciously. In the future, and with the help of the institution, Comfort would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy more slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 12 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de shampoo, cremas, lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Sandra, who is 40 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She has worked in the sale of personal use products for 12 years. She has many clients because of the quality of her products and the good prices. With what she obtains from her sales, she can settle some household expenses. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of shampoo, creams, lotions, deodorants, perfumes, etc., at wholesale to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, creams, lotions, deodorants, perfumes, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, 54 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a member of Munyaka Progressive Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training in enterprise management.

Peter does small scale vegetable farming where he plants kale, cabbages and snow peas. He is borrowing money to boost his farming by buying manure and fertilizer to improve his crop production. He looks forward to a bountiful harvest and thus more income, which he plans to use to provide better education and basic needs for the family. He is happy with Kiva and all lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer that will help improve his crop productivity.

loans.name: Maida Ester

texts.es: Maida de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ambos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materia prima arroz, frijoles, carnes, pollos, maíz, verduras, etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas últimamente y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maida, 53, lives in her own house with her two children who both work and help out economically.  She sells food near her home which is in a very busy area and is able to support the family this way.

She is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, meats, chicken, corn, vegetables, etc. as sales volume has been high lately and she is able to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, beans, meats, chicken, corn, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats and some cows to add to her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more smart secondhand bed sheets and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Munyaka Progressive Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Macharia, a member of Munyaka Progressive Self Help Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the training on enterprise development.

Macharia is married and living with his wife and children. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training by gaining good entrepreneurial and financial management skills. He does both dairy and vegetable farming of snow peas, potatoes, carrots and cabbages. He is borrowing money to buy a calf to help expand his dairy farming. He believes when the calf matures it will give him more returns and provide the basic needs for the family, especially food, school fees and clothing for the children. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support

loans.use: To buy a dairy calf that will help expand farming.

loans.name: Felex

texts.en:
Felex is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a salon as his main source of income. He started this business so as to sustain himself and cause development at his home. He has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman, though he has limited capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more modern shaving machines, shampoo and spare parts to use in his salon and boost his business.

loans.use: to buy more modern shaving machines, shampoo and spare parts to use in his salon

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza has added 25 goats to her existing herd, yet she has no money to pay for them. Thus, with your financial help of 250,000 ALL that she is requesting from you, she will pay off this debt owed to some distant relatives.

Mimoza is a villager and a married mother of two children (ages 14 and 18) who does agriculture/livestock work to earn an income for her family. All in all now, she’s got 70 goats. Fifty-five of them were purchased with the money Mimoza’s husband earned from his seasonal work as a goat keeper in Greece, and 25 with money they got from relatives with a promise to repay them within a year. When her husband goes to Greece to work for three months, Mimoza and their 14-year-old son take the goats to graze; otherwise, it is her husband who does it.

loans.use: to repay a loan she used to purchase 25 goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her carrot crop.

loans.name: Guadalupe Concepcion

texts.es: Guadalupe de 57 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo quien estudia actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fardos de ropa para continuar con sus ventas y así generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 57, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her son who is a student.  She sells used clothing from home and earns enough to cover some of her expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy packages of clothing to continue her sales activity and generate more profit.

loans.use: To buy packages of clothing.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has lived in a Palestinian Refugee camp in Lebanon his entire life. He is a 37-year-old Palestinian, he is married with three children and resides in a very cramped apartment with his four family members. 

Every day of the week, Youssef transports students, employees and others from one place to another seeking a small daily income to provide his beloved family with a good standard of living. He works very hard at his job and has never missed a day. His income is barely able to feed his large family and each day is a continuous struggle. 

Youssef is worried about his home's uncomfortable living conditions since the ceiling has cracks due to the humidity, which lets the house fill with rain water.

Due to this, Youssef is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to make the necessary repairs to his house's rooftop - especially for the current winter season since it is filling with rain.
 
He is certain that these changes will significantly improve his family's living situation. His previous loan from Al Majmoua was invested in making necessary repairs to his car and to develop his business properly.
 
His dream is to one day earn enough money in order to improve his family's living condition and provide them with the best education.

loans.use: to provide the necessary maintenance to his house's rooftop.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Las Esmeraldas” y  la conforman  08 socias trabajadoras y solidarias. Felicitas de 53 años de edad, es  separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio (librería). Como actividad secundaria Felicitas vende productos de belleza y cosméticos. Su mayor deseo es implementar su negocio con más variedades de productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, fólderes, lapiceros y plumones.  El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. Felicitas es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Esmeraldas" communal bank. It has eight hard-working and supportive members, one of whom is 53-year-old Felicitas. She is separated and has one son who is dependent on her. Felicitas makes a living selling stationery. As a secondary business, she also sells beauty products and cosmetics.

Felicitas' biggest wish is to offer a greater variety of products. She is applying for this loan in order to buy notebooks, folders, pens and marker pens.

The "Las Esmeraldas" group thanks Kiva lenders for this loan.

In the photo, Felicitas is third from the right and wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, folders, pens and marker pens.

loans.name: Carlos Joel

texts.es:
Carlos Joel tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia junto a su madre en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila, la población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de entretenimiento musical, es gestor de una reconocida orquesta de Cayaltí. Es conocido en su distrito por la actividad que realiza y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mezcladora (aparato electrónico) para producción musical así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales equipos de sonido. Con ello Carlos Joel espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Joel, 26, is single and lives in his own house with his mother in the district of Cayaltí, which is in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.  He lives in a community where life is calm and the locals work in commerce, agriculture and livestock farming.

Carlos Joel is a musical entertainment provider and he manages a well-known orchestra in Cayaltí.  He is known in the district for his services and enjoys very good personal and professional references in the area.  The loan he is requesting is buy an electronic sound mixer for music production and to pay for sound equipment maintenance.  He hopes to provide better customer service and generate more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy an electronic sound mixer for music production and to pay for sound equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 30 años a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ya tiene clientes establecidos con lo que obtiene de sus venta logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos y nailon de colores para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 59, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  For 30 years she has been making and selling hammocks.  She has steady customers and is able to earn enough to cover some of the household expenses.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy colored cord and nylon to continue her work and improve her income.

loans.use: To by colored cord and nylon.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela de 56 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas en los ultimos meses y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gabriela is 56 years old and a widow. She lives in a house that she owns and has a small shop in her home. She has many customers, particularly neighbours, and earns a profit that allows her to get ahead. Gabriela is applying for another loan in order to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and more as her sales have gone very well in the past few months and, as a result, she can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and more.

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Gladys Ruth se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de niños,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys Ruth continues working as a teacher. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to have a business selling clothes. Gladys is applying for a loan in order to buy a sound system for her house.

Gladys is very happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for her house.

loans.name: Marilyn Liseth

texts.es: Marilyn tiene 23 años de edad y está soltera, actualmente se encuentra laborando como Docente en una reconocida institución educativa ya que termino la carrera que empezó en la universidad “la Cantuta” desde el 2008 hasta el 2012 ahora empezara el programa de titulación en la universidad, es por esto la solicitud del préstamo ya que lo invertirá para pagar a un asesor y para comprar los materiales y textos que necesita para titularse y poder aspirar a obtener cargos más importantes y con mucha responsabilidad. Una de las metas más importantes de Marilyn es implementar un círculo de estudios que ayude el rendimiento académico de los chicos que cursan la primaria en el colegio. Ella se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida al saber que hay personas de buen corazón que apoyan a jóvenes como ella no solamente en superarse sino también en poder cumplir sus sueños, pide encarecidamente que el apoyo continúe.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 23 years old and single. She currently works as a teacher at a well-known educational establishment following completion of her degree for which she studied at the La Cantuta university between 2008 and 2012. Now Marilyn will begin a professional programme at the university. She is therefore applying for a loan that she will use to pay for an evaluation and to buy materials and books that she needs for her studies. Marilyn aspires to more important roles in her work, and with much more responsibility. One of Marilyn's most important goals is to create study groups to help improve pupils' academic abilities. 

Marilyn is very satisfied and grateful to know that good-hearted people are supporting young people like her, not only so that they can do better but so that they can achieve their dreams. Marilyn earnestly requests that this support continue.

loans.use: to cover costs in order to obtain her professional certificate.

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es: Iris de 33 años de edad  vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 6 años en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Iris, 33, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  For six years she has been running a beauty salon in her home and using the profit, and help from her husband, to cover household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to buy beauty salon products like hair conditioners, shampoos, hair clips, scissors and other needed items.  This is to allow her to improve profit and enjoy a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy conditioners, shampoos, hair clips, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Pain Moderne Group

texts.fr: Urbain est commerçant, président d’un groupe de crédits «Pain Moderne», âgé de 43 ans, marié, père de 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont encore gosses. Le client est vendeur  des denrées alimentaires et boisson sucrée. Il étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt de la ville. Il commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Il y a 4 ans qu'il exerce cette activité. Il va s’approvisionner en sacs de farines de maïs, de formant et 50 caisses de sucrés. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Urbain is a merchant and the president of the "Pain Moderne" loan group. He is 43 years old, married, and a father to four children. One of his children goes to school, but the other three are too young. 

The client sells food staples and soft drinks. He displays his goods in a warehouse in the city. He started his business four years ago with funds from his family. He will buy sacks of corn and wheat flour and 50 cases of soft drinks. 

He would like to increase his capital, and to educate, clothe, and feed his children. Finally, he would like to thank Hekima for the empowerment of small, non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy sacks of corn and wheat flour and 50 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es: Rigoberto de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes de carga y de personas en su camión desde hace 14 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 54, lives in his own house with his life partner and thei two children.  For 14 years he has been transporting merchandise and people by truck, serving many steady customers who prefer him because of how responsible he is at the wheel.  He is able to cover the household expenses with the income he earns.

The new loan he is requesting is to buy tires for his truck and pay for vehicle maintenance since this is his only source of income, and so he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Jesus Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de computadora y tambien tiene un trabajo como tecnico de computadoras,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de arreglo de computadoras.La socia solicita el crecito para compras repuestos de computadoras como mouses,teclado y computadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesus Carlos continues with his computer parts business and also works as a computer technician.  His dream is to expand his business to include computer repair.

The loan he is requesting is to buy computer parts, such as mice, keyboards and computers.  The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy computer parts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca continues with her grocery store activity selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and has been in business successfully for five years.  Her dream is to expand the store and she is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Olga Del Carmen

texts.es: Olga de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de quesillo, frijoles, maíz, chicharrón, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya quie le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their daughter. 

She makes a living selling stuffed tortillas. She has been running the business from her house for many years and she manages to pay for some household expenses with her earnings. 

Her business is going very well so he is requesting a new loan to buy wholesale fresh cheese, beans, corn, pork rind etc to carry on selling stuffed tortillas and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fresh cheese, beans, corn and pork rind.

loans.name: Selinda

texts.es: La Sra. Selinda  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la localidad de Taruma del Nunicipio del Torno localidades dedicadas en la gran mayoría a la agricultura, ganadería ,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene estas fechas de fin de año razón por la cual necesita comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda y así abastecerse de variedad de productos para satisfacer a su clientela.
texts.en:
Selinda is still selling basic groceries in her neighbourhood shop which is located in the town of Taruma in the Torno province, where farming and breeding cattle are the main economic activities. 

This is her second loan cycle with the institution and she reports that her last loan went very well. She used it to buy merchandise to stock her shop with things like groceries, candy and soft drinks.

She is requesting this loan to meet the demand from her customers at this time of year, meaning that she needs to buy merchandise to stock her shop and have a large enough variety of products to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her neighbourhood shop.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears livestock and has a farm which helps him earn more income and educate his children. He has a vision of becoming a modern farmer. This has been limited by insufficient funds to practice modern agriculture. With the loan requested, Godfrey intends to buy more cows to add in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Al Amal3 Group

texts.en:
Al Amal3 group members live on the Mount Lebanon. The group is comprised of three unique women whose work varies between services and food production and sales. Two of them are married with children, while the third is a widowed mother. All of the women have been neighbors and best friends for many years and have come to rely on each other significantly. 

Amal is a widowed mother of one child. Her child is enrolled in a private school, so she works hard to make sure she can afford educational fees. Amal's work is mainly based on food production and sales.  She works from home conserving certain vegetables and fruits from one season to another, in addition to preparing delicious homemade jams. In addition to this, she prepares hand made souvenirs and special occasions themes and gifts to ensure that she can expand her family's living and cover their increasing living needs.  Amal participates in several exhibitions, to market her productions and improve her business.

She resorted to these businesses in 2007 after her husband passed away so that she could fend for her child and take him to school. She does all this single handedly. She will use the loan which she is acquiring from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special season production and newly released special occasions themes. Her main customers are neighbors and exhibition visitors. The main challenge is to compete with competitors from nearby villages. Sometimes she or her child might fall sick and on those days she is unable to work so she makes sure to work hard as much as she can when she is in good health to make sure that she can rest when she feels tired. Despite all the challenges, Amal is very hard working and determined to change her future and that of her child by giving him a good education.

Amal is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Heba (sitting in the middle in pink) is a married mother of one child, who has been employed in a research company for three years, and her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her child's school tuition fees. Fadia is the lady at the far right side of the picture.  She is a married mother of one child, who has been working as a tailor from her house for twenty years. Her acquired loan will be invested in renewing her tailoring machine.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special season production and new released special occasions themes

loans.name: Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Minnie (who is holding a passbook in the photo) is 27 years old and works hard to support her family. She is a poultry farmer and also practices dairy farming. Minnie is requesting a loan to purchase animal feeds and mineral supplements, and to hire an extra plot for her fodder farming. She believes this will lead to extra income.  She hopes that her business will help her provide for her family's basic needs with ease.
 Minnie is happy for Kiva and the support of their lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds, mineral supplements and pay for hiring an extra farming land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty six year old hardworking man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells spare parts his primary job and also practices farming to earn extra income.  He earns income so that he can educate his children.  He has inadequate capital but hopes to expand his business and become a very prominent businessman.   

 He needs a loan to buy more spare parts to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to add to his business.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana es una mujer  de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos varones de 23, 19 y 21 años,  su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de manera artesanal (hecho con paja seca e hilo grueso forrados de sacos de yute este producto más conocido como payasas).
Cipriana es paciente, fuerte, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en localidad de Palcoco y el producto terminado lo comercializa en la zona ’16 de julio’ un área comercial caracterizada por su tradicional feria los días jueves y domingo, dónde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un auto.
Cipriana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español para el comercio, Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos; los mayores son los que le ayudan en el trabajo Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas a domicilio. Su negocio es la fabricación y comercialización de colchones hechos de paja y sacos de yute  “difícil de realizar por el arduo trabajo manual que implica…” comenta. Ella desea realizar la compra de materiales para fabricacion colchones por mayor como paja fresca para después hacerla secar y sacos por mayor motivo por el cual solicita el prestamo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
texts.en:
Sipriana is a 43 year old woman. She is married and has three male children of 23, 19 and 21 years of age. Her business is the production of hadcrafted mattresses (made with dried hay and thick thread, lined with burlap sacks, a product better known as ‘payasas’).

Cipriana is patient, strong, a good mother and a hard worker. She works out of a shop in Palcoco and sells the finished product in the ’16 de julio’ (July 16th) zone. This is a commercial district characterized by its traditional market on Thursdays and Sundays where one can find a sewing needle or an automobile. 

Cipriana is dark skinned with long, dark, braided hair. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her children and her husband, who works in construction. The elder ones are those who help her at work. They live in a rented home that has potable water, electricity and in-home gas. Her business is the production and sale of mattresses made from straw and burlap sacks – “difficult work due to the arduous manual labor that it entails” she says.

The reason that she is requesting this loan is that she hopes to purchase the materials to produce the mattresses in bulk, such as fresh hay to put to dry and wholesale sacks. This is her first series of loans with the communal bank in the 12 years she has been doing this work.

loans.use: to buy materials to make mattresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, iron bars, cement and gravel to build a brick house.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta se sigue dedicando al negocio de  fotocopiadora, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener otro negocio de fotocopiadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles  para la fotocopiadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues with her photocopying business. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who wants to get ahead with her business. Her dream is to open another photocopying business.

She is requesting a loan to buy printing paper for the photocopying machine. This loan makes her feel happy, and she promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy printing paper for her photocopying machine.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria se dedica al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Maria works in hardware sales. She sells nails, paint and wire. She works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She has been in this business for some years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her hardware business. She asks for the loan to purchase nails, paint, and wire.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, and wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her carrot plantation.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man and lives in southern Ghour.. He could not complete his education because of financial problems that his family faced. 

He opened a bicycle repair shop to begin increasing his standard of living, and to help his family with household expenses.  He asks for a loan to expand his work and buy some products and tools to sell.

loans.use: to expand his work and buy some products and tools to sell.

loans.name: Doris Glorimar

texts.es: Doris de 38 años de edad vive en  casa propia con su padre, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos preciso, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cosméticos, esmaltes, ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, tientes para el cabello, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Doris, 38 years old, lives in her own house with her father. She works selling personal care products. Her business is located near her house in a heavily trafficked area. She has many customers due to the variety of her products and the good prices. She is asking for a loan to purchase more products such as cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dye, etc. and in this way to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc.

loans.name: Mery Anselma

texts.es:
La socia Mery Anselma se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende chupetes, caramelos y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes, caramelos y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mery Anselma continues with her business selling sweets. She sells lollipops, candies, and cookies, and she works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She has been in this business for 7 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She asks for this loan to purchase lollipops, candies, and cookies.

she is happy for this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase lollipops, candies and cookies.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues with her hardware sales. She sells nails, paint, and wire and she works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She has been in this business for some years now. Her dream is to expand her hardware business. She asks for the loan to purchase nails, paint, and wire. 

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint and wire.

loans.name: Gerson Moises

texts.es:
Gerson, de 20 años de edad, es pescador y su nivel de estudio fue hasta sexto grado, no continuó sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos en que vivían.- Estuvo acompañado y junto con su pareja procrearon una niña, la cual tiene un año de edad.- Ahora Gerson, es un hombre soltero, pues su pareja decidió alejarse de él.

Gerson, vive con sus padres y su hija, la cual depende económicamente de él, actualmente trabaja como guía turistico de lanchas en un lugar en la playa, desde hace 2 años y en sus días libres, va a pescar para el consumo de él y su familia.- 

Este trabajo de lanchero lo aprendió por la misma necesidad que tenían, pues son pobres y necesitaba ayudarle a sus padres en todos los gastos de la casa.- Para llegar a su trabajo Gerson, viaja en bicicleta 5 kilómetros y  trabaja en el horario de 8:00 a.m a 4:00 p.m. 

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar una vaca lechera, para poder tener leche para su familia.

El sueño de Gerson es, comprar un vehículo para poder trasportarse más seguro ya que en donde vive no hay trasporte público.
texts.en:
Gerson, 20 years old, is a fisherman, and his level of education was up to the sixth grade. He didn't continue his schooling due to the lack of economic resources in which he lived. He was partnered and with his partner had a daughter, who is 1 year old. Now Gerson is a single man, since his partner decided to leave him.

Gerson lives with his parents and his daughter, who depends on him economically. He currently has worked as a boat tourist guide in a place on the beach for the past 2 years and, on his free days, he goes fishing to feed himself and his family. 

This work as a boatman he learned due to the need that they had, since they are poor and he needed to help his parents with all the household expenses. To get to work, Gerson goes 5 kilometers by bicycle and he works a schedule of 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

This loan that he is requesting from the institution is to buy a dairy cow to be able to have milk for his family.  

Gerson's dream is to purchase a vehicle to be able to get around more safely, since where he lives there isn't any public transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 31 años a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus venta logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, Maria está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de hilos y nailon de colores para poder seguir con su trabajo ya le que ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: María is 47 years old and a single mother. She lives with her four children in a house of her own. She has been weaving and selling hammocks for thirty-one years. She has many regular customers and the product of her sales helps her cover part of the household expenses. María is asking for a new loan to buy thread and nylon in various colours so as to keep in business, since it has been going very well and she wants to increase her sales and her income even more.

loans.use: to buy thread and nylon in various colours.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 14  años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has had a small shop located in her home for 14 years, where she sells a variety of products such as sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar, etc. She has a lot of customers because of the good prices.

She is applying for a loan to buy more stock in bulk as this is her only source of income and in this way she will be able to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jelly, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es: Zoila de 30 años de edad vive en casa con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Zoila is 30 years old and lives in a house of her own with her family. She has been making and selling tortillas for four years. Her shop is located at her house and she has many customers. She manages to get by with the product of her sales. She asks for a loan in order to buy maize by the quintal and lime in order to keep making tortillas. She hopes for increased sales that would grant her a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy maize by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Virgen Copacabana - Belempata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA - BELEMPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ocobamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata ella es conviviente y tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to communal bank 'Virgen Copacabana – Belempata'. This bank is situated in the Ocobamba district. It belongs to the La Convención province and the department of Cusco.
Fortunata, 41, has a partner and two children. She grows fruit for a living: she owns a plot of land where she grows plantain, coffee, mandarins, and oranges. She works from 6 am to 5 pm. She has been engaged in this activity for several years and it has been going very well. Her dream is to have a bigger plot of land. She asks for the loan to buy seeds and fertiliser.
The other members in the group make their living by selling animal, farming, selling groceries or selling food.
Fortunata is grateful to all who form part of this dream through these means, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Santíago

texts.es:
