Santiago, es 62 años de edad, es empleado y estudió hasta sexto grado, no continuó sus estudios porque decidió mejor aprender a trabajar para ayudarle a su familia en todo los gastos de la casa, está casado y junto con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos mayores, los cuales ya están casados y trabajan para sus propios hogares.

Santiago, vive con su esposa y dos nietos, los cuales dependen de él, su esposa se dedica a la venta de bebidas como, sodas, jugos, frutsis, frescos etc. mientras que Santiago, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de cerdos, desde hace 15 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres.- Para llegar a donde están sus cultivos,  Santiago viaja 2 kilómetros en bicicleta y trabaja de 6:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m todos los días.

El préstamo que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar una novilla embarazada, para poder tener leche para sus nietos y así también logrará aprovechar el pasto que le queda después de su cosecha.

Santiago, sueña con que sus nietos crezcan muy sanos y fuertes y también sueña con comprar un vehículo para transportar su cosecha.
texts.en:
Santiago, 62, is an employee. He studied up to the sixth form only because he decided to quit school to learn a trade in order to help his family with household expenses. He is married and has two adult children, who are also married and work to support their own households.
Santiago thus lives with his wife and two grandchildren, who are dependent on him. The wife sells drinks such as fizzy drinks, box juice, and fresh fruit juice, while Santiago grows maize and raises pigs. He has been in engaged in those activities for fifteen years: farming is a trade he learned from his parents. Santiago takes a 2-km bicycle ride to his fields every day and works there from 6 am to 5 pm.
He asks for a loan to buy a pregnant heifer. His goal is to have milk for his grandchildren. He plans on using the leftover grass from the harvest to feed the heifer.
Santiago dreams of seeing his grandchildren grow up healthy and strong. He would also like to buy a vehicle to transport the harvest.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant heifer.

loans.name: Lidivine

texts.en:
Lidivine is 38 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 7 years. All of them go to school. She has been farming for 9 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and to sell rice. Profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and to sell rice.

loans.name: Ruth Noemy

texts.es:
Ruth, de 19 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta segundo año de bachillerato general, esta acompañada, pero no tiene hijos aun; vive con su esposo y su padre quien depende de ella, su compañero de vida trabaja como vigilante desde hace 2 años, mientras que Ruth, se dedica solamente a los quehaceres del hogar y a la crianza de pollos indios y de cerdos, los cuales vende y con los ingresos le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar cemento y arena para encementar el corredor de su casa ya que por el momento es de tierra.

El sueño de Ruth es viajar a España con su esposo a visitar a su suegra.
texts.en:
Ruth, 19 years old, is a housewife. She completed the second year of secondary school. She has a partner but the couple have no children yet. She lives with her husband and her father, and the latter is dependent on her. Her partner has been a security guard for two years, while Ruth takes care of the household and raises chicks and piglets, which she sells, thus contributing to household expenses.
She asks for a loan in order to buy cement and sand because she wants to replace the corridor's dirt floor with a concrete one.
Ruth's dream is to travel to Spain with her husband to visit her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to lay a concrete floor.

loans.name: Gatarakwa Great Vision Group

texts.en: Gatarakwa Great Vision Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to get training on enterprise and financial management. The group has been able to embrace the training by managing their enterprises/business well. The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jane, a member of this group. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a vegetable farmer and also operates a gasoline selling enterprise. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock of gasoline to help meet customers' rising demand. She hopes her business will thrive, thus more income to cater for family needs. Jane is so happy that her business will expand.

loans.use: To buy more stock of gasoline.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 52 years old. He is married with five children aged between 7 and 17 years old. Both children attend school. He has farmed for 15 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида, 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У Фариды средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении 8 лет работает санитаром в больнице. Также занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. Ежемесячная прибыль, с учетом заработной платы Фариды составляет около 40,000 сом (KGS). Фарида решила отремонтировать свой дом, а именно перекрыть крышу, путем покупки кирпича, шифера, балок. Поэтому Фарида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы от бизнеса и заработной платы, она планирует откладывать на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Farida is 47, married, and has four children. She has a secondary specialized education and has been a nurse at the hospital for eight years. She also raises livestock and has four cows. She earns about 40,000 som (KGS) per month, including her wages. Farida decided to renovate her house, specifically the roof, through the purchase of brick, slate, and beams. This is why she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy building materials. She plans to use her business profits and wages to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase brick, slate, and beams to reconstruct the roof of her house and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes fijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her spouse and three children.  For the past two years she has made a living selling clothing.   Her business is located in the local market and she has many regular clients.  She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale prices to continue her sales and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing

loans.name: Shaanikan

texts.ru: Шааникан, 57 лет, мать 2 детей, с Шааникан живут ее внуки, которые и помогают по хозяйству. У нее средне-специальное образование. Бизнесом занимается давно, более 15 лет. Начала она свой бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент Шааникан продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у нее есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Шааникан очень ответственная и доброжелательная. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения коров. В будущем Шааникан собирается увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Shaanikan is 57 and has two children. Her grandchildren also live with her and help her around the farm. She has a secondary specialized education and has been farming for over 15 years. She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS). She currently plants crops and raises livestock. She has three cows and earns around 30,000 som (KGS) per month. Shaanikan is a very responsible and friendly person. She applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to purchase cows. In the future she will increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Harriet, 27 years old, works hard to support her family. She operates a shop selling items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil and washing detergents. She is borrowing a loan to add more stock in her shop. She hopes this will help her maintain a consistent supply thus satisfying the rising customer demand. She hopes that her business will help support her family and improve the overall living standard such as medical care and quality education for the children.

Harriet is happy for Kiva and the support of its lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en: The group Agape is composed of three persons, who live in the same district and are into car lubricants, hair products, materials and perfumes. The group’s representative, Belinda, is 29 years old and married to a man named Raphael. The couple have one child. She lives together with her husband and child. Belinda ensures along with her husband that the diverse household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling materials and perfumes at the market for 6 years now. She gets her goods from the wholesale suppliers and sells to customers. With the goal of bolstering her business, Belinda and the other members are requesting a fourth loan from ID-Ghana. They promise to repay this loan duly and promptly.

loans.use: to buy materials and perfumes from her suppleirs and sell to customers at the market.

loans.name: Viktore

texts.en:
Viktore is a retiree whose retirement pension is approximately $110/month. She resides in the rural southeastern Albania where she practices agriculture/livestock to make extra money. Otherwise, it is impossible to live with this little money in Albania. 

Viktore is widowed and a mother of two grownups now. She owns about 5.5 dynym of agricultural land where she plants medicinal plants, beans and fodder and also has a cow with a calf and wants to add another dairy cow with your help of a loan. She sells the medicinal plants and dried beans but not the fodder since she uses it for her livestock.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow in order to increase her income since the retirement pension is just about $110/month.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to see her daughter a successful and professional lady and find a good job so she can increase their income.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios  años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in his own house with his wife.  He has earned a living for several years selling shoes.  His business is located in the town market in a very busy area, so he has a lot of customers.  He's able to pay for his expenses with his sales.

He's requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale so he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.ru:
Aisha single lady 21-year-old, lives in southern Ghour, she is third year student majoring finance.
Aisha is one of nine members, her father is retired, and they are faced financial problem, which make it difficult to complete her education because she cannot pay university fees.
She has a lot of dreams that make her determined to complete her studies, which lead her to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees which make her achieve her dreams about working in banking field.
texts.en:
Aisha is a single lady who is 21 years old and lives in southern Ghour. She is a third-year student, majoring in finance.

Aisha is one of nine members. Her father is retired and they are faced with financial problems, which make it difficult to complete her education because she cannot pay university fees.

She has a lot of dreams that make her determined to complete her studies, which led her to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees. This makes her achieve her dreams about working in the banking field.

loans.use: To pay for covering the semester fees that make her achieve her dreams about working in the banking field.

loans.name: Ana Matea

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y junto con su esposo tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella, los otros dos viven aparte, pues ya están acompañados y trabajan para su familia.

Ana, trabaja en un negocio de venta de tortillas, desde hace 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió para sacar adelante a sus hijos, en este negocio le ayuda su nuera y el horario en el que trabajan es de 5:00 a.m a 7:00 p.m tres días a la semana, mientras que su esposo trabaja como vigilante.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar lamina, cemento y arena. para ampliar un poco más su vivienda.

El sueño de Ana es, comprar un vehículo para poder salir a comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio de tortillas y así no tener que pagar trasporte siempre.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and studied until 6th grade. She is a married homemaker who has three children with her husband, one of which is living with her. The other two children are already partnered. They live elsewhere and work for their families.

Ana has worked in a business selling tortillas for 10 years, a job she learned while raising her children. In this business, she helps her daughter and the hours they work are from 5:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. 3 days a week, while her husband works as a guard.

She is asking for this loan to purchase metal sheets, cement, and sand to expand her house a little bit.

Ana's dream is to buy a vehicle to use to purchase all that is necessary for her tortilla business and to avoid costs she now pays for transport.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Julius, married and blessed with four children. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings, which has helped him realize his strength in business. He does both dairy and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a loan to boost his farming business by buying manure and certified seeds. He believes that this will help improve his crop yield, thus an increase in his profit. This will help him provide better education for his children as well as basic needs for the family.

Julius is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and certified seeds to help improve crop yield and thus more profit.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 35 years old. He is married with six children aged between 4 months and 7 years old. Two children attend school. 

He has farmed for 14 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi âgée de 46ans est mariée à un artiste plasticien et en charge 02 enfants de 20 et 25ans. Elle est revendeuse de mèches, pagnes et bijoux et s'approvisionne dans les marchés étrangers. Avec son quatrième  crédit, elle désire acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. A l'avenir, elle souhaite élargir l'activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Nottons qu'elle a 05ans d’ancienneté.
texts.en: Akouavi is 46 and married to a visual artist. She has two dependent children of 20 and 25 years old. She sells locks of hair, traditional pagne dress and jewellery. She buys her supplies at foreign markets. With this her fourth loan, she would like to buy goods in order to satisfy her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and guarantee her family’s well-being. It should be noted that she has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: to buy locks of hair, traditional pagne dress and jewellery.

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Shg Group

texts.en:
Dalidei is a 37-year-old lady who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Dhenkanal district of Odisha, India. Her children are in school. She is engaged in mushroom cultivation. 

Dalidei, along with ten women from her village, made a self-help group having the name "Laxmi Narayan SHG" to educate each other in their business activities. All the group members are engaged in different activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, flower selling, etc. All group members help and support each other in their personal lives as well as in their business activities. 

In the picture, the lady standing first from the right hand side in the first row is Dalidei. She has been doing mushroom cultivation for nine years. She produces mushrooms and then sells them. Her husband is a farmer, and he does paddy and vegetable cultivation. Dalidei's husband helps her in her activity, and he also helps her to sell mushrooms in the market. 

She and her group members have requested a loan amount of 165,000 INR for their business activities. Dalidei will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her mushroom cultivation. 

All the group members are very happy and excited to take this opportunity, and also, they are very thankful to Kiva for this.

loans.use: to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her mushroom cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase irrigated land, fertilizers, and seeds to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Xhevair

texts.en:
Xhevair wants to add doors and windows to their family home. Kindly note that he has been photographed by making brooms of straw, which is very traditional in the region of Korca. 

Xhevair is a father of two who, like the majority of others in the rural area, does agriculture/livestock to earn a living. Xhevair receives a pension of $170/month and owns about two dynym of agricultural land. He also rents from some other villagers about 10 more dynyms; he plants potatoes, onions, corn, beans, and broom straws, and he has a dairy cow. His two sons, 28 and 25, go to Greece for seasonal work and since they live with the parents they contribute financially as well.

loans.use: to install doors and windows to the family home

loans.name: Maa Dakhinkali Shg Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 32-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and a 6-year-old child in a small village in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha, India. 

In the picture, the lady standing second from the left-hand side in the red sari in the front row is Basanti. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. 

Some years ago, Basanti formed a group with 13 other women from her village with the group name of "Maa Dakhinkali Self Help Group." All the group members are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. Basanti is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. 

Basanti, along with her group, requested a loan of 210,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mulch and pay school fees

loans.name: Maa Lubhi Shg Group

texts.en:
A 20-year-old mother of one child, Prabhati (in the picture, the lady standing with a raised hand) currently has only the one child under her dependency. As a poor woman, she struggles in earning her daily cost of living through selling fish and having a small grocery shop. For her one-year involvement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 3,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month. 

She is a first-time borrower with People's Forum, Kiva's partner, and feels very confident that she can upgrade her living in a gradual manner. Now, to better support her business, she formed a group of 11 members having the name "Maa Lubhi SHG" to request a loan. All the group members are female and all are engaged in different business activities like fish selling, vegetable selling, paddy cultivation, etc. The total of her group loan loan is 165,000 INR. 

Prabhati will use her loan portion to buy grocery items to support her business. Moreover, she also wants to fix her house so it is in proper condition. She hopes her business will improve progressively, and also hopes to have her house in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items in bulk like sugar, rice, raw dal, spices, biscuits, tea, flour, etc., to support her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de cilindros de gas propano por mayor desde hace 10 años, posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 120 cilindros de gas propano para continuar con sus ventas y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Benjamín is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his 3 children. He has worked selling propane gas cylinders wholesale for the past 10 years. He has many clients and with what he earns from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy 120 cylinders of propane gas to continue with his sales and thus enjoy a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy 120 cylinders of propane gas.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia Cleofe  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas , la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mandarinas,naranjas y platanos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Cleofe continues to work in her business of selling fruit. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who's dream is to expand her business selling fruit. The member is requesting a loan to buy mandarins, oranges and bananas. Cleofe is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy mandarins, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des draps de lit pour revendre, Akossiwa fait la demande d'un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle a démarré en 2004. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle désire réinvestir dans l'activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle est mariée à un tailleur et ils ont 02 enfants en charge de 12 et 08ans.  Avec 11ans d'ancienneté, Akossiwa est âgée de 39ans.
texts.en: In order to buy bed linen for resale, Akossiwa requests a third loan from Wages. She started up her business in 2004. Her hopes for the future are to reinvest in her activity and to provide for her family. She is married to a tailor and they have two dependent children of 12 and eight years old. Akossiwa has 11 years experience and is 39 years old.

loans.use: To buy bed linen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like iron sheets, cement, windows and doors to complete his house.

loans.name: Dowloun Group

texts.fr: Fatimata est la responsable du groupe Dowloun. Elle est mariée et a 9 enfants dont 5 sont encore à sa charge.Elle fait le commerce des condiments depuis 20 ans. Avec son commerce, cette brave dame arrive à scolariser, à soigner ses enfants. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant chaque jour en légumes de qualité pour satisfaire ses clients. Fatimata et les autres membres du groupes travaillent sans relâche. Elles font leurs remboursement à la bonne date. Après les ventes, Fatimata aura une bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer à s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Fatimata is the leader of the Dowloun group. She is married with nine children of whom five are still dependent on her. She has been selling condiments for 20 years. With her business, this good lady manages to pay the school fees for her children and to pay for their health care. She needs this loan to reinforce her activity by stocking up daily on quality vegetable produce to satisfy her customers. Fatimata and the other members of the group, work very hard. They repay their loan on the fixed date. After selling the produce, Fatimata will make a profit which will enable her to continue looking after her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables(courgette, tomato, cucumber...) for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a repeat borrower having borrowed five times from UGAFODE Microfinance through its Ishaka branch. He is 45 years old and married with one wife and four children aged between 22 and 11 and they are all in school. He makes and sells bricks, a business he started in the year 1998 with a hope of getting enough money to cater for the needs of his family. He is a hardworking man who works five days in a week and works 10 hours per day, and this has greatly helped him to beat the competition that he faces in the market. He also does coffee farming and this gives him additional income, which helps him to pay school fees for his children. The business is located in Kyanamira in Rwenjeru Bushenyi District and his major clients are builders who buy bricks as building materials. 

He would like to use the loan money, amounting to two million Ugandan shillings (2,000,000), only to buy firewood for burning bricks so that he can sell the bricks and get enough money to cater for his family needs. He is mainly challenged by the weather, which changes a lot, especially in the rainy season, but he has high hopes of managing this by buying tapelines to cover the bricks using the profits from the business. He strongly believes that given the loan, he will make enough profits to help him run the business and cater for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy firewood for burning bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of chickens, corn, vegetables, tomatoes, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Xhavit

texts.en:
Xhevit is 46 and a married father of three children ranging in their teens. He wants to add another dairy cow to the herd, as the livestock is his primary activity and from which he makes most of the earnings.

Xhevit has five cows and only one baby calf at the moment. He sells the raw milk and baby calves to the farmers’ market in their nearby town. On the agricultural land that he owns, he has planted mostly plum and apple orchards and sells the fruits in addition to selling onions, wheat, corn, beans and potatoes.

Xhevit’s parents live with them and receive their little retirement pension of less than $300/month. Parents and their married or unmarried children living together is a tradition that is still going strong in the rural parts of the country, but is not limited in the urban area as well.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing herd, as the livestock is the primary activity of earning an income for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jose Fermin

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad posee una taller de elaboración de carteras y monederos a base de cuero desde hace 6 años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, cuero etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Jose is 46 years old. He has had a workshop to make wallets and purses from leather for 6 years. His workshop is located at his house and has many clients due to the quality of his work. With what he earns from his work he is able to get ahead. Jose is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, leather, etc thus being able to continue with his work which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, leather, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land for settlement.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Madame Béatrice née en 1969, revend à domicile de l'arachide en bouteille, de l'eau minérale, du jus depuis 2008. Elle est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des marchandises. A l'avenir, elle désire avoir une activité complémentaire et assurer l'éducation et la santé de son enfant (Elle a un enfant de 25ans qui est scolarisé).
texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice was born in 1969. She has been selling groundnuts in a bottle, mineral water and juice from her home since 2008. She is already a client of Wages and requests a second loan to buy merchandise. In the future, she would like to have an additional business and guarantee education and health care for her child. (She has a child of 25, who is a student).

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, and mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a single mother of one child. She lives in El Alto, and she has her own house. 

Virginia sells hats, blankets and petticoats. She needs a loan to buy materials to produce more hats, blankets and petticoats. 

Virginia pays money to a bunch of seamstresses that make the clothes. She would appreciate your help again.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce more hats, blankets and petticoats

loans.name: Rayi-Zallem 3 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Madame EMILIENNE est la représentante du groupe RAYI-ZALLEM 3 SAPONE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 10 ans et le moins âgé à 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge. 
Madame fait la restauration depuis 06 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de quartier.
 Elle veut s’acheter 1/2 sac d'haricot.
Madame épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne assurer l'avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilienne is the leader of the Ray-Zallem 3 Sapone group. She is married with three children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is two. Two of them go to school. She has eight people who are dependent on her. 
This lady has been working in catering for six years. She buys her supplies at the local market.
She would like to buy half a sack of beans.
Mrs. Emilienne saves up her profits. She hopes to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy 1/2 a sack of beans.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 12 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que la prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother. She owns a house where she lives with her three children. She has been selling roasted cashew seeds for twelve years and has loyal customers that prefer the quality and good prices she offers.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy more cashew seeds in bulk and be able to continue with her work in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is married, and he is father of five. He lives at his own house in El Alto. Gregorio is still a mason in El Alto. His wife makes blankets. 

Gregorio needs a loan to build a room that will be used by his wife as a little workshop. Gregorio would appreciate your help again. 

Gregorio hopes to see his kids graduate from university.

loans.use: to build a room as a workshop for his wife

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose works in a well known Bolivian factory and  lives at his mother s house in El Alto. Jose wants to have his own business and open a workshop.

Jose appreciates your help and trusts his skills  He is single and takes care of his mother.

loans.use: to open a workshop.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 28-year-old single man who lives in his own house.   Edgar is a talented school teacher who needs a loan to build a room onto his house.  He will  rent it out  to  increase his incomes.

 He is alone without anyone to help; he will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Margot

texts.en:
Margot sells televisions  and other electric items.  She travels around La Paz and offers her products to many people employed in banks and other institutions.  She has had this business for  4 years and lives  at her mother's house.

 Margot is 45 years old and works from home.   She hopes to have a shop in the future  Margot is  an accountant but doesn't work in that field.  Margot needs a loan to buy televisions that will help  increase her income.

loans.use: to buy televisions.

loans.name: Trabajando Para  El Futuro Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Trabajando Para El Futuro” conformada por 07 mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras. Andrea de 21 años de edad es soltera.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir. Así mismo como actividad secundaria distribuye productos cosméticos por catalogo. Su mayor deseo contar con un local para exhibir sus productos y de esta manera dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.  Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, camisas, pantalones y shorts. El grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Andrea se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior  es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo de color plomo.
texts.en:
This is the “Trabajando para el Futuro” [Working for the Future] communal bank, comprised of seven energetic and entrepreneurial women.

Andrea, 21, is single. She buys and sells clothes. She also sells cosmetics on a catalogue. Her biggest dream is to have a store where she can display her products and better serve her customers. This is why she requested a loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and shorts.

The “Trabajando para el Futuro” group wants to thank all of those who made this loan possible. Andrea is standing in the back, second from left to right, and is wearing a gray t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.en:
Santusa is 37 years old. She has her own house, and she makes a living by selling used blankets. She is a traveling seller, and she goes around El Alto.

Santusa needs a loan to increase her inventory of blankets. Santusa is mother of four, and her husband travels a lot, too.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of the blankets she sells

loans.name: Harbieh

texts.en:
Harbieh is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Harbieh, in cooperation with her husband, works very hard daily to be able to afford the heavy life expenses.

She has worked as a farmer since 2010. Her products are distributed to multiple customers at good prices. Today, with her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase agricultural supplies, as she seeks an increase in her production as well as in her income to enhance the family’s way of living.

Harbieh states that in the future, she will borrow more Kiva loans to open a vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 30 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one school-aged child. Basilia is a housewife and takes good care of her child. She receives support from her husband, who is a hollow block maker and laborer. The couple is earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of activity. 

Basilia has requested a loan to be used in purchasing nipa thatch for house repair. Basilia has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Basilia hopes she and her husband will have their own hollow block making business and become a major supplier in the area.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing nipa thatch for house repair

loans.name: Yesika

texts.en:
Yesika is a young entrepreneur with one son.  She lives in her own house in Achacachi.  Her husband is a farmer  and bus driver.  Yesika sells cheese and   wants a loan to buy food for her cows.

 Yesika has a hard job but she is optimistic about the situation.  She knows that you can trust her and give her a hand to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus has sold clothing since he was very young. He needs a loan and your help to buy merchandise.  He is experienced and wants to improve his quality of life.   

Jesus lost his wife but is an optimistic person, convinced that things will go better for him and his family. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock, such as crates of soda, soap, sugar, salt and loaves of bread, to add in his shop to sell.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en:
Esperanca is a business woman who lives in Ermera. She requests $ 1000.00  USA from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She wants to buy milk, sardines, cigarettes, candles, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, biscuits, toothbrushes, soft drinks,  and other items to sell in her store. 

Esperanca started  this business in 2006 with $ 1000.00 of her own capital. She earns a good income because many people like to buy from her. She is happy with her business. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin  to expand her business and store.

loans.use: to buy milk, sardines, cigarettes, candles, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar,  noodles, biscuits, toothbrushes, soft drinks,  and other items.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita would like $ 700.00 USD to improve her kiosk business. Many people shop there daily. She will buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, fish, and water.

She started her business in 2014 and is comfortable running it because she can earn money every day and is independent.  She can be responsible for herself and also helps her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes,sugar,coffee,fish, and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for light renovations and cloths to renew her collection.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 67-year-old widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business for 15 years.

 Carmelita requests 20,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Grupo Agricola Pasac 4 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre soltero de 53 años vive en una comunidad denominado Pasac. Junto a sus padres y hermanos. 
Manuel es desde ya hace varios años se dedica a la venta de bananos, en su comunidad, con esta actividad el genera sus ingresos y con lo poco que gana ayuda a su papá en algunos gastos de la casa , es una actividad que heredo de sus padres desde hace 30 años y es la única actividad que Manuel realiza. 
Pues Manuel para mantener esta actividad él necesita darle mantenimiento a la siembra del banano que tiene sembrado , para que siempre mantenga producción y seguir generando sus ingresos, pero para realizar todo este trabajo, él no cuenta con capital para hacerlo ya que es un trabajo que lleva inversión,  pues Manuel decidió buscar un prestamo de cuatro mil quetzales, 
Pues una de las metas de Manuel para este año es tener buena producción y generar ganancias  y con esto él  pueda seguir plantando mas de banano.
texts.en:
Manuel, 53, is single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community called Pasac.

For several years he has earned a living selling bananas in his community.  He earns his income with this job and, with what little he earns, helps his father with some of the household expenses.  It's a job he learned from his parents 30 years ago and it's the only work he does.

Manuel needs to take care of the banana plants he's growing so he can maintain production and continue with this job and keep on earning an income.  He doesn't have the capital to do all this work because it's a job that requires investment, so he decided to request a loan for 4,000 quetzals [GTQ].

One of Manuel's goals for this year is to have a good crop and make a profit so he can continue to plant more banana plants.

loans.use: to take care of his banana plants

loans.name: Chamrat

texts.en:
Chamrat, 40, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer with four children.  He grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he is able to make an income of 10.00 USD a day.

Chamrat wants to improve the living conditions of his family by having a latrine and needs a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is a 48-year-old married rice farmer with three children who lives in the Takeo province, Cambodia. She has grown rice since 1991. Her husband (shown in the photo) is 50 years old and builds houses. One of her children works in a factory. They earn18 USD per day. 

Ran requests a loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to commute to work. This loan will help her  to buy a motorcycle and provide her daughter with good traveling conditions. 

 Ran wants her husband to make wooden furniture to sell and to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transportation business and earns additional income from a general store. Joy requests 9,000 through NWTF to buy a wheel  for her bicycle.

Joy has sustained her business  through  3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a wheel for her bicycle.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 54-year-old a widow with two children who works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 20 years and requests 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, beverages, eggs, and groceries.

Flora has previously borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF. She earns an income buying and selling charcoal.

Flora aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs,  and groceries.

loans.name: Prudelina

texts.en:
Prudelina is a 51-year-old married woman with two children, 1 attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with  a food vending businesss. Prudelina requests 27,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business which she has had for 6 years.

 In the future, Prudelina would like to save enough  money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 27-year-old single woman with one child in school. Aileen works very hard to provide for their needs and has run a general store for 2 years. She requests  13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  canned goods, biscuits, condiments, and groceries.

In the future, Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, condiments, and groceries.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a 41-year-old married woman with one child who works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 4 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  beverages, canned goods, sugar, and groceries.

Eleonor has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income selling coconut wine.

Eleonor aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, sugar,  and groceries.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a dairy farmer, and at the same time grows bananas. He faces the challenges of low capital and the long distance to transport his milk to the dairy. However, he hopes to construct a permanent home.

Robert has asked for a loan to buy building materials such as cement and bricks for construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and bricks for construction of a permanent home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like sand for a permanent home.

loans.name: Pilita

texts.en:
Pilita is a married woman with one child who attends school. She is a very hard working 37-year-old entrepreneur. 

Pilita has has a business to sell frozen foods for 1 year and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional frozen goods to sell.

In the future, Pilita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods to sell.

loans.name: Serlina

texts.en:
Serlina is 59 years old and married with five children.

Serlina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Serlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Serlina has been in this business for seven years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Serlina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a vulcanizing shop. Elenita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming rice. Lolita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak is a 20-year- old married factory worker with a child.  She  lives in the Takeo province, Cambodia and has worked in the factory for  four years. Her husband (shown in the  photo) is 24 years old and also works in the factory. 

They can earn 8 USD each day. Sreyleak’s wooden house is old and she would like to build a proper house but she doesn’t have enough money.  She request a loan  to buy bricks and cement.  This loan will provide her  with better living conditions. 

He future plans are  to run a tailor shop at home and support her child in earning a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: Jose de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de accesorios y repuestos para electrodomésticos, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 5 años y tiene muchos clientes, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas repuestos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose, aged 45, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He sells accessories and spare parts for electronic appliances.

His business has been situated in the municipal market for 5 years, and he has many clients.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy more spare parts wholesale to be able to continue with his sales, and so increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts wholesale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y asi una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Irma, aged 36, lives in her own home with her two children. 

She works as a street vendor, selling clothing in various neighborhoods, and has many regular customers due to the quality and good prices. 

With the sales that she makes, she has been able to afford some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more clothing wholesale, in order to have a higher income and a better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a hardworking woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her retail business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, Dulce requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. Aside from her business running her sari-sari store (or variety store), she has thought of having a pig-raising operation right in her own backyard. 

Dulce also hopes to one day open a meat shop in a nearby town for additional income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two adult children. 

Alicia has managed a grocery store for  5 years. She earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mariefel

texts.en:
Mariefel is 29 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has one child who attends school. 

Mariefela has raised hog for 6 years and requests 10,000 PHP to purchase 5 pigs and 4 sacks of  feeds. 

Mariefel has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, Mariefel hopes to build a larger pig pen for her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 pig and 4 sacks of feed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Lolita has sold  dried fish  for 10 years and earns  3,000 PHP each month to  help meet the family's need. She has requested a loan to purchase dried fish.

 Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lolita hopes to build her own dried fish stall.

loans.use: to purchase avariety dried fish.

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en:
Aleli is married and works hard to support her family. Aleli has had a food vending business for 25 years and requests 21,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional and ingredients.

Aleli would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Sabyrbek

texts.ru: Сабырбек, 64 года, вдовец, есть сын. У Сабырбека средне-специальное образование, он на пенсии, также с 2000 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У него в хозяйстве есть 1 корова с теленком. Сабырбек известен, как ответственный и добрый человек. Его совокупный ежемесячный доход около 10,000 сом (KGS) от пенсии, продажи молока, скота. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита он планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и увеличения доходов его семьи.
texts.en:
Sabyrbek is a 64-year-old widower with a son.  He has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training.  He collects a pension and has also been farming since 2000, which provides his main source of income.  He currently has a cow and a calf on his farm.

Sabyrbek is known as a responsible and kind person.  His gross monthly income is around 10,000 som from his pension and sales of milk and livestock.  This money isn't enough for a decent life, so to further develop his farm, he's requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som to go towards a purchase of sheep.  He plans on using his extra income due to the loan to expand his farm and increase his family's income.

loans.use: buy additional sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase his profit

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia needs a $ 600.00 loan  to improve her business. Adelia opened her kiosk in 2013 and will use the loan to buy  gasoline and diesel fuel.  She generates a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and diesel fuel.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
José Antonio is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

José is 39 years old and is single. He lives in his aunt’s house and has been involved in commerce for 15 years now and describes himself as a good salesman.

He started selling silver products in a tianguis (open air market) near his house. He recently decided to also sell corn elotes to increase his income. José asks for this loan to invest in his business, make it a more established stand and buy merchandise.

With the effort he puts into his work, he aspires to be able to develop his business and enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: to establish his silver and food selling stand.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a married woman with 3 children.  Her husband is a driver. 

She is applying for a loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her clothing business.  She will use the  loan  to buy children's shorts, trousers, school uniforms, jackets, and other children's clothing. 

Filomena began her business in 2010 with her own capital of $ 3000.00. She earns a good income  selling her clothes because many people like to buy from her.  She is a happy business woman who hopes to expand her business into a bigger store. 

She also has animals like cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy children's shorts, trousers, school uniforms, jackets and other  clothing to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 54-year-old, hard-working man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in produce as his main source of income and he has a farm where he gets supplementary income. Francis started these businesses in order to educate his children. He has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman, but he faces a challenge of inadequate capital.

Francis is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, like millet to make local porridge.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like millet to make local porridge.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de tamales de pollos, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos, maíz, verduras, tomates, etc. todo por mayor para seguir con su  trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, aged 24, lives in her own home with her husband and two children. 

For fifteen years she has been working as a street vendor, selling chicken tamales in various neighborhoods and markets.

She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, corn, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. all wholesale, so that she can continue with her work and this way earn a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy chicken, corn, vegetables, tomatoes etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa,  tiene 58 años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto de 20 años  de edad el cual es su compañía.
Doña Teresa es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante  se dedica a varias actividades, ella tiene una pequeña fábrica de chifles,  vende telas, perfumes y cremas y los fines de semana también prepara y vende tongas (comida tóipica), las mismas que prepara por encargo, esto lo realiza todas las semanas ya que siempre tiene pedidos  por que sus tongas son deliciosas, trabaja todos los días en la  fabricación de los chifles con la ayuda de dos personas más  a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal y  su nieto se encarga de entregar a cevicherías y tiendas de la localidad, ya son más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar telas, perfumes, plátanos, manteca y víveres para la fabricación de los chifles y los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.  Sus sueños son darle a su nieto lo mejor.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, every two weeks the members of the Communal Bank "Organized Women" get together. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are recognized throughout the country. Teresa, who is 58 years old, lives in this place. Several years ago, her husband passed away, but she had two children from that relationship. They are now older in age. She has a 20-year-old grandson in her care. She is a very hard-fighting woman, who in order to get ahead, works in several activities. She has a small snacks factory; she sells fabrics, perfumes and pomades and on the week ends she prepares and sells "tongas" (local cuisine). She prepares this food by request every weekend and she always has requests since her "tongas" are delicious. She prepares snacks with the help of two people who she pays a weekly income and her grandson is responsible for making deliveries to diners and stores in the area. She has been involved in this business for over 12 years and it has allowed her to move ahead. 

This loan will allow her to purchase fabrics, perfumes, plantains, butter and food supplies for making snacks and other foods. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank, and she likes it because the interest rates are very low and because of the help that she receives with the loans. Her dreams are to provide the best to her grandson.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, perfumes, plantains, butter and food supplies.

loans.name: Lucia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Lucia del Pilar tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Esta comunidad esta habitada por gente sencilla y amable, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 01 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos, lo que le permitirá ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes e incrementará su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su nivel de ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia del Pilar is 23 years old; she is in a civil partnership and she lives with her partner and her children in the district of Cayaltí; located in the province of Chiclayo; in the region of Lambayeque; in the nothern coast of Peru. Humble and friendly people live in this community and the population works mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

She works in raising and selling small livestock such as turkeys, guinea pigs, chickens, among others. She has been working in this business for over a year and she has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of livestock such as hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. As well as to purchase feed for these. This will allow her to offer a wider variety of livestock to her clients and will increase her sales and thus improve her revenue and her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of farm animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. As well as to purchase feed for these.

loans.name: Wendnsongde Group

texts.fr:
Mme  W.SABINE est la représentante du groupe WENDNSONGDE. ALIMATA se porte très bien mais ne fait plus partie du groupe. Marié, elle est mère de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 03 va à l’école. 
Madame est restauratrice depuis 09 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 03 sacs de riz de 50kg et 02bidons d'huile de 20l.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans l’activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand restaurant et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
W.Sabine is the Wendnsongde group representative.   Alimata is doing well but is no longer part of the group. 

W. Sabine is married and has three children; the eldest is 12 years old and the youngest is two years old. Three of her children go to school.
W. Sabine has been cooking food for sale for nine years. She stocks up at a market in her neighborhood. She would like to buy three 50-kg [110 lbs] bags of rice and two 20-l [5 gal] jugs of oil. She plans to invest her revenues in her business. Her goal is to open a proper restaurant and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy three 50-kg bags of rice and two 20-l jugs of oil.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Arsenia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Arsenia is taking a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a widowed woman with four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 33 years old.

Analyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her business.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca requests  $ 800 USD to improve her business. Francisca lives in Ermera ans  is married with  5 children. 

She is a business woman earning an income from a general store. She started  her business in 2010 with her own  capital of $ 200.00. 

She will use the loan to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as umbrellas, slippers, milk, coffee, noodles, toothpaste, cooking oil, and other items. 

She is pleased with this  daily work and happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin. She will be able  to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas, slippers, milk, coffee, noodles, toothpaste, cooking oil,  and other items.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, born in 1968, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She has been a member of the program M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7 MFI) since 2008 and now she is living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family's main income is from grocery trading, therefore, the income after deducting all costs, is just enough to cover food and to save the little amount left. She is intending to build a sanitary toilet, but the amount she has saved is not enough to buy materials. So she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for the sanitary work.

Therefore, Mai expects much from the loan, which will help her family have a favorable condition for living and she will work hard to have money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on-time.

loans.use: to buy materials for sanitary work.

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Thinh, born in 1976, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of four members, including herself, her husband, and two sons. Her two sons are both obedient and good students. Her family currently lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her elder son is studying in Son La and her younger son is studying at a high school.
Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager salary, so the income just covers the basic family’s expenses with a little for savings. But, the saved amount is not enough to pay her children’s education fees. Therefore, she wants a loan to invest in her children’s education and pay their education fees.
She expects the loan will help her children have better learning conditions and have a brighter future, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education and pay their education fees

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: Samoeurn is a 23-year-old fatherless son and a single student who is pursuing an associate’s degree at university in the city, majoring in business and tourism management in his second year. He is from Svay Reang province of Cambodia. His mother is a rice farmer, his sister works in a factory and his brother works in a company. Samoeurn needs money to cover his tuition fees for a year, so he would like to take out a loan. He will use the loan to graduate successfully with skills for his future. After graduation, he hopes to have a job and to save money to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees for a year

loans.name: Josefa Guadalupe

texts.es: Josefa de 46 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos a los que apoya para que estudien y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las buenas ideas de Josefa le han permitido instalar un pequeño taller de costura en el cual elabora mosquiteros para cama desde hace 14 años, por lo que gracias a la calidad de productos que ofrece y a sus precios accesibles cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre gustan de sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilos, accesorios, listones, etc. Para seguir agrandando su producción y cumplir con la demanda de productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 46 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. Josefa supports her children to study and ensure they can have a better life. 

Due to Josefa's astute thinking, for the last 14 years she has been making mosquito nets in a small sewing workshop she has set up. Thanks to the quality of her products and her accessible prices, she has a large number of customers who always appreciate her products. 

Josefa seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cloth, thread, accessories, cleats, etc. The loan will enable her to continue widening her production and keep up with the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to invest in: cloth, thread, accessories, cleats, etc.

loans.name: Antonia Carolina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Carolina, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 10 meses de nacido. El marido es controlador de un bus de transporte. Ella hace tiempo aprendió belleza en una academia local.
Doña Carolina es joven madre y esposa que hace lo necesario para ganar lo suyo para el bienestar de su familia, ella  realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal en su casa o a domicilio dependiendo de lo que sus clientes prefieran, ella  realiza tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas, alisados entre  otros muchos trabajos de acuerdo a su profesión. Trabaja todos los días  y esto depende de sus clientes ya que ella está lista para atenderlos a la hora que ellos quieran ya que de esto dependen sus ganancias y así logra más clientela con los días, ya son 4 años dedicada a esta profesión la cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y ciertas herramientas que ella necesita para sus trabajos.  Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en el grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton, associates of the Communal Bank "Organized Women" meet every fifteen days. This place is known for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare and that are recognized throughout the country. Carolina, who is 19 years old, and who is in a partnership which has given her a 10-month old child, lives here. Her husband is a bus controller. She learned to work in beauty at a local academy. Carolina is a young mother and wife who does what is necessary to earn her keep for the wellbeing of her family. She works in beauty and personal grooming at her home or by request, depending on the preferences of her clients. She performs hair dying, haircuts, nail polishing, hair straightening among many other requests in accordance to her profession. 
She works every day, depending on her clients, during hours that are convenient to them. She depends on these revenues and in that way she expands her clientele base every day. She has been working in this profession for 4 years, which has allowed her to earn some revenue for herself. She will use this loan to purchase hair dye, permanent dye and certain tools that she needs for her work. She has been part of the Communal Bank for two cycles and she likes it because of the support the group provides. She dreams of providing the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, permanent dye and tools.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Concepcion, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  De Las Nieves es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una casa de recepciones, alquileres de globo loco, payasos, decoraciones, también sale a vender lencerías y joyas de plata.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener, y de esa forma evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mesas, cubiertos, sillas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con los alquileres que tiene, y con ello seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Sagrada Familia group is in its 6th loan cycle of the women's communal bank program. The members are from the city of Concepcion, and live some distance from the central area, in an area that is still growing.  It is an area that is somewhat hard to get to, so the members of this group want to strive to grow gradually, give the area where they live a better environment and see it grow slowly.

De Las Nieves is one of the members. She has a place for holding social events and rents out inflatable play structures, clowns and decorations. 

She also goes out to sell lingerie and silver jewelry. She is a very hard-working woman who strives to be able to provide her family with everything she was not able to have, and that way help them avoid the hardships that she had to experience.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase tables, cutlery, chairs and other items, so that she can continue with her rentals, and with this continue providing her family with what they need.

loans.use: To buy tables, cutlery, chairs, and other items to rent out.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 42-year-old widowed mother of two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Emma has been in this business for seven years. Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a 38-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Felomina has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Felomina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear like pants, shorts, t-shirts, and blouses to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 61 years old and married with three children. Luciana works very hard to provide for her family.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, soy sauce, and biscuits to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, soy sauce, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 43-year-old married mother of three children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melinda has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Aurelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish net and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Aurelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials needed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nenita has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional computers for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
