Blesilda is 39 years old, married, and has three children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Blesilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Blesilda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Blesilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 42 years old and married with three children, two currently in school. Dioscora works very hard to provide for her family.

Dioscora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Dioscora has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, sugar, cooking oil, and candies. 

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, born in 1985, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. The income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and to save a small amount. Because the children are all small, she has to spend much money for many things. She wants to invest in raising pigs for meat and chicken for eggs, but she doesn’t have enough money for this purpose. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to invest in these breeding activities to earn additional income for the whole family.

She expects the loan will help her family invest effectively in breeding, and it will bring her family a considerable amount of interest. She will find an extra job to earn money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Don Natividad de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos de manera ambulante por el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes ya que es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios como: frutas, horchata, cebada, azúcar, hielo, etc. todo por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 41 years old lives in his own home with his wife. He sells soft drinks is a street vendor around the municipal market and has many customers because it is a very sellable product. With what he gets from the sales, he is managing to pay for some household expenses.

He is Is requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary ingredients such as fruit, (horchata and cebada are both traditional salvadoran soft drinks made with fruit and other natural ingredients), sugar, iced, etc., all at wholesale. This way he can earn better income.

loans.use: To buy fruit, horchata, cebada, (horchata and cebada are both traditional salvadoran soft drinks made with fruit and other natural ingredients), sugar, ice, etc., all at wholesale.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 40 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three single children. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2 a day.

Channy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Maria Matias

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 12 años, Maria solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en: Maria is a 47-year-old single mother. She lives in her own house with her two children. She is a hard worker who devotes herself to her business in order to succeed and thus provide her family a better life. She sells fruits and vegetables in a market located close to where she has lived for the last 12 years. Maria is requesting this loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacqueline Jeaneth

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 35  años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has had a small store located in her home for three years. She has many customers because of good prices and the friendliness she has when she sells. 

She is requesting a loan so that you can buy more soups, eggs, basic staples, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc., and this way be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more soups, eggs, basic staples, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Vath

texts.en:
Vath, 55, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children; two single and five married. To make a living, she has been involved in farming since 1981, growing cassava and selling her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of (USD) $2.50 a day, on average.
In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seed and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seed and insecticides

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun, 36, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one child. To make a living, she has been involved in farming since 1999, growing rice and selling her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of (USD) $5 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seed and insecticide.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seed and insecticide.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is a farmer who grows rice in his field while his wife sells slippers and sandals in the market. Due to insufficient funds, Ramil cannot afford all his farm's needs. He is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his crops. His earnings will serve to support his family's primary needs. He doesn’t want to rely so much on his wife's earnings to meet family expenses. So, in this simple way, he wants to help his wife. Ramil hopes to operate his farm continuously for a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia works hard to support her family. Sulpicia is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Sulpicia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Sulpicia has been in this business for 15 years now.

Sulpicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Emelia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a buy-and-sell bread business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lucrecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Lucrecia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop. Ma. Lucrecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Ma. Lucrecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nhóm 16-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Lan, 42, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 420,000. She is raising three school-age sons and the youngest has an intellectual disability. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. 
Currently, her family is in an economic hardship situation since she has to support a sick mother and her husband left the family three years ago. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet yet. With this loan, Lan will build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection.
In this photo, Lan is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 15-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet, pictured third from the left, is 36 years old. She works as a farmer and makes about VND 710,000 monthly. She is married with two children and has an old mother to support. 

She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Currently, her family does not have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, Tuyet will have a septic tank latrine installed in her home. This will improve the living conditions of the family members and contribute to the protection of the environment.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Santa works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Santa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Santa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la reparación y venta de electrodomésticos, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y electrodomésticos por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pablo, aged 42, lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. 

He has been making a living repairing and selling home appliances for 20 years. He has many customers because of the quality of his work. With what he makes from his sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and home appliances wholesale to stay in business and generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and home appliances wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios  años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, who is 45 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She has sold shoes for some years. Her business is located in a busy area and she therefore has many clients. She has managed to cover expenses through her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes at wholesale in order to have better income.

loans.use: buy shoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Khushvakhtoy

texts.en:
Khushvakhtoy lives in Vakhsh district with her son who is 24 years old. Now he is in Russia for making earnings. Khushvakhtoy, at the age of 53, is engaged in a livestock business. She has 3 years of experience in this kind of business. In addition to the livestock business she is also involved in agriculture like many residents of rural areas.
 
Khushvakhtoy is a simple and good-natured woman. She really likes her livestock activity and wants to develop it. She is planning to increase the count of livestock and expand her business. She needs your support to purchase more cattle so she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Puthoeun

texts.en:
Puthoeun is an 18-year-old freshman who is from Pursat province in Cambodia. He is pursuing an associate’s degree at the university in the city, majoring in management. His father has removable open wedding shed for rent and his mother is a rice farmer. 

Puthoeun is lacking the money to cover his university fees from the first to the second year, so he would like to apply for a loan. With the loan, he will be able to have enough money to earn an associate’s degree. After graduation, he dreams of working in a company with a decent salary. He will also pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: pay his university fees

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 2 Group

texts.en:
Andremena is a member of the “Canal de Bendición 2 (Blessing Way)” group. In this group most members are Dominican-Haitians or emigrants from Haiti who live in 'bateyes' (company towns where sugar workers live) in the town of Romana, one of the Dominican Republic's tourist destinations which has a high scale of luxury. Andremena's business is selling new and used clothing. She acquires her clothing in the flea markets of Santo Domingo or on the border with Haiti. 

Andremena has 4 children and she lives together with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to establish a successful business in the Dominican Republic. Andremena is very excited to be receiving her 15th loan from Esperanza Internacional, and will invest it in her business, which she has had for around 10 years. She is planning to invest her loan in buying various items of new clothing and a packet of used clothing whose items she will then sell individually. She will use her profits to re-invest in her business and to provide any need her family has. Her dream is to be able to expand her established business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean, 48, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living, she has been involved in an agri-business since 1980. By owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market.  On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day.

In this farming season, she would like hire some people to clear the forest from a plot of her land in order to grow cassava.  Due to the shortage of money, she would like to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for hiring laborers. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Seu

texts.en: Seu, who is 47 years old, is residing in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children who work as garment factory workers. To make a living and support her family, she operates a fish selling business in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 8.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy, who is 36 years old, is residing in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business on a small piece of land which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than ten years. 

On average, Phy is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nhar

texts.en:
Nhar, 51, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has three children. To make a living, she opens a small grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been involved in this business for four years. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of fund, Nhar has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: pay for house renovation

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Vantha, 54, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children in total, one is single and four are married. To make a living, she has been involved in a farming business since 1981.  She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.50 a day, on average

The earning that Vantha receives from her farming is every low. She wants to have one more business for a supplementary income. However, her limited capital doesn't allow her to do so. That is why she is applying for a KIVA loan as capital to run a business of selling an iron welding service. This loan will allow her to have one more source of income which helps to remove poverty form her life. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: start an iron welding service business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Aida is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming corn for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe Group

texts.es:
Shirley es integrante del Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe, su grupo se creó hace varios años, ha solicitado 4 préstamos anteriormente, y su conducta de pago se califica como “MUY BUENA”. Está compuesto actualmente por 10 socias, que invierten en actividades comerciales y de servicios. 
Ella es casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos estudiantes de secundaria, por los que trabaja muy duro para contribuir con los gastos de sus estudios. 
 Esta señora tan trabajadora inicio vendiendo todo tipo de mercadería, de forma ambulante, y actualmente emprendió un pequeño negocio en su casa que es la venta de abarrotes, por medio de una pequeña pulpería. Todo esto lo ha logrado gracias a los financiamientos anteriores y a la buena gestión de los recursos propios.  Para este nuevo crédito piensa invertir en capital de trabajo, específicamente abarrotes, refrescos, golosinas y otras para abastecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Shirley is a member of the New Caribbean Woman Bank group, which was created several years ago. The group has requested four loans historically, and they have been very good at loan repayment. The group currently consists of 10 members engaged in commercial and service activities.

Shirley is married with three children, all of whom are high school students. She works very hard to contribute to the cost of their studies. This hardworking woman started selling every type of merchandise as a street vendor. She even undertook starting up a small business selling groceries from her own home. She has achieved all of this thanks to previous funding and good resource management. For the requested new loan, she plans to invest in working capital in the form of groceries, soft drinks, candy and other items to supply her business.

loans.use: buy groceries, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, candy and more.

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en: Chhon’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chhon makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: buy a water filter

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en: Khosiyat is a 35-year-old resident of the district Jilinkul. She is married and lives with her husband and growing children. Khosiyat is distinguished by her kindness and cheerfulness. She is engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry. She is active and can handle both activities. Currently Khosiyat is preparing to sow cotton. She should buy cotton seeds and prepare the land for sowing. For this reason Khosiyat requested a loan. On borrowed money she would buy seeds and other supplies for planting. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to sow cotton and purchase seeds.

loans.name: San Ruben 1 Group

texts.es:
Nohemi  mujer de27 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos y viven en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión. 
Nohemi (señora que está en la foto al lado izquierdo) con mucho esfuerzo lucha todos los días, con el único propósito de ayudar a su esposo en complementar los gastos de su hogar, ella ama mucho a sus hijos pero por escases económicos ella, se ve en la necesidad de salir a trabajar y sus hijos están al cuidado de la abuela. 

Nohemi trabaja de empleada doméstica con una familia ahí en su comunidad, pues Nohemí se da cuenta que con el ingreso de su esposo no es suficiente sobrevivir, pues para lograr satisfacer otras necesidades, es necesario que los dos trabajen, Noemí es una madre que vela por lo que hace falta en su hogar, pues ella se da cuenta que su cocina  necesita de remodelación, a raíz de esta necesitad, pues ella decidido hacer un prestamo de dos mil quinientos quetzales y ella lo estaría pagando con sus ingresos, y él esposo estaría cubriendo los gastos del hogar. Noemí manifiesta que solo con los préstamos se pueden satisfacer otras necesidades. 
Pues la meta de Nohemi es seguir trabajando  y pagar el prestamo y apoyar  a sus hijos  que sigan estudiando para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nohemi is a 27 year old woman. She is married and has 2 children. They live in a community called Santo Tomas la Union. Nohemi (who appears on the left side of the photo) puts forth great effort every day with the singular goal of helping her husband and contributing to the household expenses. She loves her children very much but, due to financial reasons, she needs to leave every day to work. The children are cared for by their grandmother.

Nohemi works as a domestic employee for a family in her community. She realized that her husband's income is not sufficient for them so, in order to meet their financial needs, it is necessary for both of them to work.

Nohemi does not like when things are lacking in her house, and she has realized that her kitchen needs to be remodeled. For this reason, she has decided to seek a loan for 2,500 quetzals. She is also paying for this project with her income.

Nohemi's goals include continuing work, paying off the loan, and supporting her children so that they can continue to study in order to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hay and livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, biscuits, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of biscuits, sweets, soda and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of biscuits, sweets, soda and other items.

loans.name: Sazhidahan

texts.ru: Сажидахан 49 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Сажидахан среднее образование, 6 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Сажидахан, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 0,64 ГА собственного земельного надела, где она ежегодно выращивает кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 50 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сажидахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 5 овец с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Сажидахан намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в обучение ее сына в университете.
texts.en: Sazhidahan is 49 years old, married and has an adult son. Sazhidahan has a secondary education and has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 6 years. Thanks to her hard work and drive, today Sazhidahan has 0.64 hectares of owned land, where she annually grows corn and clover for both the farm consumption and sale. She also has 50 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sazhidahan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 5 sheep for subsequent fattening up and resale. Sazhidahan intends to develop her business, which will certainly lead to increasing her family's capital. She wants to invest the earnings from the loan into her son's education at a university.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep for subsequent fattening up and resale

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a young and beautiful woman from the town of Konibodom. She is only 33-years-old and she is not married and has no children. She is an employable and intelligent woman. She graduated medical college in 2005.

Manzura now works as a nurse in a hospital in her hometown. She likes the work of treating people and caring for patients. Now, Manzura is taking out a loan to buy furniture for her home. Because of the lack of money she requested a loan. In the future, Manzura plans to get a higher doctoral education. 

You can support Manzura now. Your support will help her to improve the conditions in her home.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for the improvement of conditions in her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase sodas, juice and water for her min-supermarket.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a very hard working single man with no children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Richard operates a men’s hair salon, working for at least 8 hours a day, along with a music and video library which boosts his income. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital to modernise his salon in order to compete favorably in the market. Therefore, Richard is requesting the loan to purchase mirrors, chairs and a hair cutting machine for the salon.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, chairs and a hair cutting machine for the salon.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55-years-old and has ten children, four of whom are currently in school. She is married.

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming corn for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elvessa

texts.en:
Elvessa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvessa has been in this business for 10 years. Elvessa earns more income from a general store.

Elvessa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tumaini A Group

texts.en:
Jackson is in his mid twenties and is a  married man. He has been a businessman managing a restaurant serving food. He has run this business since 2009, working from 6am to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit per day.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his fourth credit to be apportioned among Tumaini A, a four member group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous loans, all since paid back successfully, to improve his store with rice, maize and baking flour, beans, cooking oil, and vegetables. Jackson managed to make extra income which he used to cover his family expenses and plow back in his business. 

He dreams to manage a hotel. With his new credit request, he will use it to buy food cooking ingredients for his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for his restaurant

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be patient. He is a mechanic and repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be getting motor vehicle spare parts. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a shoe repair business. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy shoe repair materials. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy shoe repair materials

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1977. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an immigrant.  For about seven years, she has had a business. She is a sewer. Dilafruz sews traditional dresses for woman and national blankets. She has three sewing machines now. She wants to teach two students and take them on as helpers. Dilafruz is asking for financial support to provide a wedding party for her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To provide a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Maria Nida

texts.en:
Maria Nida is 52 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maria Nida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Nida has been in pig fattening for four years and earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Akkyz

texts.ru: Аккыз, 55 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 3 детей. Аккыз в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи вот уже 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Аккыз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец. На участке мерою 0,10 Га она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ее развитое хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аккыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для разведения. Доходы от кредита Аккыз вложит в расширение бизнеса и она хочет накопить на ремонт сарая.
texts.en:
Akkyz is 55 and married with three children. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 15 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 0.10 hectares of land where she grows barley both for her own use and for sale. Her various activities bring in a monthly income of about 6,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Akkyz has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 15,000 KGS to purchase sheep for breeding. She intends to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save toward renovating her barn.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Marie Julie

texts.en:
Though handicapped by the earthquake of January 2010, Marie Julie does not lose hope to bring a change in her life and other people’s lives as well. In response, she launched a grocery store near her house. This business has an encouraging impact within the community.

To face the management challenges, Marie Julie attended training in Zafen. She also is applying for a loan, as she has a need to increase her food products. As a result, your contribution will be crucial for the business’ financial performance.

PADF pre-funded this request up to 25%.

loans.use: to purchase 31 sacks of food products.

loans.name: Kholjamol

texts.en:
Kholjamol is 44 years old and lives in Vakhsh district. She has three children; they are studying in high school. Her husband is a craftsman.

Kholjamol is engaged in livestock. In this activity, she has ten years of experience. She learned it from her parents. In this industry, her son and husband help her. She is a very kind and hardworking woman.

Now she wants to increase the count of livestock and improve her family’s income. It is the main income of the family. She hopes for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase several head of cattle.

loans.name: Chitra

texts.en:
Chitra is a 22-year-old security guard at a microfinance institution who resides in the Takeo province in Cambodia. Previously, he worked as a credit officer at another microfinance institution, but then he stopped because his workplace was far from his university. As a security guard, he can make about USD 4.33 a day. 

Now Chitra would like a loan to pay his university fees for the second semester of his third year and first semester of his fourth year. He will be able to graduate with this loan. His dream is to have a good position with a reasonable salary in the microfinance institution. He also wants to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products for making meals to sell.

loans.name: Barohat

texts.en: Barohat is a purposeful woman. She was born in 1982. She lives in a rural area. She is a widow. She has one child. For about ten years she has had a business. Barohat works at a kindergarten. She is an educator helper. As she raises her son alone, it is hard for her to keep her family and house. She tries her best to have time at home and at work. Barohat is a good helper. She is a hardworking, intelligent, honest woman and mom. She is planning to make better conditions at her apartment to live. She wants to renovate her apartment. Barohat is asking for financial support to buy building materials to renovate her apartment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her apartment.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1980. She lives in a village. She is divorced. She has one child. She works at a restaurant. She is a waiter. She has lived with her parents after her divorce. In order to have good conditions for living and feeding she works hard. She is planning to make good conditions for her parents also. She needs to send her father abroad to work. She wants to buy a ticket for her dad. Umeda is seeking financial support to buy a ticket.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for her father.

loans.name: Nụ

texts.en:
Mr Nụ works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture. He is 26 years old, and he is married with two children. Nụ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nụ has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Nụ faces in his life is not having hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Nụ hopes to build a new house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dates to resell at his stall to resell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 36 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion,Iloilo. She earns a living through retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.Sonia has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Sonia is requesting to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice ,soft drinks, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods, condiments among others. This loan will enable Sonia to augment her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Sonia hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: n to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice ,soft drinks, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods, condiments among others

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.en:
Olimpio, 65 years old, is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. He has been engaged in a hog raising business for 10 years. Olimpio is married and has four grown children. 

Olimpio has requested a loan to buy piglets and to purchase materials for renovating the pig pen. Building a new shelter will help improve his way of raising pigs. These changes will slowly enable Olimpio and his family to gain higher earnings and to settle his obligations. He could now roll back his capital to any possible business ventures to augment his daily income. Olimpio is determined to expand his current source of income to become more sustainable in the near future and to set aside some savings for emergency use.

loans.use: to buy piglets and to purchase materials for renovating the pig pen

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
In 2012, Josette had her first loan from PMPC. She is from Southern Poblacion, Plaridel in the Philippines. Josette is 40 years old and is married. She and her husband helping each other to raise their family,. They were stretching their resources to sustain the family's needs and especially to pay for the education of her children. 

Josette came up with the idea of starting a business, since she has had the skills to bake delicious cakes - but she had no starting capital. She joined PMPC after hearing that she could avail herself of financial assistance. Josette applied for a loan to start her cake baking business and it's been doing well for more than 2  years. 

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers. And she has planned to use her additional revenue for her increasing orders. Josette is thankful for the financing she gets for her capital needs. In addition, she wanted to expand and improve her business and hopes to open a cake house near the town.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers.

location.town: Plaridel - So. Pob. Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods like canned goods, noodles, soap, seasonings, powdered juice, chips, biscuits and beverages. She is a 62-year-old married woman with three grown children from Mayorga, Leyte.

She is asking for a loan to purchase assorted goods like eggs, noodles, condiments, and toiletries.  With these stocks, she can now sell and display  a variety of goods. It will surely attract more buyers. She can now start to gain a higher income and start to settle her obligations. She can now provide a healthy diet that is useful in her day to day activities.

Verginia hopes that she can properly manage her source of income successfully.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods like eggs, noodles, condiments, and toiletries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna  earns a living by producing and selling home-made ice cream. She sells it to the local people in her community. She is a married woman with eight children. Six of them are still attending school. She has been engaged in making ice cream for almost ten years already. She is need of capital to continue to finance her current business.

Myrna has requested  a loan to buy more ingredients like sugar, various flavorings, ice cream cones and many others. These ingredients will be used in making home-made ice cream. Then she can prepare a variety of flavors with respect to the various taste and preferences of her customers. She can then start to earn more and pay her dues.

In the future, Myrna would like to expand her business to become more sustainable and so she could also support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like sugar, various flavorings, ice cream cones and many others

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, 59 years old, is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is a married woman with eight children. All are grown and the youngest is 18 years old. Vilma has been engaged in the rice retail business for several years now. Vilma is standing next to sacks of rice. She also invests in potpot (a bicycle with an attached sidecar and third wheel, for transporting passenger). Vilma is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more rice to sell to her customers.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to maximize her profit. In the future, she plans to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing, and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. Luzminda has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has been a babysitter of her own grandson, since the mother of the child is working abroad as a domestic helper to support their whole family.

Carmelita is now supervising the renovation of their home with the help of her daughter. She hopes to live comfortably with a house that has good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 50,000.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. As a matter of fact, Carmelita has been given priority as a regular and active member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, that all of her financing needs have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 52 years old and married. She is from Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Evangeline has operated a snack vending business for five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of activity. This is how she helps her husband in sustaining the needs of their family. Evangeline wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase nails, lumber, and plywood for house repair. Evangeline has became an active member of PMPC in 2012. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for house repair

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryl has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from basket weaving.

Guillerma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the completion of maintenance and update process for the laundry service for increased profit for this year.

loans.name: Mayla

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mayla works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening. Mayla is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mayla has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Margalita

texts.en: Margalita is a 47-year-old woman from Persati, a small village. She lives with her husband and both are involved in a small agricultural business. The income is very low for covering even basic needs. Margalita wants to generate more income for her family's welfare and start an additional activity. As the business she plans to start will be the only one in this area and the demand will be high, Margarita requested a loan to start it. Margalita requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a manufacturing business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Margarita's loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Margalita will purchase all merchandise and tools for a wood workshop and will open locally. Her husband will help her for leading the new business. They will get private orders and will make good profits. Margalita and her husband rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to open a wood workshop and make a stable source of income.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a young woman, 38 years old, from Ozurgeti district. She has a 7-member family, and they don't have any significant income. The family has been designated as "subsistence poor" and are living with poverty. They get social assistance from the local government. Apart from this, they have a small agricultural enterprise: they own a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees and citrus. 

Irma has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare, and to somehow increase their income. Irma requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products.

Irma plans to purchase clothing and resell it among her villagers and neighbors. The loan will greatly assist Irma and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a young woman, 34 years old, from Akhmeta district. She lives with her husband and 2 school-aged children. The family is in the "subsistence poor" category and are living with poverty. They get social assistance from the local government. Apart from this, they have a small agricultural enterprise: they own 8 sheep and 11 goats and they sell cheese at the local market. 

Natela has a great desire to expand the business and to somehow increase their income. Natela requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products. 

With the received credit, she will purchase additional sheep and will expand her livestock. She will be able to produce more cheese. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and she and her family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to expand the business and increase her family income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old  Salah, a single man, living with his family in a rented house in Hodeidah city, Yemen. He is a university graduate, but he couldn't find a job in order to look after his family. Salah lives with his family in a very miserable condition, but as any young man, he didn't give up. He decided to start his own business- purchasing a minibus to work on to earn money. As a sole source of income for Salah and his family, he works on the bus 17 hours daily, Sunday to Sunday. He spends most of his time in this business. Unfortunately the bus is broken down and doesn't work well. Now it needs repair and maintenance, but most of what he earns of money from the bus goes to cover the daily needs of the family and is not enough to make the necessary repair for the bus. For this reason, Salah is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase spare parts for the bus.

Salah looks forward to purchasing a new bus that will help him in improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the bus.

loans.name: Maa Kalhuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Santilata, the lady standing second from left in the first row is a 50-year-old lady who lost her husband in 2004. Since then, she has taken on all the burdens of her family. She lives with her daughter, age 23, and her son, age 20. After her husband passed away, she became involved in an agriculture activity. This is not sufficient to manage her family, so she purchased a cow. Now she is taking care of her cow and selling milk in the local market. From this business, she earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR per month. She wants to purchase one more cow and continue her milk business. She has one year of experience in this field and she has time to take care of the cow. 

Santilata, along with her group, requested a loan of 165,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows. She says that this business can strengthen her economic condition and she can pay her children's tuition. She has a dream of educating her children so they can earn for themselves in the future. She does not want her children to face the same kinds of problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man with four children, living with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. Ali has studied until the secondary education but couldn't complete his study. His wife works as a housewife and he works with a daily wage which is not fixed. His house lacks a lot of the necessary home appliances and he doesn't have enough money to purchase them. For this reason, he asked for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary home appliances such as an oven for the kitchen.

Ali hopes to renovate his house and rent part of it.

loans.use: to purchase some of the necessary home appliances such as an oven for the kitchen.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is 54-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her son has been running a general store for many years. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Zarina's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items, for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Zarina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and also will help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Zarina is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Nadeang Group

texts.en:
Khun's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Khun’s, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Khun is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter.  Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases.  The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Khun due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, decreased time spent foraging for wood, and by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.  The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mary. She is married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise management. 

Mary does both poultry and vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing money from Kiva to buy hybrid vegetable seeds. This will help boost her farm output, thus allowing her to supply more vegetables to the local market. This will ensure she maintains a consistent supply to the market leading to stable income. She plans to use the anticipated income to support her children education.

Mary is happy with Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds that will boost output.

loans.name: Nhóm 29-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung, 47, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about VND 740,000. She is married with 3 children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2007.

Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation and they don't have a sanitary latrine yet. With this loan, she will use the funds to build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for her family members and contribute to the sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, Nhung is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 1 - Định Hóa 01 Group

texts.en: Thuan, pictured second from the right in the first row, works as a farmer. She has two grown children; one is married and one not, and both are still living with her. Her family does not have a hygienic latrine due to economic hardship. With this VND 8 million loan, she will have a sanitary toilet installed in her home. This will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement of her community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Gyon Hnyin Tan Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Gyon Hnyin Tan Village in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region of Myanmar. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of sixteen village customers (eight males and eight females). This loan will help some group members purchase ducks (costing $40 for 100 ducks), boosting villager's income through an increase in duck eggs. Other group members will use the funds to buy high quality feed (costing $36 for four days feed to 100 ducks). 

Gyon Hnyin Tan Village has over 1,600 villagers and most men focus on farming. Villagers also plant different kinds of flowers that are imported to the city. For additional income, they also raise pigs, ducks and chickens.

The above photo shows four CBO members and a village customer, named as U Khin, U Naing, U Kyi, U Sein and Daw Ohmar. Included in the picture, U Khin, (Second from Right) is 51 years old and married with a daughter. He farms on his six acre farm and also has a pig and several chickens.  Like his fellow group members, the loan will enable U Khin to purchase ducks.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married. He has a son. Vitaliy has his own business.

Vitaliy has small tractor. He digs trenches for other people. Vitaliy is a hard working person. In the future he wants to buy another tractor.

Vitaliy is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to buy equipment for his tractor (a bucket).

loans.use: to buy equipment for his tractor (a bucket) and offer additional services.

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en: Luaupu is 36 years old with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Luaupu has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a forty-five-year-old married Palestinian mother of five children who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, she opened a clothes shop seven years ago. The aim of this shop was to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Mervat is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business and improve her children's living conditions. As a result, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of winter clothes as she wants to help her son develop his own business but they didn't decide the type of the business yet. Mervat hopes to expand her business more in the future as she will always try in all ways to help her children improve their living conditions and succeed in their lives.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new collection of winter clothes as she wants to help her son develop his own business

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Trying new types of businesses in agriculture proven to increase revenue, while still running a pig-raising business- this happens in the Sari Maju group. Six months ago they tried to start a business in agriculture and 2 members successfully improved their quality of life and decided to start a business with its own capital after they paid all their loans.

Now the rainy season starts and the Sari Maju group resume lending to expand their business in agriculture. These loans are used for land preparation costs, buying fertilizer, seeds and agricultural tools. Ni Komang managed to sell her agricultural products, chilies and beans, at a satisfactory price. The cacao tree also began to grow healthy, resistant to disease and bear much fruit. Current loans are used to buy fertilizer, corn seed and agricultural equipment. Due to the rainy season, Ni Komang chose to plant corn. Ni Komang hopes to get maximum results and be able to independently raise capital for business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and agricultural equipment

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 30-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah who appears in the photo above.  He lives with his family in a humble house. He is an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. Mostafa would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the items they need.

Mostafa took out a USD Murabaha loan (a type of Islamic financing) from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. Consequently, it will decrease the family's electricity usage.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese.

loans.name: Manuel Felipe

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El  socio Manuel  sigue trabajando para una institución pública, el  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, a la vez el socio continua con su negocio de compra y  venta de repuestos para autos, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas, faros  y otros.
texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Comuzone II” which is located in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Manuel continues to work for a public institution. He appreciates the support that he has been given and promises to complete his loan payments in a disciplined manner. Manuel also continue to manage his business of buying and selling auto parts. He wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of tires, headlights, and other products.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlights, and other products.

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh, 32, is a married man from Kampong Speu Province. He has three children who are currently in school. He is a construction worker with a daily income of $6.50. So far, he has been in this career for ten years. His wife Nim, 27, is a rice farmer with a daily earnings of $3.00. 

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, he has applied for a Kiva loan via Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to pay for his house renovation. He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation

loans.name: Jiguene Bakhna 45 Group

texts.fr: JIGUENE BAKHNA 45 est un groupement de personnes qui est composé de 3 femmes et un homme. Ils habitent tous dans le même quartier et font pratiquement les mêmes activités. La présidente s’appelle Aïssatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des poulets. Elle pratique l’aviculture et demande ce crédit pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment de volaille. Elle est reconnue par la main levée sur la photo. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans. Elle souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus en diversifier ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jiguene Bakhna 45 is a group of 3 women and 1 man. They all live in the same area and work in the same business. 

The president of the group is named Aïssatou and she has her hand raised in the photo. She is married and a mother of a family. She works selling chickens. She starts her day at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m.

Aïssatou raises the chickens and is seeking a loan to buy chicks and feed. 

She helps her husband to take care of the everyday expenses and their children's school fees. In the future, she wishes to increase her revenue and diversify her business. She'd also like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed
